loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Haruna is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices after harvest.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a maize farmer from Furana village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shehu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to generate cash for his immediate needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Shehu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes in general

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines, fabric and thread

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Jonathan, Isah and Salamatu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  Ibrahim  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices after harvest.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en:
Valbona is a 30-year-old villager who wants to repair her animal stable. She is married and has three children, 13, 7 and 3 years old. Her immediate family includes her husband’s elderly parents who receive their retirement pension. 
Raising livestock is what Valbona has been doing since she got married. She currently has one dairy cow, two sows and 20 chickens. She sells raw milk, one baby calf a year, eggs and also piglets. While she does all her livestock activity, her husband works with stone making gravestones, tables etc.

loans.use: to repair a damaged stable  for her animals

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Samsin, Hassan, and Asabe.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Ibrahim spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahaya Lado

texts.en: Yahaya Lado is a maize farmer from Galadima village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya Lado would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya Lado can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya Lado, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 12, 25 y 30 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, sincera, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa el Carmen’ un área caracterizada por la estación de buses con dirección al norte del departamento. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura aproximada entre 8-16 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Simona es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a sus 3 hijos que son independientes y es separada de su esposo, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; plato paceño (choclo, queso, habas y papas), ají de papa lisa (papa lisa, arroz, ají), Anticucho (corazón de res a la brasa), Chairo (sopa de chuño), fricasé (sopa de cerdo picante), y otros. Su inicio fue al observar que por su barrio no existía dónde comer, observo que estaban construyendo una terminal de buses, entonces comenzó su emprendimiento, poco a poco se fue acabando su comida y cada día debía preparar más; “a mis caseros les gusta como cocino y la comida se me acaba rápido porque no tengo como guardar los alimentos…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar y diversificar su negocio para favorecer con mayor atención a sus clientes. Ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora de alimentos para tener alimentos frescos para preparar la comida diaria. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Simona solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora para tener alimentos frescos para cocinar en mayor cantidad.
texts.en: Simona is a 46 year old woman. She is married and has three children, ages 12, 25 and 30. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good mother, honest, generous, understanding, patient, responsible and hardworking. She has her business in the area of  ‘villa el Carmen, an area characterized by the bus station with buses going North of the region. The weather is cold and dry, with temperatures of 8-16 degrees Celsius during the whole year. Simona is dark skinned, short, and has long black braided hair. She wears traditional dress (hat, shawl and skirt). Her native language is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish for commerce. She spends her life together with her 3 children, who are independent. She is separated from her husband. They live in a rented house that has drinking water and electricity. Her business is selling traditional food such as: plato paceño (dish from La Paz), made of corn, cheese, lima beans and potatoes; aji de papa lisa (potatoes, rice and chili, aji); Anticucho (grilled beef heart); Chairo (dry potato soup); fricase (spicy pork soup), and others. She started her business by observing that in her neighborhood there was no place to eat. She saw that they were building a bus terminal, and this is how she started her business. Little by little her food was running out and each day she needed to prepare more. "My set customers like how I cook and the food ran out quickly because I do not have a place to store the food", she comments. Her dream is to broaden and diversify her business in order to satisfy her customers better. She wants to invest in her business by buying a freezer in order to have fresh food ingredients to prepare the daily food. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in 10 years that she has been working in this job. These are the reasons why Simona is requesting a loan in order to buy a freezer to have fresh ingredients to cook in larger amounts.

loans.use: to buy a freezer in order to have fresh ingredients to cook in larger amounts.

loans.name: Martha Dilay

texts.es:
Martha ha tenido que soportar el duro verdugo del desplazamiento a causa de la violencia, ella vivía en San Carlos y se vio en la obligación de trasladarse hasta La Dorada en busca de una nueva oportunidad de vida para ella y sus hijos lejos de la violencia, la sangre y las balas.

Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo helados caseros, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para sus hijos.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una planta para el mantenimiento de su carrito de helados.

Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Hoy en día es una mujer fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Martha has had to bear the hard executioner of violence-related displacement. She lived in San Carlos and saw the obligation to move to La Dorada in search of a new life opportunity for herself and her children, away from violence, blood and bullets.

She currently lives in a humble house and makes a living selling homemade ice cream, an activity that she learned empirically, eager to obtain the livelihood of her children.

She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of a power plant to maintain her ice cream cart. With this loan she will be able to offer her products and improve her sales considerably.

She is now a strong woman with a great entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy a power plant to maintain her ice cream cart

loans.name: Sara Janeth

texts.es: Sara es una señora de 46 años de edad, son 15 años que se divorcio de su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y demás productos de revista, Sara vive con sus 3 hijos de los que uno asiste al colegio, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y en demás productos de revista, la aspiración de Sara es que se incrementen sus ventas y que seguir dando el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en: Sara is a 46 year old woman. It has been 15 years since she divorced her husband. She works selling cosmetics and other products by catalog. Sara lives with her 3 children, of which one of them attends school. She will invest the loan buying cosmetics and other catalog products. Sara's dream is to increase her sales and be able to keep giving her son an education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Oliva Esperanza

texts.es: A sus 52 años de edad Oliva se dedica a la venta de edredones que los ofrece a sus amigas, familiares y otras clientas, el crédito lo necesita para comprar edredones y cobijas, de sus 3 hijos solo uno de ellos vive con ella y esta estudiando, la aspiración de Oliva a mejorar sus ventas para tener los suficientes ingresos para mantener su hogar.
texts.en: Oliva, 52 years of age, makes her living by selling quilts to her friends, relatives, and other customers. She needs the loan to purchase quilts and blankets. Of her three children, only one, who is currently a student, lives with her. Oliva's goal is to improve her sales in order to have sufficient income to provide for her household.

loans.use: to purchase quilts

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Maritza, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de su hijo, vive en el municipio de Puerto Boyacá, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en su casa.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Maritza ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas, ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hard-working is Maritza, a warrior woman who has dedicated a great part of her life to the care of her son. She lives in the Puerto Boyacá municipality, where she makes a living preparing varied foods, such as lunches and breakfasts in a small restaurant located in her house. Her dishes are known by the neighbours of the sector, who visit her restaurant since they know that they will be able to eat deliciously.

Maritza has decided to improve her business and increase her sales, and so she is requesting a loan to buy chairs, tables, ingredients and supplies for her recipes. This loan will permit her to get her business ahead, and so to obtain the necessary income that will give her opportunity to continue supporting her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and makes her dreams a reality!

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, ingredients and supplies for her recipes

loans.name: Blanca Regina

texts.es:
Blanca es una bella mujer de 49 años de edad, soltera, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para realizar algunas mejoras locativas de ampliación e instalación de un lavacabezas en su negocio.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Realiza un préstamo para que la vida de Blanca Sea mucho mejor en su negocio!
texts.en:
Blanca is a beautiful woman of 49 years, single, and raised with very good manners.  Ever since she was in school, she developed a great passion and love for everything related to beauty.  

She started out taking courses and trainings and then one day ventured and decided to go in search of her own clientele, setting up a beauty salon business in her home.  

She is asking for a loan to make some renovations and install shampoo chairs in her business.  

The loan is very important since she will finish establishing her business complete with all the necessary inputs to operate and offer any service that is requested by customers.

Make a loan so that Blanca's life is much better in her business!

loans.use: to make some renovations and install shampoo chairs in her business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad es una persona mayor, de estado civil soltera y a su cargo tiene dos dependientes económicos que son sus propios hijos que está estudiando, el menor alcanzo estudiar solo hasta el nivel primario por falta de recursos, su actividad principal es la agricultura, produce papa, haba y otros productos, en la misma zona tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas que son como 6 Has en los dos comunidades, actualmente tiene su propia casa rustica. Ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de vacas (yuntas) porque el precio del ganado esta barato y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para después del engorde venderlos a un precio más alto, de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos y por lo tanto la calidad de vida  de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad is an older person, single and has two economic dependants who are her own sons and are studying. The youngest managed to study only up to elementary school due to a lack of resources. Her main activity is agriculture, producing potatoes, beans and other products. In the same area as her  6 hectares of agricultural land in two communities, she currently has her own rustic house.

She now has the necessity to request a loan to buy a pair of cows, as the price of cattle is low and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity, so that after they are fattened, she can sell them at a higher price. In this way she will improve her income and thus the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy a pair of cows as the price of cattle is low and she wishes to take advantage of that opportunity

loans.name: Al Fares Group

texts.en:
Afaf is the featured borrower for AL Fares Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Afaf is a 25-year-old married Syrian mother of five children. Due to the low social and financial situation of her husband, she started working two years ago in agriculture to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. 

Today, Afaf is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through investing in agricultural land which will increase her production and satisfy her customers, as she wants to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Afaf is the first lady on the right of the photo. With respect to the other group members, Elham is the lady standing, and Hanan is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural land so she can pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Usman is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children, Halima, Ummalkairi and Kabiru, are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, all of whom go to school. She is also looking after three nieces.

Victo has been selling clothes at retail and wholesale, door-to-door, in the market and from home. For ten years, depending on circumstances, she has been working seven days a week. She also earns money by selling water.

Victo has requested for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to be able to stock more skirts, blouses, and dresses to sell. 

Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to become an importer of both new and second-hand clothes. She joined MCDT SACCO because of the good customer care. 

Victo stays in her house, with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include electric power, food, and fees.

loans.use: to buy more skirts, blouses, and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz cuenta con una experiencia de 20 años en la actividad de la confección, tiene su taller de confección a terceros en su casa desde hace 14 años. 

Trabaja durante todo el día y con su taller desea generar empleo para personas con muchas necesidades. 

Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó desde muy pequeña. La ventaja es que ya tiene reconocimiento en el sector y la calidad de sus productos es muy buena, lo que le ha permitido cada vez conseguir más clientes para su negocio y también se ha transformado en buenos pedidos. 

Debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción no alcanza para satisfacer a todos sus clientes, Luz requiere de un préstamo para comprar una máquina fileteadora para aumentar la capacidad de producción de su negocio e insumos de confeccion.

Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante con su taller de confección y poder tener en su hogar unas mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Luz has 20 years of experience in making clothes, she has had her wholesale clothes making workshop in her home for 14 years. 

She works all day and with her workshop she wants to create jobs for people with lots of needs.

She learned to make clothes from her mother who taught her from a young age. The advantage she has it that she already has recognition in the sector and the quality of her products is very good. This has allowed her to get more and more customers for her business and that has also meant good orders.

Because her current production capacity is not sufficient to satisfy all of her customers, Luz requires a loan to buy a serger sewing machine in order to increase the production of her business and to buy supplies for making clothes. 

Her biggest wish is to move ahead with her clothes making business and to be able to have better economic opportunities for her family in order to progress along with her husband and 3 children.

Lend and support today, go for it!

loans.use: to buy a serger sewing machine to increase production capacity.

loans.name: Khursan

texts.ru: Хурсан пожилая жительница района Кубадиён, которой исполнилось в этом году 66 лет. Несмотря на свой возраст Хурсан ведет активную жизнь и занимается животноводством. Она разводит мелкорогатых скотин вот уже 3 года. Муж и дети помогают ей вести этот бизнес, так как это их семейный бизнес. Хурсан нравится ухаживать за скотами и делает это каждый день сама. Целью запрашиваемогог кредита является увеличение погловья скота. Хурсан на сумму кредита хочет купить пару овец и увеличить таким образом семейный бюджет. Этот кредит важен ей.
texts.en:
Khursan is an elderly resident of the Qubadiyon region. She turned 66 years old this year. Despite her age, Khursan leads an active life and works with livestock breeding. She has been breeding sheep and goats for three years already. Her husband and children help her manage this business, as it is their family business. 

Khursan likes to care for the livestock and does so every day. The goal of requesting a loan is to increase the number of livestock. Khursan would like to purchase two sheep for the loan amount, and this way increase the family budget. This loan is important to her.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Samson, Moses, and Ishaku.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yakubu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан, 47 лет, замужем и имеет 6 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода своей семьи, Токтокан занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 26 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан, на сегодня в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 15 коз, что приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтокан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Токтокан является лидером группы "Эки Орук", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы накопить на постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Toktokan is 47 years old, married, and has six children. As a main source of income for her family, Toktokan works with livestock breeding, after having started this business 26 years ago. Thanks to Toktokan's persistent work, her farm currently has four cows and 15 goats, which brings her a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Toktokan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) to purchase ten sheep. Toktokan is the leader of the group "Eki Oruk", which in addition to her consists of two other people. It is only the three of them. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving the business, in order to save money for building a large livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Kasyoka

texts.en:
Kasyoka is a single mother of 11 children. She grew up and stays in Mukuru kwa Ruben, where she owns several units of houses.

She saw the challenge of sanitation in her plots and embarked on a mission to install a Freshlife toilet in each of her plots. This is her second Freshlife toilet, and she would like to raise funds to pay for it and then pay back in installments, as she did before.

loans.use: to pay for one Freshlife toilet.

loans.name: Yina Tatiana

texts.es:
Yina, con 21 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 1 hijo. Se caracteriza por ser una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, una visionaria y buena negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo medicamentos en su propia droguería y desde hace 1 año tiene este negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Yina acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido de medicamentos en general. 

Yina es una mujer muy organizada y le gusta ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos de diversos lugares del país,  se siente a gusto cuando visitan su droguería ya que tiene un ambiente bello y muy agradable.  

La suma de todo estos esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente y sin mayores inconvenientes.  

Haz que los sueños de Yina Se hagan realidad con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Yina, 21 years of age, is a single mother with one child. She is a very responsible and hard-working young woman, a visionary, and a good businesswoman. 

She has always worked as a shopkeeper, selling medicine in her own drugstore, which she has had for a year. She has been able to overcome difficult times in the business. Her dream is to buy her own house and to build a lasting business. It is for this reason that Yina requests this loan, with which she will purchase medicine.

Yina is a very organized woman who likes to offer her clients a wide selection of products from various areas of the country. She feels at ease when they visit her drugstore, as it has a very pleasing atmosphere. 

Her efforts give her whole family an excellent quality of life, without major problems. 

Make Yina's dreams come true today with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase general medicine as stock

loans.name: Gloria Judith

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Gloria montó su taller de confección con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo. 

La actividad la aprendió realizando algunos cursos y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 

Con sus trabajos, Gloria ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Gloria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una maquina plana.

Gloria espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 

Además, Gloria espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales. 

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Gloria!
texts.en:
Without much capital, Gloria started her sewing workshop with the aim of generating income with which to pay the household expenses. She lives with her husband and her 3 children. She learned the business taking a few courses which allows her to do work that is of good quality and delivered on time. With her work Gloria has managed to gain a good number of clients which guarantees her good monthly sales.

Gloria is looking for a loan that allows her to buy a straight stitch sewing machine. Gloria hopes that doing this will allow the family better income which would permit a higher quality of living and better education. Also Gloria hopes that her business continues to grow at a good pace and that her workshop can generate at least employment for one person that needs a job and doesn't have an opportunity to work. Let's go and make a loan to Gloria!

loans.use: to buy a straight stitch sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Carlos Norberto

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, reside en un sector de Cofradía, municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Hace 20 años que Carlos se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía, fabrica alcansillas y todo tipo de adornos de pared, para decoración de salas, comedor, porche, patios etc. Este producto es elaborado a base de barro o arcilla y es decorado con pinturas especiales y este producto lo vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando el quinto ciclo de prestamo a la institución y es por 11,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar barro y pinturas para la elaboración de su producto y poder mantener mejor producción de calidad par el cliente. Su plan es seguir mejorando y vender en otros departamentos del país.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old, married with four kids and lives in Cofradía, in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. 

For 20 years Carlos has made a living through the creation of handicrafts. He makes piggybanks and all kinds of wall mounts to decorate living rooms, kitchens, porches, patios etc. He makes his products from clay or mud, which he decorates with special paint and sells in the local market.  

He is asking the institution for 11,000 Honduran Lempiras for the fifth cycle of the loan, with which he will buy clay and paint to create his crafts and be able to maintain a high level of quality for his customers. His plan is to keep improving and sell in other departments in the country.

loans.use: to buy clay and paint to create his handicrafts

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Mary, Annah and Benjamin. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Rahila spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Идигул. Идигулу 36 лет. Она разведена с мужем, и пока что живет вместе с родителями и братом. Она работает в сфере торговли овощей. Торговой деятельностью она занята уже 3 года. За столько времени Идигул освоила свою работу на отлично, и знает все тонкости своей деятельности. Теперь она считает, что пришло время для расширения бизнеса. Сейчас многие жители закупают овощи для запаса на зиму. И Идигул просит кредит для купли большого количества овощей для перепродажи. На данный момент сезон ее работы и Идигул не хочет упускать шанс для получения большого дохода. 
  Также Идигулу хотелось бы работать в сфере выпечки лепешек. Она строит планы построить пекарню. Но пока она решила остаться в торговом бизнесе.
texts.en:
This is Idigul. She is 36 years old. Idigul is divorced from her husband, and for the time being she lives with her parents and brother. She works with vegetable sales. She has had this retail business for three years already. In this time, Idigul mastered her job perfectly, and knows all tricks of the trade. 

Idigul thinks that the time has come to expand the business. Currently, many residents are purchasing vegetables for their winter stock. Idigul requests a loan to purchase a large number of vegetables for selling. This is the main season of her work, and Idigul would not like to miss the chance of getting a good income. 

Idigul would also like to work with baking flatbread. She is making plans of building a bakery. However, she has decided to remain in the retail business for now.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and expand her retail business

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a maize farmer from Dogon Fako village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. 
Abdu will use this loan to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.
With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Abdu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a maize farmer from Chino village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. Hussaini will use this loan to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.
With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hussaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Hussaini, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a maize farmer from Tajiri village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. Ahmed will use this loan to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.
With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ahmed, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Matiyu

texts.en:
Matiyu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Matiyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Matiyu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Matiyu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 31-year-old married mother of three children. She is a Palestinian refugee who has been working hard for six years developing her clothes and shoe shop inside a Palestinian refugee camp.

Today Ibtissam is acquiring a 2,000 USD loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to acquire a new collection of winter clothes and shoes for the coming Christmas season. This loan will provide her with a wide range of items that will help her attract more customers and satisfy their needs.

Ibtissam is working towards expanding her business and increasing her income so as to improve her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to acquire a new collection of winter clothes and shoes for the coming Christmas season.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 34-year-old single lady who started selling and renting wedding and engagement dresses to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of four members.

She is a hard worker and motivated lady. In order to develop her business, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of winter dresses to satisfy her customers' needs in the upcoming Christmas season.

Amal hopes to expand her business further in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new collection of winter dresses to sell

loans.name: Lina Patricia

texts.es:
Lina, de 26 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios. Algunas de sus más grandes dificultades son el alto costo de la mercancía y la competencia del sector.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Lina is 26 and has a very good idea of what she wants in life, She is determined to finish her studies to get ahead and have a good life. She works as a vendor of a variety of merchandise like clothing, accessories, wallets and some cosmetics amongst others.

She started this business in the effort to find the needed resources to sustain her and to pay for her studies. One of her greatest challenges is the high cost of the merchandise and the competition in the sector. She is an enterprising woman and very disciplined.

She is requesting a loan to by a large assortment of merchandise and in this way have stock available to sell to her clients. She hopes to be able to progress as a businessperson and have more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a large assortment of merchandise like clothing, accessories and cosmetics.

loans.name: Keny Elizabeth

texts.es: A sus 39 años de edad Keny es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, la edad de sus hijos es de 6, 8 y 19 años mismos que están estudiando,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que la ofrece a sus amigas, vecinas y clientas que le adquieren su ropa, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para variar mas su mercadería, lo que Keny espera de este negocio es seguir trabajando duro para el bienestar de sus hijos,
texts.en:
39-year-old Keny is a single mother who has three children ages six, eight, and nineteen who are all in school. She sells clothing for a living to her friends, neighbors, and customers. 

She will use the loan to buy clothing for a wider variety of merchandise. Keny hopes to continue working hard in this business for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mayimuna

texts.en:
Mayimuna lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with seven children, all of whom are attending school. Other than her children, she is not looking after other family members. Mayimuna lives in her house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

Mayimuna has been selling secondhand shoes in the market at retail in the last four years, working six days a week. She also sells tomatoes and vegetables to supplement that income. She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to restock more secondhand shoes for sale. 

Her business challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to upgrade to a direct importer and wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the customer care.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She is also looking after her brothers` children. 

She has been selling big yellow bananas and green bananas at retail in the market for the last eleven years, working six days a week. She also gets income from rental houses and also works a division councilor.

Eva has requested a loan of Ugshs 1,300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more big and small yellow bananas for sale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to be able to become a farmer and supplier of yellow bananas in a busy trading center. She joined MCDT because staff members pay attention to members and they are accommodating.

Eva lives in her house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school dues.

loans.use: To buy more big and small yellow bananas and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 2 hijos y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposo y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de artículos navideños, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Adriana manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Adriana has been a very dedicated housewife, always attentive to the care of her family, made up of her 2 children and her husband. She has always wanted to work as an independent businesswoman. She began to sell goods 5 years ago as she is responsible for the economic support of their household along with her husband, and she needs to generate the resources to cover these.

Her customers are neighbours, relations and friends from the local area. She works in her business every day. She finds that this work has the advantage of being able to take care of her family at the same time as she can be productive as a saleswoman.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy wholesale a variety of Christmas items. This time of year is a great opportunity, and this will allow her to be able to stock up a greater variety of products to satisfy the demand that increases in the Christmas season. As a result she will obtain a better income for her family.

Adriana states that her greatest wish is to continue to support her family economically and to give education to all her children, to see them become professionals and have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale a variety of Chistmas items.

loans.name: Sa'adu

texts.en: Sa'adu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sa'adu would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sa'adu can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. When asked about his goals, Sa'adu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Habila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Philibus, Danladi, and Grace.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Habila would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Habila spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer from Gunda village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ayuba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her brother-in-law. She rents a house with access to electricity, but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has been selling charcoal from home, at retail, for the last eight years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO. The loan would enable her to stock 15 sacks of charcoal for resale. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to open other outlets, in busy trading centers near her residence. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru:
Эту пожилую женщину из района Дангара зовут Озода. Ей 59 лет. Она мать троих детей. Ее сыновьям по 32 и 26 лет, а дочери 24 года. Муж Озоды уже пенсионер, а сыновья ездят в Россию на заработки. Сама Озода занимается востребованной деятельностью - шитьем. 10 лет назад она начала свой швейный бизнес, который неустанно продолжает по сей день. Озода берет заказ на пошив женских платьев национальных фасонов. От процесса работы она не только получает прибыль, но и наслаждается.
Как видите, Озода все эти годы шила на швейной машинке старого производства. Теперь она хочет купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Для реализации этой цели она берет кредит. Озода верит в вашу поддержку и на дальнейший прогресс своей деятельности.
texts.en:
This elderly resident of the Dangara region is called Ozoda. She is 59 years old and the mother of three children. Her sons are 32 and 26 years old, and her daughter is 24. Ozoda's husband is already retired, and her sons have gone to Russia as migrant workers. 

Ozada is engaged in a popular activity - sewing. 10 years ago, she started her sewing business, which she continues tirelessly to this day. Ozoda takes orders for sewing women's national dresses. She not only gets an income from this work, but also pleasure. 

As you can see, Ozoda has been sewing on an old sewing machine for all these years. Currently she would like to purchase a new, modern sewing machine, in order to expand her business. To realize this goal, she takes a loan. Ozoda trusts in your support and in the further progress of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Bukuroshe

texts.en:
Bukuroshe wants this money to buy some equipment for her hair salon. She has been operating her salon for some time now, and it has been going well according to her.

She is 31 years old and a mother of a 6-year-old. She lives in the suburbs, a little town in northern Albania. Her husband works as a teacher, and his salary is around $480/month, while her pay varies between $100-$300/month.

The fact that they do not have any sources of income from agriculture/livestock makes it difficult, Bukuroshe said during her interview. “Our pays are just to cover food and basic things. We’ve got to buy all food items, and food is not cheap at all. Should we have a cow or a little garden here to plant some veggies for our family needs, it would be awesome.”

loans.use: to purchase some equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is involved in a retail business. She lives with her husband, her elderly retired father-in-law, and three children. Anna sells agricultural products that she purchases from nearby farmers.  

With the help of her husband, she understands the agricultural products needed in the local market. Her business is a very important source of income for their family. To continue running her retail business in a sustainable way, Anna needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase new supplies for her business (flour, barley, forage) and to pay for the renovation of the truck which helps to deliver the products to the market. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Anna has been able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments for this loan. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Anna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their business.

loans.use: to pay for new supplies (flour, barley, forage) and renovate the truck which helps to deliver the products to the market

loans.name: Shehu Juda

texts.en:
Shehu Juda is a maize farmer. Before he became a member of Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at a low price soon after harvest so he could cover his immediate cash needs. But with this 16,283 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu Juda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Shehu Juda expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to store his harvest, sell it later and make a greater profit.

loans.name: Shu'aibu

texts.en: Shu'aibu is a maize farmer from Hayin Mallam Bawa, a village in the state of Kaduna, Nigeria. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shu'aibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shu'aibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Shu'aibu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a maize farmer from Babbar Saura, a village in the state of Kaduna, Nigeria. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Garba, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmer's Organization member, Idris would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idris can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Idris is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
На фотографии Зулфия. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Зулфия вместе с семей проживает в городе Куляб. Ее дети учатся в школе, а муж занимается торговлей, как и Зулфия. Зулфия в течение 5 лет занимается продажей фруктов. Она очень любит свою работу и хочет развивать свою деятельность. 
Сейчас на ее пути подвернулись большие проблемы, которых Зулфия не может не решить и не обратить внимание. У веселой и жизнерадостной Зулфии имеются проблемы со здоровьем, и ей не хватает не большой суммы денег на лечения, и она вынуждена обратиться за кредитом. Помогите Зулфие, она надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
In the photo you see Zulfiya. She is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. Zulfiya and her family live in the city of Kulob. Her children go to school, and her husband works with sales, just like Zulfiya. For a period of five years, Zulfiya has worked with selling fruit. She loves her work very much and would like to develop her business. 

Currently some large problems have turned up on her path. Zulfiya cannot solve or ignore these problems. The merry and cheerful Zulfiya has problems with her health, and she does not have enough money for the treatment. Therefore it is necessary for her to apply for a loan. Please help Zulfiya, she puts her trust in you.

loans.use: to get treatment to restore her health

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Solicita el préstamo para comprar una cocina de plancha para preparar pupusas debido a que la actual está  muy deteriorada. Carmen espera sacar adelante a su hija dándole el estudio, y fortalecer su tienda garantizando estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
She asks for the loan to buy a griddle to prepare pupusas as the one she uses currently is greatly deteriorated.

Carmen hopes to provide for her daughter’s studies and improve her store by guaranteeing her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a griddle

loans.name: Murat

texts.en:
Murat is seeking your help to pay for his wife, Zana, to see a medical specialist. She has had four surgeries so far, yet hasn’t been feeling well at all despite these painful procedures designed to restore her health. To enable Zana to see the specialist, Murat has applied for a 110,000 ALL loan through VisionFund Albania.

Murat and Zana have three children together aged nineteen, sixteen and thirteen; the three of them are all in school. Murat works as a mechanic, while Zana has been on disability. They own some agricultural land that they have rented out to other villagers. The family lived in a village, but when Zana developed problems with her health, they moved to the city of Korca to have better access to medical care.

loans.use: pay for his wife, Zana, to see a medical specialist.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en:
This is Ndue, a villager and a married father of four, being photographed in front of the so called ‘family house.’ He has recently retired. He receives a pension, but he also works as a night man, while his wife receives a retirement pension. Note that retirement age in Albania is 65 for men and 60 for women. 

They have a dairy cow and two sheep and they sell a baby calf per year and two baby goats per year. Prior to the current location, they lived very far away in a northern, rural area where their lives were very difficult. They had extreme snow for about nine months per year, with people staying inside almost all day. There was no infrastructure, roads, electricity, etc. 

Ndue is seeking your help to make some repairs to the house.

loans.use: to make some repairs to his house.

loans.name: Daisy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daisy de 22 años de edad, está acompañada y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta bachillerato y luego dejo los estudios para trabajar y apoyar a su pareja en los gastos de la familia. Su pareja es empleado y trabaja haciendo vigilancia en una zona con el medio ambiente protegido.

Daisy tiene 2 años trabajando como secretaria de una institución gubernamental que protege el medio ambiente. Esta encargada de facilitar los trámites  para la organización y mejoramiento ambiental de su comunidad. Solicita el préstamo para hacer reparaciones al techo de su vivienda que con la pasada época lluviosa de daño y dio paso a filtraciones de agua.

Daisy sueña con tener una linda casa, por el momento no tiene hijos pero espera formar una familia.
texts.en:
Daisy is 22 years old, she has a partner and doesn't have any children. She studied to high school level and then left her studies to work and support her partner with the family expenses. Her partner is employed and works as a guard in a protected environmental area.

Daisy has worked for 2 years as a secretary in a government institution that protects the environment. She is responsible for facilitating the procedures of the organisation and the environmental improvement of her community.

She is asking for a loan to make repairs to the roof of her house that was damaged by the recent rainy period and caused water leakage.

Daisy dreams of having a pretty house, for the moment she does not have children but she hopes to have a family.

loans.use: to make repairs to the roof of her house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos; uno de 2 años y otro de 6 meses, y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ una zona agrícola que agrupa a productores campesinos de carne, verduras, granos y otros., con vendedores/distribuidores mayoristas, que se encargan de distribuir la producción en diferentes mercados de la ciudad. De clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que sobrepasa los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Esther es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos, el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor todavía es un bebé. Viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa para bebé, como; los mamelucos, playeritas, cobertores, chamarritas y otros. Su venta la realiza en un puesto fijo de venta y cuenta con clientes continuos. “la venta de ropa de bebe es un negocio constante, porque todo el tiempo nacen nuevos bebes y los padres compran todo, la ropa debe ser de algodón y con tonos suaves…” comenta. Su sueño es tener mejores ingresos económicos realizando su actividad. Ella desea surtir su negocio mediante la compra de variedad de prendas para bebé por mayor, para satisfacer a los nuevos papás. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Esther solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de bebé por mayor para satisfacer a los nuevos papás.
texts.en:
Esther is a 24 year old single woman who has 2 children; one of 2 and one of 6 years old and her business is selling clothes. She is a good mother, has an entrepreneurial spirit, is cheerful, optimistic, and happy, she has a good attitude, is responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in El Torno an agricultural area which brings together farmers who produce beef, vegetables, grains, etc. The area has a warm tropical climate with a temperature which surpasses 30 degrees Celsius throughout the whole year.

Esther is of dark complexion, has long tied up black hair, is quite short, her mother tongue is Aymara but she also speaks Spanish due to the culture and for her sales.  She lives her life together with her 2 children, her oldest son is currently studying at school and the youngest is still a baby.  They live in a rented house build of brick which has drinking water, electricity and sewage.  

She makes a living selling baby clothes like; onesies, shirts, blankets, coats and other things. She sells her merchandise in a set location where she has regular clients. "The sale of baby clothes is a constant business as new babies are always born and the parents must buy them everything, the clothes must be made of cotton and with soft tones" she mentions.  

Her dream is to increase the earnings of her business. She wants to stock up her store by buying a variety of clothes for babies in bulk to meet the needs of new parents.  This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in 2 years which is undertaking this activity. It is for this reason that Esther is requesting a loan, to buy wholesale baby clothes to meet the needs of new parents.

loans.use: to buy wholesale baby clothes to meet the needs of new parents

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan Group

texts.en:
Eight women, who live in the town of San Lucas Toliman on the shores of Lake Atitlan, have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank named “Mujeres Trabajadoras San Juan,” which means “Hardworking Women of San Juan." The ladies have already received one loan from Friendship Bridge, last April, which was funded by KIVA lenders. They report that the loan was of great benefit to them in sustaining and expanding their small businesses. They are requesting a new loan, to continue the trend.

The President of the Trust Bank is Abida, who is 35 years old and has a track record of effective leadership. She married when she was only 17 years old and has four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. Abida has two businesses, textile production and the sale of chicken. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase more chickens to fatten up, as well as the materials she needs to create more traditional textiles. She is determined to increase sales and generate more income.

Abida and her friends in the Trust Bank benefit from the educational component of the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” Program. Each month at their Trust Bank meetings, a Loan Officer from the organization shares practical information with the ladies, often in their own indigenous language. Subjects covered include business management practices including accounting, marketing, budgeting, and customer service. Other topics discussed include hygiene, health and the use of medicinal plants, and women’s rights.

Kiva lenders are much appreciated, for their generosity and kindness in funding these much-needed loans. Thank you, Kiva lenders! Gracias KIVA por contribuir.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to fatten up, and materials that she needs to create more traditional textiles.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 37-year-old Lebanese woman. She is divorced and has one child. She works as a chef on demand for people hosting special occasions. She likes her job and has been doing it for the past 8 years. She cooks delicious dishes, and feedback from the community is proof of her continuous success and potential.

With the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l., she wants to buy a new, more technologically advanced, and larger refrigerator to store the meals she cooks and to keep her dishes fresh and healthy. In the future, she plans to open a small town restaurant so she can secure a better life for her only child.

loans.use: to buy a new, more technologically advanced, and larger refrigerator

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Mahamaya, Suleiman, and Mary.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Maryamu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to eventually ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jumwa's Group

texts.en:
Jumwa is 47 years old and married. She is a Komaza tree farmer. Her spouse is a farmer as well. In addition to growing trees, Jumwa also cultivates sorghum, cassava, and ground nuts and supports her family with small scale poultry farming. 

Jumwa joined Komaza because she was influenced by the good state of the neighbors' trees. She requested a loan, which she will use to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings and pay for technical training and planting support. She will use the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate her nieces and nephews. Jumwa’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the planting of trees on her farm in anticipation of money in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob is 66 years old and widowed. He is a Komaza tree farmer. In addition to growing trees, Jacob also cultivates maize, cowpeas, cassava, and coconut trees and supports his family by working as a casual laborer at a quarry in the village. 

Jacob joined Komaza in order to get money when the trees are harvested in the future. He requested a loan, which he will use to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings and pay for technical training and planting support. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to start a poultry business. Jacob’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the watching the trees grow at a fast rate.

Jacob is the farmer with his hand raised.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Borrower Siham is 43 years old. She is a Lebanese married woman with four children. Her husband is a farmer and part-time painter. He is the main provider for the family. Siham has been a farmer for the past 10 years.

Through the loan she will obtain from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l., Siham will purchase agriculture supplies and equipment such as fertilizers and seeds. Thus, she will be able to expand her product offerings, in terms of fresh produce, and increase her sales.

She believes firmly that the future will be better for her entire family, due to her positive attitude and hard work, and especially that the chances of developing her business further look promising.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture supplies and equipment such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Famille Zairois Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de deux conjoints dont Eric assume la pleine responsabilité en tant que chef de ménage. Il a commencé ses activités il y a 10 ans grâce au champ que lui a donné son père. Au bout de 3 ans de travail, les bénéfices successifs réalisés lui ont permis d'acheter 2 autres champs, une parcelle et d'autres biens. C'est la raison qui fait à ce qu'il continue ses activités champêtres dans l'idéal d'acquérir d'autres espaces culturales et une autre parcelle afin d'assurer l'avenir de sa modeste famille; seuls les  inondations et les hippopotames peuvent constituer un obstacle à l'évolution normale de plants.Pour l'instant, ce crédit permettra à Eric de supporter la main d'oeuvre pour les premiers travaux de labour.
texts.en:
This group consists of two spouses. As the head of the household, Eric is also the group leader. He started his activities 10 years ago with a field that his father had given him. After three years of labour, the cumulative profits he earned allowed him to purchase two more fields, a piece of land and other goods. 

As a result, he is pursuing his farming activities with the goal of acquiring more farmable land, as well as one more plot to provide the future of his humble family. The only obstacles he feels may interfere with his plans are floods and hippos. 

For the time being, this loan will allow Eric to pay for the labor needed at the early stages of plowing.

loans.use: to pay for the labor needed for plowing.

loans.name: Isaac Adalberto

texts.es:
Isaac de 29 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad. Estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su pareja es ama de casa y se encarga del cuido de su hijo.

Isaac es agricultor por herencia de su padre, pero es empleado de una hacienda desde hace 3 años,  trabaja como chofer de un camión trasladando el alimento del ganado y haciendo otras actividades de la hacienda. Por las tardes sale a vender pan después de terminar su labor en la hacienda, en época lluviosa cultiva granos básicos. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta para repartir el pan, por el momento tiene que rentar una todos los días para hacer esta actividad. Tiene pensado comprar un terreno en el que construirá su propia casa para vivir con su familia luego comprar ganado para involucrarlos en actividades económicas.
texts.en:
29-year-old Isaac has a partner and a two-year-old child. He studied up until the end of the ninth grade. His partner is a housewife and is in charge of looking after their son.

Through an inheritance from his father, Isaac is a farmer, but he has been employed at a farm for three years. He works as a truck driver, transporting livestock feed and doing other work on the farm. In the afternoons after finishing work he goes out to sell bread. In the rainy season he plants staple grains.

He is requesting the loan in order to buy a motorcycle for transporting the bread. At the moment he has to rent one every day in order to go and sell his bread. He has thought about buying a plot of land where he will build his own house. He will live there with his family and then buy livestock in order to get his family involved in economic activities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting his bread

loans.name: Alh. Salisu

texts.en:
Alh. Salisu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Salisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Salisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Alh. Salisu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ada's Group

texts.en:
Ada is a member of Ada's Group and a 61-year-old, KOMAZA tree farmer. She has five children, none of whom are in school. Ada is married and her spouse is a businessman. 

In addition to growing trees, Ada also cultivates maize, cowpeas, and oranges and she supports her family with dairy and poultry farming, as well as running a posho mill business. 

She decided to join KOMAZA because the trees grow very fast compared to other types of trees and she plans to spend the money earned from the KOMAZA tree farm to invest in businesses and buy shares. 

Ada’s favorite part about working with KOMAZA is the partnership with KOMAZA and other farmers to plant trees. 

Ada is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs, such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Lillian's Group

texts.en:
Lillian is a member of Lillian's Group. She is a 40-year-old KOMAZA tree farmer with two children, both of whom are in school. She is married to a policeman. 

In addition to growing trees, Lillian also cultivates maize, cassava, and cowpeas. She decided to join KOMAZA for future benefits that will arise from tree sales and she plans to spend the money earned from the KOMAZA tree farm to pay school fees for her children and to buy a dairy cow. 

Lillian’s favorite part about working with KOMAZA is watching her neighbors' trees grow fast and healthy. Lillian is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs, such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Jherry Raul

texts.es: Jherry es un joven luchador que se encuentra estudiando una carrera técnica y a su vez trabaja en un fundo agrícola para poder solventar sus gastos ,el sueña terminar su carrera y ejercerla, su motivación para continuar con sus proyectos es su familia que dentro de sus posibilidades económicas lo han ido apoyando.Jherry se encuentra solicitando un crédito para poder financiar los tramites de su titulo ya que esta por culminar su carrera y no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes , el está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que de brindarle el crédito obtendrá su titulo , su familia se sentirá orgullaso de él, podrá ir creciendo profesionalmente y encontrara un mejor puesto de trabajo.
texts.en: Jherry is a young hard worker who is studying a technical course and, at the same time, works for an agricultural fund to be able to pay his bills. He dreams of finishing and using his course. His motivation for continuing with his projects is his family who have been supporting him within their means. Jherry is requesting a loan to be able to finance the formalities of his title since it is needed to finish his course and he doesn't have enough economic resources. He is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since by providing the loan he will obtain his title. His family will feel proud of him, he will be able to keep growing professionally and find a better job.

loans.use: to finance his title.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Habila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Habila is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Coronado

texts.en:
Coronado lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (potatoes and Coffee). Age 64 years; he is married and has five children. It is clear that Coronado works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Coronado is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Haruna expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (potatoes and Coffee). Age 62 years; he is married and has one child. It is clear that Silvestre works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, his child will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.
Silvestre is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en:
