Ikhlas is a 34-year-old Lebanese woman. She is a married with three kids in school. Her husband is employed at a contracting company and is the main provider for the family.

She runs a nursery within the confines of her home and has two years of experience in the field. Through the loan she requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she wants to purchase toys, tables, and chairs to renovate the furniture of the nursery and increase its capacity to accommodate more children.

In the future, she plans to move to a larger location and to set up a fully equipped nursery, which will inevitably reflect positively on her income and her ability to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase toys, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, invirtió el crédito anterior en mejorar el inventario de su llantería, su negocio es más rentable y cuenta con nuevos clientes. 
Con la aproximación de una temporada buena para las ventas y mayor demanda de sus servicios se siente motivado a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar llantas, neumáticos, grasa y otros repuestos para vehículos.
texts.en: Buenaventura invested the previous loan to make improvements in his tire repair business. His business is more profitable and has new clients. With the approaching good sales season and increased demand for his services, Buenaventura is motivated to apply for a new loan to buy wheels, tires, grease, and other vehicle parts.

loans.use: to buy wheels, tires, grease, and other vehicle parts.

loans.name: Adam's Group

texts.en: Adam is a thirty-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He is single, with no children. In addition to growing trees, Adam also cultivates maize, cassava, and cowpeas, and further supports his family through a motorcycle-riding business. He decided to join Komaza to get money to expand his business in future. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to build a rental house. Adam’s favorite part about working with Komaza is seeing the trees grow fast, and nearing harvest time. Adam is the farmer with his hand raised, in the picture.

loans.use: to buy tree-farm-planting inputs, such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Chitole's Group

texts.en: Chitole is a thirty-five-year-old, Komaza tree farmer. He has five children, all of whom are in school. He is married, and his spouse is a housewife. In addition to growing trees, Chitole also cultivates maize, cassava, and vegetables, and further supports his family through casual labor. He decided to join Komaza, because it is a future investment. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate his children, buy a solar panel, and a water pump. Chitole’s favorite part about working with Komaza is seeing the trees grow at a fast rate. Chitole is the farmer with his hand raised, in the picture.

loans.use: to buy tree-farm-planting inputs, such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente es un hombre muy trabajador y organizado, se gana la vida prestando el servicio de transporte de personas en su taxi a través de las calles del municipio de Sincelejo posibilitando el desplazamiento de la comunidad hasta las distintitas áreas del municipio.

Es un hombre amable, servicial y muy emprendedor, viven en unión libre con su pareja y es padre de dos hijos a los cuales siempre ha procurado ofrecerles la mejor vida posible.

Solicita un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento y reparación a su taxi ya que es su único medio de trabajo.

Con este crédito podrá mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo y podrá continuar prestando su servicio con total seguridad y sin poner en riesgo su vida ni la de sus clientes.

Apoya a Vicente con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Vicente is a very hardworking and organised man. He earns a living transporting people in his taxi around the streets of the municipality of Sincelejo, making possible the movement of local people around the different areas of the municipality.

He is a friendly, helpful and very entrepreneurial man. He lives in a common law marriage with his partner and is the father of two children, to whom he has always tried to offer the best life possible.

He is asking for a loan to maintain and repair his taxi as it is his only source of work.

With this loan he can improve the condition of his vehicle and will be able to continue offering his service in complete safety without putting his own life or that of his clients at risk.

Support Vicente with a loan today!

loans.use: to maintain and repair his taxi as it is his only means of work.

loans.name: Kiti's Group

texts.en:
Kiti is a member of Kiti's Group and a 61-year-old KOZAMA tree farmer. He has seven children, one of whom is in school. Kiti is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Kiti also cultivates maize, green grams, cowpeas, and beans and he supports his family through tapping and selling coconut wine. 

He decided to join KOMAZA because he loved the trees being grown and he plans to spend the money earned from the KOMAZA tree farm to to build a permanent house for business. 

Kiti’s favorite part about working with KOMAZA is seeing the trees grow very fast. 

Kiti is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs, such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Sada's Group

texts.en:
Sada is a member of Sada's Group and a 52-year-old KOMAZA tree farmer. She has six children, two of whom are in school. She is a widow. 

In addition to growing trees, Sada also cultivates maize, cowpeas, and green grams and she supports her family by selling coconut wine. 

Sada decided to join KOMAZA because she loves the fast-growing tree species and she plans to spend the money earned from the KOMAZA tree farm to pay school fees for her grandchildren. Sada’s favorite part about working with KOMAZA is planting the trees together with other farmers. 

Sada is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs, such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Isiyaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Obadiya, Keziya and Obida.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, at a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. When asked, Isiyaku spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, and his hope, eventually, to ensure that other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is a forty-three-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has eight children, all of whom are in school. Florence is married and her spouse is a farmer too. In addition to growing trees, Florence also cultivates maize, cassava, cowpeas and green grams (mung beans) and supports her family with farming and selling cassava.

She decided to join Komaza because it is an investment in the future. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate her children up to university level and to build a permanent family house. Florence’s favorite part about working with Komaza is watching the trees grow very fast.

Florence is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Floridalba

texts.en:
Floridalba lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. She is a farmer (corn, beans and Africam palm). Age 39 years; she is married and has two children. It is clear that Floridalba works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to do their homeworks and improve the living conditions.
Floridalba is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her business and grow her inventory.

loans.name: Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Massiel es una mujer de 34 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos de 11 y 5 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un área caracterizada porque hace 31 años que una riada arraso con todo a su paso y fue el motivo de la creación de esta ciudadela que en la actualidad se potencia como un epicentro económico para la ciudad, etnias ‘Ayoreas’ del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente se mezclan en el ambiente para volverlo multicultural y multiétnico, de clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente que ronda los 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Massiel es de tez morena, estatura alta, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (usa blusa negra), su vida la realiza con sus dos hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor está su cuidado, viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica. La necesidad por suministrar todo lo que necesita su familia la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de refrescos, librería, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de ropa, venta de pescado y servicio de construcción, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar con su s actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos; en un puesto fijo de venta que tiene en medio del mercado. La ropa que oferta es de temporada, como; pantalones, poleras, blusas, camisetas, etc., y los cosméticos de marcas como; yanbal, loreal, Avon, etc., algunos los tiene en exposición y los demás en catálogo. Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa fina y desea realizar la compra de su mercadería por mayor para surtir su negocio y estar preparada para las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Massiel solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y cosméticos por mayor para estar preparada para las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Massiel is a 34-year-old single woman with two children aged 11 and 5 years of age. Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics. She is enterprising, independent, consistent, responsible, and hardworking good mother. She does her business in the “Plan 3000” zone, an area characterized by a flood that razed everything in its path 31 years ago. The flood was the reason for creating a citadel which is the economic epicenter of the city. People from the Ayoreas ethnicity and miners from the west relocated and mix in this multicultural and multiethnic environment. The area is tropical and humid with an ambient temperature of around 30 degrees Celsius throughout the year.

Massie is of dark complexion. She is tall, has long black hair, and her mother tongue is Guaraní. She also speaks Spanish. She wears the black blouse. Her life has given her two children. The oldest studies in school and the youngest is in her care. They live in a rented house with electricity and water. The need to provide for her family led her to begin this banking group of entrepreneurs who sell soft drinks, books, fruit, tomatoes, clothing, fish, and provide construction services. They borrow to prosper in their businesses. 

Her business is selling clothing and cosmetics at a fixed stall that she has in the market. The clothing range is seasonal with pants, sweatshirts, blouses, shirts, and more. She sells cosmetics brands like Yanbal, L’Oreal, Avon, and more. She has some on display and sells others by catalog. She wants to buy wholesale merchandise for her business to prepare for this year’s holidays. This is their first sequence of loans from the institution in her 20 years of doing this work. 

It is for these reasons that Massiel is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale clothing and cosmetics to be ready for the yearend sales.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing and cosmetics to prepare for holiday sales

loans.name: Ana Ligia

texts.es:
Ana se dedica a la actividad de la confección desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, gracias a esto ha podido contribuir, junto con su esposo al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. 

Ana es madre de 1 hija a quien siempre le ha querido ofrecer todo lo necesario; debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener su hogar, Ana decidió montar un taller donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros.  

Gracias a la buena calidad de las prendas que fabrica, ha podido captar una muy buena clientela, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. 

Ana actualmente quiere aumentar la capacidad de producción de su taller con el ánimo de poder pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina de dos agujas.

Ana espera que de esta manera pueda cumplir su sueño de que su hija acceda a una educación universitaria, además, de poder mejorarle la calidad de vida a su familia. 

Ana espera que su taller aumente las ventas considerablemente y en un futuro hacerlo crecer y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Ayuda con un préstamo el taller de Ana!
texts.en:
Ana has made a living making clothes for about eight years ago. Thanks to this, she has been able to contribute, along with her husband, to pay for household expenses. Ana is the mother of one daughter, who she has always wanted to provide with everything she needs. 

Because her husband's income was not sufficient to provide for their household, Ana decided to set up a workshop making clothing for third parties. Because of the high quality of the garments she makes, she has been able to capture a good client base, allowing her to have very good sales. 

Ana currently wants to increase the production capacity of her workshop in order to be able to pay for her daughter's university education. This is why she is hoping to receive a loan that will give her the opportunity to purchase a sewing machine with two needles. Ana thus hopes to fulfill her dream of  sending her daughter to college, and improving her family's quality of life. 

Ana hopes her sales will increase considerably, so that in the future she can expand and be able to generate employment opportunities for those most in need. Help Ana's workshop with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase a two-needle sewing machine.

loans.name: Kevin's Group

texts.en: Kevin is a thirty-four year old Komaza tree farmer. He has seven children, four of whom are in school. Kevin is married, and his spouse is also a farmer. In addition to growing trees, Kevin also cultivates maize, cowpeas, cassava, and green grams. He supports his family with small scale dairy farming. Kevin decided to join Komaza to be part of the organization's vision, and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate his children, and improve his family's health. His favorite part about working with Komaza is the planting of trees on his farm. Kevin is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Marscelina's Group

texts.en: Marscelina is a fifty-one year old Komaza tree farmer. She has six children, all of whom are in school. Marscelina is married, and her spouse is a policeman. In addition to growing trees, Marscelina also cultivates cowpeas, green grams, and maize. She supports her family by selling coconut leaves (makuti) for thatching, and by farming. Marscelina decided to join Komaza as an investment in the future. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to educate her children through secondary school, and to start a family business. Marscelina’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the watching the trees grow very big so quickly. Marscelina is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Getrude's Group

texts.en: Getrude is a thirty-two-year-old, Komaza tree farmer. She has seven children, five of whom are in school. She is married, and her spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Getrude also cultivates maize, cowpeas, and cassava. She decided to join Komaza, since it is a future investment. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate her children, through high school and university. Getrude’s favorite part about working with Komaza is planting trees on her farm. Getrude is the farmer with her hand raised, in the picture.

loans.use: to buy tree-farm-planting inputs, such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is a thirty-eight-year-old, Komaza tree farmer. He has four children, two of whom are in school. Raphael is married, and his spouse is a driller in a quarry. In addition to growing trees, Raphael also cultivates maize, cassava, cowpeas, and beans. He decided to join Komaza, because it is a future investment. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a family business and buy a dairy cow. Raphael’s favorite part about working with Komaza is planting trees on his farm.

loans.use: to buy tree-farm-planting inputs, such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Nayely

texts.es:
Nayely is a 22 year old Popoluca that, with the help of her father, developed a coffee processing facility in one of the most marginalized communities of Veracruz. 
With the help of a local NGO and a loan from ERES Energía, last season, Nayely and her father set up a processing facility to receive the freshly harvested coffee cherries from local producers, depulp, ferment, wash, dry and bag the coffee. 
Having the working capital to pay the farmers for their coffee cherries and the coffee drying facility, allowed Nayely to skip the local middleman and obtain a better price for her coffee. As a result, she was able to make a second payment to the coffee producers, increasing their income by 15%.

This sesason, with the help form a coffee roaster in Germany, Nayely will be able to process coffee even further from parchment (pergamino) coffee to green (oro) coffee for exportation.  Nayely needs a loan to buy enough coffee from local producers to fulfill the German coffee roaster’s order and buy the machinery needed for hulling, polishing, grading and sorting the coffee beans.

With this loan Nayely will be able to help more than 100 producers improve their living conditions and contribute to the conservation of an area of high environmental value by offering them a fixed price for their coffee cherries.

loans.use: to purchase coffee from local producers, process it and export it to Germany.

loans.name: Mokoli's Group

texts.en:
Mokoli is a twenty-eight-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He is single with no children.

He decided to join Komaza because it is an investment in the future. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to open a hardware store. 

Mokoli's favorite part about working with Komaza is the enthusiasm he derives from the fast rate at which the trees are growing.

Mokoli is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Nelly Johana

texts.es:
Muy  joven mujer de 23 años quien desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar en un almacén de venta de ropa para poder ayudar económicamente a su madre en los gastos del hogar.
Hoy NELLY vive con su hermana y su sobrina y ha tenido la oportunidad de realizarse en su negocio de venta de sabanas- toallas y  toldos mosquiteros.
Se considera muy activa y dinámica le gusta mucho compartir sus conocimientos y orientar a niñas y jóvenes de su edad en lo que tiene que ver a el apoyo familiar. 
Ella con el crédito que recibió con anterioridad pudo fortalecer esta actividad y hoy se siente muy solida en sus ventas. 
Ella arrienda una pequeña pieza para habitar con su hermana y su sobrina en un barrio con pocas oportunidades. Es por eso que sus ventas las realiza bajo pedido y de puerta a puerta.
Espera muy pronto con sus ahorros poder comprar una casita propia y poder vivir mejor.
Es una muy buena oportunidad poder trabajar con FODEMI ya que facilita facilidades de trabajar a personas que no pueden acceder a créditos tradicionales por la situación de documentos y requisitos.
texts.en:
Nelly, a young woman, age 23, began working in a clothing store at a very early age so that she could help her mother with the household expenses. Today, Nelly lives with her sister and her niece.  She has had the opportunity to carry out her business selling sheets, towels, and bed canopies made with mosquito netting.

She is very active and dynamic; and she very much likes sharing her knowledge, and showing young girls and young people of her own age how they can support their families.  With her previous loan she was able to strengthen her business, and today she feels very strong in her sales. 

She rents a tiny apartment that she lives in with her sister and her niece, in a neighborhood where there are few opportunities.  That is why she sells on order and door to door. She hopes that very soon, she will be able to buy a little house of her own with her savings, and be able to live better.

Being able to work with FODEMI has been a very good opportunity, as it creates work opportunities for people who do not have access to traditional loans due to situations with documents and requirements.

loans.use: to purchase and sell sheets, towels, and bed canopies made with mosquito netting, in nearby communities.

loans.name: Reina Doris

texts.es:
Reina, siente que la institución le brinda un buen servicio y le da apoyo en cuando ella lo necesita, es por tal razón que requiere un nuevo crédito para comprar carnes, golosinas, bebidas varias, huevos, granos básicos, etc., para mantener el chalet abastecido con los productos que sus clientes necesitan.
El buen uso del capital anterior le ha permitido a Reina tener un negocio mucho más estable, con mejores ingresos y comparte con su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Reina feels that the partner is giving her good service and support when she needs it. 

Therefore,  she is requesting a new loan to buy meats, candies, various types of drinks, eggs, basic grains etc. in order to stock her food stall with the products her clients need. 

She has put the previous loans to good use which has allowed her to have a much more stable business with better income and is able to have a better lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: to buy meats, candies, various types of drinks, eggs, basic grains etc. in order to stock her food stall

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is a single mother of four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Jerry has a tailoring business, and has been in this business for five years. She works in a shop six days a week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, and on-and-off electricity. Jerry aspires to own a tailoring school, and also to buy more sewing machines. She lives in the family house, and the family has no access to electricity, and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, and feeding the family. Jerry has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more thread, and rolls of fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en el Caserio de San Rafael, en una zona rural. Vive con su cónyuge en casa propia, en esta zona la vida es muy pasiva y tranquila. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Leonor se dedica a las actividad de venta de abarrotes (café, azúcar, arroz, leche, etc.) en una bodega ubicada en su mismo domicilio, con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio, Leonor solicita préstamo para la compra de una cantidad mayor de mercaderia(arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad), pues ella desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de productos para poder atender toda la demanda insatisfecha, así como los diferentes gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonor is 32 years old, she lives with her life partner in their own house in a rural area of the San Rafael village, an area where life is very idle and peaceful. Agriculture, livestock breeding and retail are the main activities people of her community engage in; the village is located in Saña, a district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region, on the Peruvian northern coast.
Lenor sells groceries in a shop she has established in her own house, and she has been running this activity for more than 2 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more products, and this investment will help her meet all of her customers' unmet requests, as well as their different tastes and preferences. This will allow her to improve her earnings in a short time, thus increasing her income and finally improve her family's standard of living as well as her own.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise (rice, sugar, oil, among other staples ) so as to diversify her stock

loans.name: Joweriya

texts.en: Joweriya is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. Joweriya sells vegetables and fruits. She has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy onions, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, cabbages, oranges, and carrots, which she sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. Joweriya aspires to buy a plot of land to start farming. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care and timely loans. Joweriya lives in a rented house. Her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy sweet potatoes, onions, tomatoes, cabbages, and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: La Señora Dionisia es una persona humilde, sencilla y trabajadora diariamente se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, siembra papa, maíz y haba. Tiene cuatro hijos pequeños que asisten a la escuela para tener mejor educación. La señora y su esposo estudiaron hasta el bachillerato, viven en su casa propia, la misma es de construcción rustica, su domicilio está ubicada en la provincia Tiraque del departamento de Cochabamba. La señora desea poder ampliar su producción actual y para ello se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de semilla, abono orgánico, agroquímicos y pagar los servicios de tractor agrícola para la preparación de sus terrenos, de esta forma podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos para el bien de sus hijos que están estudiando y su familia
texts.en:
Dionisia is a humble, simple, and hardworking person who devotes herself everyday to agriculture. She plants potatoes, corn, and beans. She has four children attending school to have a better education. She and her husband studied through high school. They live in a home of rustic construction. Their home is located in the province Tiraque in the province of Cochabamba. 

Dionisia wishes to expand her current production. For this reason, she needs to apply for a loan for the purchase of seed, organic fertilizer, agrochemicals, and pay for the services of a farm tractor for preparing her land. Thus, she can improve their income for the sake of their children who are studying and their family.

loans.use: to purchase seed, organic fertilizer, agrochemicals, and pay for the services of a farm tractor for preparing her land

loans.name: Marien Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marien es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes en el municipio de Bello, Antioquia.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector que siempre prefieren visitar su tienda para adquirir sus productos.

Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida  a sus 2 hijos por los cuales aspira a darles un excelente futuro.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio.

Ella guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Marien is a very nice person, and she always has a smile for the customers who visit her grocery store in the Bello municipality in Antioquia.

Thanks to her charisma and good humor, she has been able to win the hearts and recognition from the people of the area who always prefer to visit her store to get their products.  She works every day in order to give her two children a good quality of life.  She aspires to give her children an excellent future.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy stock of basic needs items like grains, groceries, candy, and drinks, among others.  This will give significant impetus to her business.

She holds the hope of being able to continue with her business.  This way she will continue impacting the lives of her customers through her good service.

loans.use: to buy stock of basic needs items like grains, groceries, candy, and drinks, among others.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco margarita empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene una hija de 11 años que es su más grande adoración.

Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar.

Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos de confección como tela, hilos y agujas; además desea realizar el mantenimiento preventivo a sus maquinas.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande en el que pueda ofrecer empleo y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Beatriz learned to sew at a very early age from her mother, who also made clothes. This was how Beatriz began to learn and apply the craft little by little. 

Beatriz has an 11 year old daughter who is her biggest adoration. She is an entrepreneurial and affectionate woman who is always ready to serve her customers in the best way possible.

She is very grateful for all that she has been able to build so far with the help of the Interact Corporation. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and needles. She also wants to preventatively maintain her sewing machines.

Beatriz has high hopes for her business and maintains her dream of growing her business so that she can provide employment and increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Santos Evelyn

texts.es:
Santos de 27 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijo, de 14 meses y el otra de año y medio. Estudió hasta bachillerato y dejo de estudiar porque se acompañó y su pareja trabaja con cultivos de café. Solo su pareja y sus hijos viven con ella..

Santos es comerciante, se dedica a vender productos de canasta básica y desde hace 8 meses tiene una pequeña librería aprendió gracias a instrucción de su esposo que le enseño como manejar las ganancias. El negocio está ubicado en su casa y su pareja se encarga de llevarle la mercadería.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar azúcar, arroz, frijol, aceite, granos básicos y demás para su negocio. Santos pretende ampliar su negocio ofreciendo otros productos para los clientes esperando aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias y dar el estudio a sus hijos para que tengan mayores oportunidades.
texts.en:
27-year-old Santos has a common law partner and two young children. She studied up until high school but dropped out when she met her partner who worked in the coffee fields. She lives with her partner and children.

Santos has a business. She sells basic products and starting 8 months ago has a small bookstore. Her partner taught her how to manage her profits. Her business is located at her house and her partner is in charge of bringing her the merchandise.

She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, grains and other items for her business. Santos hopes to expand her business by offering new products to her customers. She would like to increase her sales and profits and be able to provide an education to her children so that they have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, grains and other items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: A sus 49 años de edad Maria tiene 5 hijos mismos de los cuales de los cuales 4 están estudiando,  su esposo trabaja de jornalero en trabajos de la agricultura, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos ya que ese es su fuente de empleo, lo que Maria espera de su negocio es mejorarlo y comprar mas chanchos y seguir trabajando en su negocio y tener los ingresos para  dar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria, age 49, has five children.  Four of them go to school.  Her husband works as a day working doing agricultural work.

She will use the loan to buy pigs because this is her source of employment.  What Maria hopes for her business is to improve it, to buy more pigs, to continue working in her business, and to have the earnings to give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy pits.

loans.name: Haro's Group

texts.en:
Haro is a forty-one-year-old Komaza tree farmer with six children, five of whom are in school. Haro is married and his spouse is a nursery school teacher. In addition to growing trees, Haro also cultivates maize, water melon, and sweet potatoes and supports his family through tapping and selling coconut wine.

He decided to join Komaza to help conserve the environment. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to buy a dairy cow and start a business in the village. Haro’s favorite part about working with Komaza is monitoring how the trees grow at a fast rate.

Haro is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: A sus 27 años Carlos  tiene unión libre con una chica  y tiene un hijo de 6 meses, Carlos se dedica a trabajar en una empresa de elaboración de quesos, también se dedica a la venta de ropa de puerta a puerta, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, la aspiración de este joven es mejorar sus ingresos y trabajar duro para a futuro comprarse un lote y después construir su casa  ya que en la actualidad vive en la casa de su madre.
texts.en:
At 27 years old, Carlos is in a long-term relationship with a woman and he has a son of 6 months old. 

Carlos makes a living working in a cheese factory as well as selling clothes door-to-door. 

He's going to invest the credit in buying clothes. 

This young man hopes to make more of an income and work hard to buy a plot of land in the future and build his own house because at the moment he is living in his mother's house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 58 años de edad, es conviviente tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad el cual cursa secundaria en colegio nacional del distrito. Eugenia vive en casa propia de material rustico por un lapso de más de 20 años, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y económicas. Eugenia vive en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Eugenia es la venta de frutas asi como bebidas gaseosa, golosinas cuenta con clientela de la zona, las ventas las realiza en su domicilio, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con más fruta y con nuevos productos(como bebidas gaseosas de mayor tamaño), pues Eugenia dese aumentar y diversificar su stock, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 58 years old. She lives with her partner and has a 17-year-old son who is in middle school at the national school. For over 20 years, Eugenia has lived in her own house, which is made of rustic materials. She counts on good personal and business references. Eugenia lives in the rural part of this district, and she relies on water and light services. Her community works in agriculture, livestock, and commerce. It is located in the Pomahuaca district in the Jaen province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Eugenia makes a living selling fruit as well as beverages, sodas, and snacks. She relies on customers from the area. She carries out her sales from her house. She has 15 years of experience in this business. She will use this loan to buy a greater supply of fruit as well as new products (like large soft drinks) so that she can inrease and diversify her stock. In the short term, this will allow her to better her income, increase her earnings, and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and new products to sell in her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She has no additional family members. 

She has been selling secondhand clothes in a shop at retail for three years, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of skirts and blouses. 

Her challenges include unstable prices of clothes and seasonality. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. She stays with her husband in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of skirts and blouses

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of a sister. 

She sells fruits and vegetables at the market six days a week on a retail basis. She has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, pineapples, oranges, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and fresh peas. 

She generates additional income from selling charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, cabbages, pineapples, tomatoes, and fresh peas to sell

loans.name: Kristian

texts.en: Kristian owns a grocery store, which he acquired a few years ago. He has experience in this type of business, because much of his life has been spent working in other grocery stores until he could have his own. He is responsible for the income of the family, and so far he has done everything possible to offer the best. He considers himself responsible, punctual, and a person with a vision in business. He intends to use this money to buy products in bulk at a lower price and increase profit margins.

loans.use: To buy products in bulk at a lower price and increase profit margin.

loans.name: Teofilo Enrique

texts.es:
Teófilo, a sus 54 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. Ser padre de 3 hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenzó a fabricar y comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará materiales para la fabricación de calzado al por mayor como cuero, telas, suelas, pegas, entre otros, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada navideña, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Teófilo manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está la de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Teófilo!
texts.en:
Teofilo, at 54 years of age, is a charismatic man, active and responsible. Being the father of 3 children is his principal motive for struggling tirelessly day after day, seeking alternative ways to earn his living and to provide sustenance for his children.

For the last five years, Teofilo has been making and selling shoes for all types of customers. His products are of very good quality and are offered at excellent prices, permitting him to become well known in the sector and to achieve good prospects. 

This has led Teofilo to request help through a loan to fortify his inventories. He will purchase materials at wholesale for making shoes, such as leather, cloth, soles, and glue, among other things. Thus, he will be able to satisfy the demand that increases in this Christmas season. This will help him to improve the income he receives for his labor.

Teofilo says that his age doesn't impede him from continuing to do what he passionately likes. He always sets new goals and, among them, is becoming a major distributor of shoes and generating employment opportunities. In this manner, he can improve his quality of life and the wellbeing of his family as well as that of the persons who help him in his daily work.

Be sure to make a loan to Teofilo's business!

loans.use: buy materials at wholesale for fabricating shoes; inputs such as leather, cloth, soles, and glues, among other items.

loans.name: Rudy Alexander

texts.es:
Rudy de 19 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos, acaba de finalizar sus estudios de bachillerato, su esposa es ama de casa y además de ella viven con su hermana su cuñado y dos sobrinos.

Rudy es agricultor de granos básicos, maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 10 años aprendió con sus padre que se dedican a la misma actividad, antes trabajaba más seguido como albañil. Camina 15 minutos para llegar a la parcela y labora de 7:00 am a 1:00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semilla certificada de chile, tomate, pepino y ejote, también pagara mano de obra para realizar las labores. Por el momento lo que más desea Rudy es ampliar el área de siembra de sus hortalizas.
texts.en:
Rudy is 19 years old, is married and doesn't have any children. He has just finished his secondary school education and his wife is a housewife. They live with his sister, her husband and two nephews.  

Rudy has been a farmer for 10 years. He grows basic grains such as: sweetcorn, beans and sorghum and learned what he knows from his father who works in farming too. He used to work more as a bricklayer. He walks for 15 minutes to get to the plot and he works from 1:00 am until 1:00 pm.

He is requesting the loan to buy certified chili, tomato, cucumber and green bean seeds and also pay for manual labour to carry out the work. At the moment, what Rudy wants most of all is to increase the area where he grows vegetables.

loans.use: to buy certified chili, tomato, cucumber and green bean seeds and also pay for manual labour to carry out the work.

loans.name: Fredy Alberto

texts.es:
A sus 40 años de edad Fredy logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que tuvo trabajando en talleres, trabaja de lunes a sábado entre 9 y 11 horas diarias dependiendo la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina fileteadora con la que podrá expandirse a nuevas empresas y tener mejor volumen de trabajo dándole la oportunidad a una persona de trabajar. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un taller y así un día contar la historia de que gracias a colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At 40 years old, Fredy has been able to establish a sewing business and his own line of clothing thanks to his experience working in workshops. He works from Monday to Saturday between 9 and 11 hours a day, depending on the amount of work he has. He is grateful for his customers who provide him with his business.

Fredy wants to expand his horizons and be able to employ the people in most need of a job. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, with which he can expand to new businesses and have a better workload, providing an opportunity to employ someone.

His dream is to continue growing and  establishing his workshop so that one day he can tell his story: that, thanks to the Kiva collaborators and lenders, and the help of the Interact Corporation, he was able to create a large business.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos, tres estudian 4°, 6° y 7° grado de educación básica, la menor aún no estudia. Él estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, después de dejar el estudio se dedicó a trabajar y apoyar a la familia con sus gastos ya que eran de escasos recursos económicos. Su pareja es ama de casa, se encarga de los oficios del hogar y de cuidar a sus hijos pero también ayuda en las labores agrícolas.

José es agricultor, aprendió trabajando con su padre que se dedica a la misma actividad; siembra maíz y ajonjolí y en época seca trabaja como albañil oficio que también aprendió de su padre y lo realiza cuando se lo solicitan. También gracias a un amigo aprendió a trabajar como carpintero.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras con las que le apoyara en el cuido su pareja. José sueña con dar el estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su casa ya que la familia está creciendo.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old. He is married and has four children. They are in the 4th, 6th, and 7th grades. The youngest isn’t in school yet. José studied until the 9th grade. After leaving school, he devoted himself to work and supporting his family in their expenses because they were economically disadvantaged. His wife is a homemaker. She takes care of household chores and cares for the children. She also helps with farming.

José is a farmer. He learned to farm by working with his father who is also a farmer. He grows corn and sesame seed. In the dry season, he works as a construction worker. It’s a job he also learned from his father which he works on when asked. Also, thanks to a friend, he learned to work as a carpenter. 

He is requesting a loan to buy two dairy cows that his wife will help him care for. José dreams of giving his children an education and improve their home because their family is growing.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.en: Alma Rose is married and has two children. She lives with her mother-in-law. Ten years ago she began selling clothing and shoes door to door. She also receives other financial support for their handwoven works . She is asking for a loan to buy more shoes and  meet the demand from recurring customers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Ana Juanita

texts.en:
Ana Juanita lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She is a farmer (coffee). Age 31 years; she is unmarried. It is clear that Ana Juanita works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.
Ana Juanita is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Nermeen

texts.en: Nermeen is a 25-year-old woman from Baniswef, Egypt. She is married with two children. Her oldest is 4 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. She lives in a rental house with her husband, who is a part-time teacher with a very low salary. They don't have any other source of income. After some research of the demands of the local market, she decided that fattening cattle would be a good project as she has a suitable place in her house for it. She requested a 10,000 EPG to buy two head of cattle. She will sell the milk or convert it into cheese for sale or for family use. She believes that the monthly income will be enough to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle to sell their milk or convert it into cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Blanca Ofir

texts.es:
Blanca, a sus 64 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo.  

Desde que tenía 16 años, ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, pues le colaboraba a una Tía que tenía una empresa grande y allí se encargaba de pulir y revisar las prendas, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad fue vinculada a la empresa, donde laboró por algunos años. 

Hace aproximadamente 8 años, Blanca se independizó y montó su taller con gran empuje; afianzó su taller con la esperanza de que las ventas aumentaran y así fue, comenzó a conseguir contratos con terceros. De esta forma ha obtenido los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 

Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una máquina plana industrial, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los contratos y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una línea propia, además de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Ella sabe que Interactuar es un gran apoyo para el crecimiento de su empresa!
texts.en:
Blanca, 64, lives with her husband and son. 

When she was 16 she started working in the dressmaking field. She worked with an aunt who had a large business where she finished and fixed garments. 

When she became of age she was legally tied to the business and worked there for several years. 

About 8 years ago, Blanca left and started her own workshop with great momentum. She set up her workshop with the hopes of increasing her sales and they did. She started getting third party contracts. This is how she has earned income to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy an industrial flat-bed sewing machine with the aim of providing her clients with well made garments with excellent finishings. 

This way she will increase her contracts and earnings in order to fulfill her dream of having her own clothing line as well as to give employment opportunities to other people. 

she knows that Interactuar supports the growth of her company.

loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine.

loans.name: Isla Dorada Group

texts.es: Isla Dorada es un grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas y emprendedoras en sus negocios. Este grupo lo coordina la señora Karla quien tiene la edad de 38 años, soltera y se dedica a la comercialización de nacatamales y electrodomésticos en su localidad de manera ambulante, este negocio lo impulso hace más de veinte años y este crédito lo solicita para la compra de televisores medianos, microondas, planchas de  cabello, licuadoras, mecates, hojas de chagüites, pollo, carne, quintales de maíz,  etc. La segunda socia  es Modesta de 61 años de edad, y es propietaria de una pulpería, y Doña Maryuri tiene la edad de 22 años y es propietaria de una pulpería en su localidad.
texts.en:
“Ilsa Dorada” is the name of a united group of three hardworking entrepreneurial businesswomen.  Karla works as the group’s coordinator.  She is 38 years old, single, and sells nacatamales and small appliances on foot in her neighborhood.  She started this business more than 20 years ago and is asking for this loan to buy medium TVs, microwaves, hair irons, blenders, rope, jewelry, chicken, meat, dried corn, etc.

Modesta is another member of the group.  She is 61 years old and has a convenience store.  Maryuri, the third member, is 22 years old and also has a convenience store in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy small appliances and foodstuff.

loans.name: Emma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Emma es una mujer emprendedora de 64 años de edad, madre de una hija de 32 años y convive con su compañero. 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes parte y áreas, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de las ventas; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros negocios y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su hija, decidió emprender su propio proyecto de venta de pijamas y ropa; por ello se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra surtido de ropa para la iniciación de este nuevo negocio y poder capitalizarlo. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar
texts.en:
Emma is a very entrepreneurial 64 year old woman, mother of a 32 year old daughter, and living with her husband.

During her productive life, she has worked in different parts and areas, so she has excellent experience and knowledge in managing sales.  But now that she’s tired of working in other businesses and with a desire to spend more time with her daughter, she decided to start her own business selling pajamas and clothing.  She is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of clothing to start this new business.

This will allow her to begin moving forward with her plans, where she hopes to have a great impact in the area, and generate a profit.  This will allow her to achieve her dream of positioning herself in the market.

With push and ambition, she expects to create jobs with the help of Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, reside en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla, su negocio inicio en el año 2009, gracias a que unas vecinas le propusieron vender ropa, calzado, bolsos, perfumes y accesorios, desde entonces su negocio se ha consolidado con una clientela fidelizada y excelente utilidades. Judith dedica 10 horas diarias a esta actividad todos los días, esta emprendedora mujer tiene 48 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos y 3 hijas a quienes desea continuar educando. Sus compras las realiza de contado a almacenes y distribuidores mayoristas, por ello en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de ropa, calzado, bolsos, perfumes y accesorios para renovar los modelos de artículos y ofrecerlos en esta temporada navideña. Judith tiene como meta a futuro para su negocio abrir un local comercial y su principal desafío es incrementar las ventas para obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Judith lives in a southwest Barranquilla neighborhood and started her business in 2009, thanks to some neighbors who suggested she sell clothing, shoes, bags, perfumes, and accessories.  Since then, her business has developed with loyal customers and excellent utility.

Judith works 10 hours a day on this.  This enterprising lady is 48 years old and is the mother of three daughters whom she wants to continue educating.  She makes her purchases in cash from warehouses and wholesale distributors, and is asking for a Kiva loan.  This will her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use the money to buy clothing, shoes, bags, perfumes, and accessories so she can refresh her styles and offer them this Christmas season.

Judith’s future goal is to open a local establishment.  Her main challenge is increasing her sales to obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Yuly Elena

texts.es:
Sin mucho capital, Yuly montó su taller de confección de calzado con el ánimo de generar ingresos con los cuales pueda sostener los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo. 

La actividad la aprendió de manera empírica y esto le ha permitido realizar trabajos que se caracterizan por su buena calidad y su puntualidad en la entrega. 

Con sus trabajos, Yuly ha logrado captar un gran número de clientes que le han garantizado muy buenas ventas mensuales, por lo que espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posteriormente pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Con la finalidad de responder a la demanda sus clientes, Yuly busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos como cuero, tela, suelas, pegantes, entre otros.

Yuly espera que así su familia pueda gozar de unos mejores ingresos los cuales les permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida y una educación de mejor calidad. 

Además, Yuly espera que si su negocio sigue ampliándose a un buen ritmo y que en su taller pueda generar como mínimo un empleo para una persona que lo requiera y no tenga oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Without much capital, Yuly began her shoemaking workshop with the aim of generating income with which she can sustain the cost of her home where she lives with her three children and her husband.

She learned this activity by observation. This has allowed her to perform jobs that are noteworthy for their good quality and timely delivery. Yuly has a large number of customers who have given her good monthly sales. She expects her business to continue to grow and then she can generate employment for those in need. 

In order to respond to customer demand, Yuly is looking for a loan that gives her the ability to purchase materials such as leather, fabric, soles, glues, and more. 

Yuly expects that her family will enjoy a better income which will allow them to have a better quality of life and a better quality education. In addition, Yuly expects her business to continue to grow at a good pace. She hopes to generate at least one job in her workshop for someone who needs it and has no job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase shoemaking materials

loans.name: José Deonicio

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene 6 hijos todos mayores, 4 con familia propia y el menor viviendo con él. José estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, no continuó porque sus padres no podían pagarle el estudio. Su esposa es ama de casa, solo ella u su hijo que le apoya en las labores agrícolas viven con él.

José es agricultor desde muy joven aprendió de su padre que se dedicaba a la misma actividad, por lo genera siembra 21,000 mts cuadrados de maíz. Se levanta muy temprano y camina un kilómetro para llegar a la parcela sembrada para terminar a tiempo el trabajo del día, ya que también se desempaña como fontanero de la comunidad y es responsable de que reciba el agua potable.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, productos de higiene personal y de cocina, golosinas y bebidas para una tienda y aumentar las fuentes de ingreso de la familia. Espera le resulte la inversión para poder mantenerse y dar un ejemplo de trabajo a su hijo.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old, he is married and has 6 grown-up children, 4 of whom have their own families although José's youngest child still lives with him. José attended school until 9th grade but did not continue because his parents could not afford the school fees. He lives with his wife, who takes care of the household tasks, and his son who helps him with the agricultural work. 

José is a farmer. He learnt how to do this when he was very young from his father who was also a farmer. Usually José plants 21,000 square metres of corn. He gets up very early and walks a kilometre to get to his plot of land. He does this because it is important that he finishes the day's work in time because he also acts as a plumber for the local community and is responsible providing people with drinking water. 

He is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, personal hygiene and food products, sweets and drinks for a shop and to increase his family's income. He hopes that the investment comes good so that he can support himself financially and provide a good example of hard work to his son.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, personal hygiene and food products, sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Nanci Carolina

texts.es:
Nanci de 19 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta bachillerato y actualmente vive con sus padres. Es comerciante, elabora tamales para vender, además de yuca frita, pasteles de carne esto lo hace a diario en su comunidad, además vende jugos y gaseosas en la canche de futbol cuando hay encuentros. De ella surgió la iniciativa de vender para costear sus estudios y aportar una parte a la familia.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar yuca, maíz, aceite para hacer los tamales y para comprar bebidas. Nancy sueña con mejorar sus ventas y apoyar a su padres con los gastos de la familia para algún día mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Nanci is 19 years old, single, with no children.  She completed high school and currently lives with her parents.  She is a merchant and makes tamales to sell, along with fried yucca, and meat pies.  She does this daily in her community and also sells juices and candy in the soccer stadium during games.  She got the idea to sell things in order to pay for her education and to help support her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy yucca, corn, and cooking oil to make her tamales and also to buy beverages.  Nancy dreams of improving her sales and helping her parents with the family expenses so they can make some home improvements some day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.en:
Bartolo decided to invest in a 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to reduce his consumption of wood, LP gas, and chemical fertilizers, while protecting the environment. He owns cows and a horse, whose manure he used to collect and pile up outside his farm. 

With his biodigester, he will now input the waste directly in the system, letting the bacteria and methanisation process produce biogas to cook and heat water in his house, as well as organic fertilizer for his corn and oat fields. He will not contaminate the watersheds anymore nor purchase the expensive fossil fuel-based LP gas and chemical fertilizers. 

The operating costs of his farm will progressively diminish, and his field's yield will improve in a natural way with the nutrient-rich fertilizer, allowing Bartolo to sell more corn on the local market while feeding his cows with higher quality forage, enhancing the taste of their milk. With the savings Bartolo will make, he plans to expand his corn production and buy new animals.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 12-cubic-meter waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Mbodze's Group

texts.en:
Mbodze is a fifty-eight-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a widow. In addition to growing trees, Mbodze cultivates beans, maize and cassava.

She decided to join Komaza because it is an investment in the future. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to pay school fees for her children and to start a family business. Mbodze’s favorite part about working with Komaza is seeing the trees grow at fast rate.

Mbodze is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a 56-year-old tree farmer with six children, none of whom are in school (she is the woman in the photo with her hand raised). She is married and her husband is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, she also cultivates maize, cowpeas and cassava.

Agnes and the others decided to join Komaza and are receiving a 70,000 KES loan. She will use her portion of the loan to receive planting inputs such as tree seedlings, technical training and planting support. With the profits from her trees she plans to buy a plot of land and build a rental house.

Agnes says the best thing about working with the Komaza organization is their help in planting trees on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, technical training and planting support

loans.name: Jesús Alberto

texts.es: Jesús un joven de 23 años de edad, domiciliado en un barrio ubicado en Barranquilla, comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa, calzado, utensilios de cocina y artículos por encargo, con el apoyo de su padre quien le proporcionó el capital.  Su principal motivación para acceder a esta actividad fue encontrarse sin empleo, así mismo las circunstancias le exigieron buscar alternativas para generar recursos, ya que enfrentaba la responsabilidad de ser padre a tan temprana edad y debía responder económicamente por su familia.  Actualmente tiene cuatro años de estar ejerciendo esta actividad en la que ha obtenido excelentes resultados, sin embargo no ha podido ampliar la cobertura de clientes porque su capital de trabajo le es insuficiente.  Sus principales clientes son los vecinos, amigos y referidos a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago, sus compras las realiza de contado a mayoristas y en la ciudad de Medellín, él está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en compra de ropa, calzado y pedidos que le han realizado. Él considera que esta inversión le generará muy buenas ganancias gracias a que se acerca la temporada navideña, en la que estos artículos se venden con mucha frecuencia y los clientes tienen mayor poder adquisitivo. Jesús desea continuar educando a sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro, por eso su principal desafío es incrementar su capital de trabajo para tener mayor cobertura.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 23 year old young man who lives in a Barranquilla neighborhood.  He began his business of selling clothing, shoes, kitchen utensils, and items to order, with his father’s help who provided money.  His main motivation for starting this business was because he was unemployed and he had to find alternatives for generating income, since he was already a father at a young age and needed to support his family.

He has been doing this for four years and things have gone very well for him, however he has not been able to expand his clientele because his working capital is not enough.

His friends, neighbors, and those referred to him are his primary customers, to whom he offers ease of payment.  He makes his purchases in cash from wholesalers in Medellin and is asking for a Kiva loan.  This will be his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use the money to buy clothing, shoes, and fill current orders.  He believes that this investment will provide very good earnings, now that the Christmas season is approaching, which is when sales are best.

Jesus wants to continue educating his children and provide a better future for them, so his greatest challenge is to increase his working capital to have better coverage.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino tiene 37 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y sus menores hijos, tiene tres hijos, los cuales estudian en la escuela de la zona, vive en casa propia, cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales. Catalino vive en una zona rural contando con servicios de agua, su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Catalino es el comercio de abarrotes en su caserío San Luis del Distrito de Santo Tomas, cuenta con local propio en su mismo domicilio, su labor la realiza todos los días de la semana, Catalino invertirá préstamo en comprar mercadería (aceite, azúcar, arroz, bebidas gaseosas, entre otros) ya que se acerca la campaña navideña y Catalino necesita surtir y aumentar su stock de productos, ello se verá reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Catalino is 37 years old; he has a stable home with his partner and their young children; they have three children, all of whom attend the local school.  He lives in his own home and has good work and personal references.  Catalino lives in a rural area and has running water; his community is located in the district of Santo Tomás, in Cutervo Province, Cajamarca Region, on Peru's northern coast.  His community works basically in farming, livestock, and commerce. 

Catalino has a business selling groceries in his neighborhood, San Luis, in the district of Santo Tomás.  He has a storefront in his home; he works every day of the week.  Catalino will invest his loan in merchandise (oil, sugar, rice, soft drinks, and other things) as Christmas season is coming, and Catalino needs increase and her augment her stock of products, which is reflected in greater sales volumes, and he will therefore make more income to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (oil, sugar, rice, soft drinks, and other things), as Christmas season is coming, and Catalino needs increase and her augment her stock of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Abdulsalam

texts.en:
Abdulsalam is a maize farmer. Before he became a member of Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at a low price soon after harvest so he could cover his immediate cash needs. But with this 15,839 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Abdulsalam expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

loans.name: Kevin Alexis

texts.es:
Kevin de 26 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta bachillerato ya que se costeaba él mismo sus estudios y decidió dedicarse totalmente a trabajar. Viajó al extranjero, estuvo poco tiempo y ahora vive con su hermano y ambos colaboran con los gastos de la casa.

Cuando estudiaba aprendió el oficio de electricista, luego se capacitó en unos curso y tomo confianza para desempañar este oficio. Hoy en día está laborando con un ingeniero que le da trabajos, en ocasiones tiene que salir lejos de su casa para realizarlos

Solicita el préstamo para reparar el vehículo que le sirve para trasladarse a los lugares donde tiene que hacer los trabajos. Kevin aspira a tener su propio negocio con sus herramientas y equipo necesario para desempeñarse y nunca descartó la posibilidad de seguir estudiando para aprender más de su oficio.
texts.en:
Kevin, 26, is single and has no children. He graduated high school. 

Since he was paying for his own studies he decided to start working. 

He traveled abroad for a short while and now lives with his brother. They share household costs. 

While in school he learned to become an electrician. He later got further training in a course and gained confidence in this field. Today he works with an engineer who gives him jobs. Sometimes he has to go far away for the jobs. 

He is requesting this loan to repair a vehicle which he uses to drive to places for work. 

Kevin hopes to own his own business with his own tools and equipment necessary to perform the work. 

He never rules out the possibility to keep studying and learn more about his trade.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Songtaaba De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur TASSERE est le  représentant  du groupe SONGTAABA DE ROLLO.  Marié, il est père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé à 13 ans et le moins âgé a 10 mois. 02 vont à l’école. Il  a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraichage depuis 05 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des villes voisins. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  10 sacs d’engrais ; 80 litres d’essence.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tassere is the group representative for the Songtaaba De Rollo Group. He is a married father to six children. His eldest is 13 years old and his youngest is 10 months old. Two of his children are currently receiving an education. He has four people living within his care.

Tassere has been market gardening for five years. He gets his supplies from the local market. His customers come from the neighbouring cities. He wants to purchase 10 sacks of fertiliser and 80 litres of gasoline. Tassere wants puts his profits towards his personal savings. He dreams of being able to grow his business and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertiliser and 80 litres of gasoline

loans.name: Janneth Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Villamil se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Janneth, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Janbneth es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante ya que su marido no trabaja,  ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le da lo necesario  para salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y otras prendas.  Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios médicos que ofrece la institución de forma gratuita. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Grupo De Crédito Villamil" (The Credit Group of Villamil) meets every 15 days in Miraflores, a neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are very busy throughout the whole year.  It is also known as a city with incomparable beauty and many tourist attractions. This is where Janneth lives, she is 51 years old, married and through this relationship she has 4 children, all adults now, although 2 of which still live with her. Her husband is retired.  Mrs. Janneth is a very strong woman who likes to depend on herself to make a living especially as her husband doesn't work. 

She makes a living selling all types of different clothing.  She sells her clothes door to door and also in her home, clients can come directly to her door when they need something.  She sells her clothes on credit and collects every week. She's been working in the business for 2 years which gives her enough to make a living. 

This loan is to buy pans, shirts, blouses, and other clothes. She has been with the "Grupo De Crédito Villami" since the begining and she likes it for the free medical services that the institution offers.  Her dream is to be successful.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and other articles of clothing

loans.name: Babrah

texts.en:
Babrah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children, three of whom are attending school. She is also looking after her sister.

She has been operating an eating place from home for the last four years, working seven days a week. She also sells shoes to earn additional income.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more ingredients like food spices, rice, beans, peas, sugar, cooking oil, and flour. Her challenges include thieves and fluctuating prices. Her dream is to own a big restaurant. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans and the chance to save money. 

She rents a house with access to neither electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy spices, peas, sugar, cooking oil, beans, and rice

loans.name: María Tulmira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Familia Con Suerte se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Miraflores  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
