En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo   mayor de edad y vive con ella junto a su familia ya que está comprometido.
Doña María  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, frutas, legumbres, cosa de bazar, papelería, helados  entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, en su tienda sus clientes. Lleva más de 10  años con su negocio con el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, embutidos, carne, frutas y otros víveres de primera necesidad  para surtir más su tienda. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con cada crédito mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The loan group Familia con Suerte meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Miraflores in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited during every season of the year, and for being a city of matchless beauty with many touristic attractions.
In this place lives Maria, she is 55 years old, and a single mother of an adult son. He lives with her together with his family, because he is engaged.
Maria has a grocery store in her home. There she sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, fruits, legumes, stationery items, ice cream, among others. She works every day from 6:00 until 20:00, and sometimes even later, in her shop. She has had her business for more than 10 years, which allows her to get ahead. 
This loan is to buy food to stock her store. She has done two loan cycles with Grupo de Credito, and she likes it because with every loan, her business improves. Her goals are to move forward with her business and for her shop to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy food to stock her store

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 13, 11 y 7 años de edad, procura que su familia esté bien atendida y que tenga los cuidados necesarios; desde hace dos años inicio a elaborar tortillas para vender, con el propósito de tener recursos económicos para ayudar en los gastos de su familia, tiene un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m., por el momento no representa dificultades.
Invertirá en maíz al por mayor para la producción de tortillas y pólvora para la temporada navideña, fortalecerá su negocio y tendrá ingresos extras, espera tener un negocio competitivo y rentable.
Sus sueños son estabilizarse económicamente y sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband and three children, ages 13, 11, and 7 and wants her family to be well cared for and have what they need.  She started making tortillas to sell two years ago in order to have financial resources to help with the family expenses.  She works from 7:00 am to 1:00 pm and has no difficulties at the moment.

She will use the money to buy dried corn in quantity to make tortillas and will also buy gunpowder for the Christmas season.  She will strengthen her business; have extra income, and hopes to have a competitive and profitable business.

Her dreams are to set herself up financially and get her children ahead.

loans.use: to buy dried corn and gunpowder.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es: Angelica tiene 68 años de edad, ella tiene 8 hijos pero de ellos solo vive con un hijo y con 3 nietos, ella se dedica a la crianza de terneros para ayudarse en los gastos que ella tiene, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros y asi seguir en su actividad, la aspiración de Angelica es mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para tener algo de ingresos para adquirir  su alimento y medicina que necesita.
texts.en:
Angelica, 68, has 8 children. She lives with one of her children and 3 grandchildren. She raises calves to help with her costs. 

She will invest the loan to buy calves in order to keep working. 

Angelica hopes to improve her business and keep working in order to generate an income for the food and medicine that she needs.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Turiho Group

texts.fr:
Aloys  fait partie du groupe  Turiho et  habite à  Bujumbura. Ila 45 ans et est marié à Eliminate ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 5 à 18 ans, tous étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de boutique (   piles, habits, sel de cuisine,...) depuis  28 ans. 

Il est à  son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de sel de cuisine à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  acheter une voiture, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aloys is a member of the Turiho Group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Eliminate, a farmer. They have had eight children together, who are between the ages of 5 and 18 years old. All of them are currently receiving an education. Aloys earns a living through running his own stall, which sells batteries, clothings and cooking salt, among other items. He has been doing this for 28 years. 

This will be his second loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he is planning to increase his working capital and purchase large quantities of kitchen salt, which will be resold at a profit. In the years to come, Aloys would like to buy a car and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to increase their working capital and purchase large quantities of kitchen salt, which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her recipes.

loans.name: Santos Anabely

texts.es:
Santos de 40 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad y solo uno vive con ella pero trabaja por su cuenta. Ella solo estudió hasta 8° grado de educación básica, no continuo sus estudios por no poder pagarlos, además quería ayudar a su madre en los oficios de la casa, su compañero de vida es electricista y trabaja en la comunidad.

Santos es comerciante desde muy pequeña, trabajó con su madre apoyándolo en las actividades que hacía y como ella, también se dedica a la venta de antojos típicos y pupusas todas las tardes en su casa donde construyo un espacio y atiende a sus clientes. Es apoyada por su esposo cuando regresa temprano de trabajar

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una cocina de plancha y elaborar pupusas, la que tiene actualmente está muy deteriorada por el uso. Santos tiene pensado construir un lugar mas amplio donde atender su cliente, ya que es muy pequeño para la cantidad de personas que llegan a comprarle.
texts.en:
Santos, 40, has a partner and 3 adult children. Only one of them lives with her and works. 

She only studied up to 8th grade. She did not continue studying because she could not pay for it.
She also wanted to help her mother with the household chores. Her partner is an electrician and works in the community. 

Santos has worked as a merchant since she was very young. She worked with her mother supporting her work. Like her mother, she sells typical treats and pupusas every afternoon from her house. 

She built a space in her house where she can serve her customers. Her husband helps her when he is able to get home early from work. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a kitchen cooktop to prepare the pupusas. What she has now is very worn out from use. 

Santos wants to build a bigger area to serve her customers since currently her space is very small for amount of people who come to buy.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen cooktop.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, su hija mayor trabaja en la ciudad y esta acompañada, su segundo hijo de 22 años de edad, acaba de terminar sus estudios de educación media, el menor estudió hasta bachillerato y decidió trabajar. Ella estudio hasta 4° grado de educación básica su esposo trabaja como jornalero, él, sus dos hijos y dos nietos viven con ella.

María es ama de casa y sus ingresos dependen del jornal de su esposo, de joven trabajo 6 años en la ciudad. Solicita el préstamo para comprar cuerdas para tutores, semilla de frijol de ejote, plaguicidas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de su esposo.

Su sueño es que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios y puedan tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo de las que tuvo ella.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, married with 3 children. Her oldest daughter works in the city and has a partner. Her second son is 22 years old and just finished secondary school, while her younger son studied until high school and decided to work. She herself attended elementary school until 4th grade. She lives with her husband who works as a day laborer, her two sons and two grandchildren. 

Maria is the head of household and her income depends on her husband’s daily wage. As a young girl she worked 6 years in the city. She asks for this loan to buy rope for sugar cane, green bean seeds, insecticide and fertilizers for her husband’s crop. 

Her dream is that her children will continue their studies and be able to have better work opportunities than she had.

loans.use: para comprar cuerdas para tutores, semilla de frijol de ejote, plaguicidas y fertilizantes

loans.name: Cossy

texts.en:
Cossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family member. She has been operating a retail shop for the last two years, working seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more beans, peas, sugar, flour, cooking oil, dairy products, and rice to sell. 

Her challenges include collecting payments from debtors; and thieves. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop in one of the busiest suburbs of Kampala city. She joined MCDT because of the interest to transform women into self-reliant beings who can run profitable businesses.

She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy beans, peas, sugar, flour, soap, dairy products, and rice to sell

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana sigue dedicandose al negocio de crianza gallinas y chanchos ,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia lleva años en este negocio y le va muy bien. la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m ,el sueño de la socia es tener su propio local donde pueda vender los animales. Eliana solicita el prestamo para comprar gallinas, chanchos y alimentos para ellos.

La socia está contenta por ser cliente y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eliana's still working in her business raising hens and pigs.  She raises and fattens them for sale in the various markets.  She already has years of experience in this business and it's going very well for her.  She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  Her dream is to have her own retail space for selling her animals.

Eliana's requesting the loan to buy hens, pigs, and animal feed.

She's happy she's a client and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs, hens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Guadalupe tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando  como asistente administrativa de obra,la socia trabaja para una empresa privada la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de un víveres para su hogar.
La socia se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank Patrón de San Sebastián in the city of Cusco. 

Guadalupe is 42 years old and single. Her daily activity varies but she works as an administrative assistant for a private company. It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. She is very responsible and hard working. This member wants to keep working in order to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy groceries for her home. She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her home.

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es:
Dina Emerita tiene 59 años de edad, es separada, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Dina Emerita se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pavos, patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 20 años. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi, que la da en alquiler para uso de transporte urbano. Dina Emerita necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de cerdos y alimento de engorde balanceado para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales, y así poder satisfacer todas las necesidades y gustos de su público consumidor. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Dina Emerita is 59 years old and is separated and lives with her children in the Cayalti district.  In this region the people work in agriculture, livestock production, and commerce.  This area is located in Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of the northern coast of Peru.

Dina Emerita has had business raising and selling small animals such as turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs for more than 20 years.  She also has a moto-taxi that she rents out for urban transportation.  Dina Emerita needs a loan to invest in pigs and nutritionally balanced animal feed, so that she can expand and diversify her stock of animals.  This way she can satisfy all of the needs and desires of her customers.  In a short period, this will enable her to increase her earnings and income, and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: José Eusebio

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad,  estudio hasta 2ª grado.

El cliente se dedica mas que todo a la agricultura, toda su vida se a dedicado a la agricultura y a la crianza y engorde de ganado y cabras esa es su fuente de ingresos. sus cultivos quedan a media hora de camino y a una hora de camino donde se pastorea el ganado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar ganado para engordarlo y luego venderlo y así tener una fuente de ingreso a largo plazo.

Desea que su ganado se desarrolle en buen estado y que tenga ingresos para seguir el tratamiento de su hija que se encuentra enferma.
texts.en:
Jose is 54 years old and went to school until 2nd grade.

The borrower works mostly in agriculture and has dedicated all his life to agriculture and to the raising and fattening of cattle and goats. This is his source of income.  His crops are half an hour away and an hour away from were he herd his cattle.

The loan he is asking from CREDICAMPO is to buy cattle, fatten and sell it and that way have a long term source of income.  

He would like his cattle to grow in good condition and to have income to continue with the treatment of his daughter who is sick.

loans.use: to buy cattle, fatten and then sell it and that way have a long term source of income.

loans.name: Gentrix's Group

texts.en:
Gentrix is 26 years old and is often described as a very hard-working individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Gentrix is representing her group of 13 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya. She is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Gentrix's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing two solar lights as part of her loan. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Gentrix and her group will receive a total of eight solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet's Group consists of 11 farmers in Webuye District. Violet, the group leader pictured above, is 28 years old, married and has three children. Violet has been a farmer for 14 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Violet isn't new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has gained a lot of respect in her community. This year, Violet will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Violet's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Janerose's Group

texts.en:
Janerose has eight children and is described as a very hard-working individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader. Janerose's Group consists of 10 farmers in Webuye District and she is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Janerose has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, to better support her family, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will include not only farming inputs but also a solar light, for which she is very happy. A solar light means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Janerose is planning to rent more land to cultivate.

A total of 5 acres will be planted by Janerose's Group, and between them they will receive a total of  six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Dickson's Group

texts.en:
Dickson is 60 years old and has 10 children. He is representing his group formed by 16 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Dickson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to send his children to school. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Dickson also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Dickson's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Vincent's Group

texts.en:
Vincent is a 48-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person. Vincent leads a group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Vincent has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Vincent described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, along with fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Vincent’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Deborah De Samarie 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Jackson est le coordinateur de son groupe Deborah de Samarie 1, 3 & 4. Il est marie et Il a 2 enfants. Il habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée. Jackson dirige son commerce de boulangerie et d'accessoires pendant plus les 14 dernières années et Il va acheter des produits pour produire des pains. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. 

Des autres membres Deborah de Samarie 1, 3 & 4 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits alimentaires, boissons gazeuses, charbon, chausures, etc. Il déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un grand commerçant dans le département du nord. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Jackson is the coordinator of his group Deborah de Samarie 1, 3 & 4.. He is married and has two children. He lives in the northeast of Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. Jackson has been managing his bakery and accessories business most recently for over fourteen years. He is going to purchase some items to make breads. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his commerce. 

Other members of Deborah de Samarie 1, 3 & 4 have need of a loan for businesses, such as selling grocery items, soft drinks, charcoal, shoes, etc. 

He states that his main challenge is to become a major merchant in the northern district. He says his main goal is to have a business that will help him build a large house, with help from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, and other items

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Cristina de 24 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella es parte del grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” y está conformado por 09 socias comprometidas y responsables. Cristina se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Gracias a su perseverancia ha logrado crecer en su negocio. Tiene planeado ampliar su negocio en su propio local. Es por Ello que solicitó el  crédito para la compra de camisas, polos, pantalones y shorts. El grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Cristina se encuentra de pie en la parte frontal es la cuarta del lado derecho y viste casaca celeste y polo celeste.
texts.en:
Cristina is 24 years old and is separated with two dependent children.  She is part of the group "Unidos Para Triunfar" ["United to Triumph"], which consists of nine committed and responsible members.  Cristina makes a living by selling clothing.  Due to her perseverance, she has succeeded in growing her business.  

She plans to expand her business in her own storefront.  That is why she requested the loan for the purchase of shirts, polos, pants, and shorts.

The group "Unidos Para Triunfar" thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.  In the photo, Cristina is standing fourth from the right side in front, wearing a sky blue jacket and sky blue polo shirt.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, polos, pants, and shorts.

loans.name: Lilian Carmen

texts.es:
Lilian es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 16 años de edad, y su negocio es la confección de sábanas y edredones.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, trabajadora, constante y activa. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del norte de la ciudad, de clima frio y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Lilian es de tez trigueña, ojos obscuros, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el aymará que utiliza muy poco, para el comercio habla español. su vida la comparte con sus tres hijos; los dos mayores se encuentra estudiando en la escuela, el menor se encuentra a su cuidado. Su negocio es la confección de sabanas, edredones, cubrecamas, cubre almohadas, etc., para la venta por mayor, labor que realiza en su domicilio junto a su familia. Los clientes realizan los pedidos por mayor para revenderlos a detalle y contribuyen con ideas como; tipos de telas, motivos infantiles para el dia del niño, motivos navideños para la época, etc. 'vengo realizando este trabajo desde que era joven, en mis inicios confeccionaba ropa de mujer hasta que encontré mi nicho de mercado (las sábanas) y me lo apropie...' comenta. Su sueño es abrir una tienda donde pueda comercializar su manufactura, ella desea realizar la compra de telas por mayor para abastecer los pedidos de fin de año. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en seis años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Lilian solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor y abastecer los pedidos de fin de año.
texts.en:
Lilian is 43 years old, single, and has two children who are 7 and 16 years old. Her business is making sheets and comforters. She is a good mother - responsible, hard-working, constant and active. Her business is located in the "Villa Fatima" zone, a place characterized by informal trade and by public transportation that reaches the northern populations of the city. The climate there is cold with winds from the mountains that are 3600 meters (11,800 feet) above sea level. 

Lilian is of dark complexion with dark eyes, long dark hair, average height with a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Aymará which she uses rarely. She uses Spanish for business. She shares her life with her three children; the two eldest ones are in school and she cares for the youngest one. 

Lilian works at making sheets, comforters, bedspreads, pillow cases, etc. to sell at wholesale. She does this work at home with her family. Her customers order at wholesale and then resell the items at retail and they contribute ideas such as types of fabrics, themes for children's day, Christmas and other seasons, etc. "I have been doing this work since I was young. In the beginning I made women's clothing until I found my market niche (sheets) and I ran with it..." she states. 

Her dream is to open a store where she can sell her products. She wants to buy fabrics at wholesale so she can satisfy her year-end orders. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the six years that she has been doing this work. This is why she is asking for a loan - to buy fabric at wholesale so she can satisfy her year-end orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale so she can satisfy her year-end orders for sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She has no additional family members. 

Aisha has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days a week. Aisha sells her products from home on a retail basis. 

Aisha has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Aisha include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease the difficulty of transportation. 

Aisha lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Adriana es madre soltera, recientemente inició un  negocio de venta de ropa el cual ubica en su casa, su propósito es trasladarse a un local más espacioso donde pueda ampliar su clientela ofreciendo mayor cantidad de artículos y de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos . Para lograr su meta necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000.ºº) con lo cual comprará nueva mercadería para continuar con su proyecto. Para Adriana es muy importante este negocio ya que le permitirá poder generar las ganancias para darle el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana is a single mother. She recently started a clothes retail business which she runs from her house. Her goal is to move to a larger premises so she can attract more customers by offering a bigger variety of clothes which will in turn enable her to make a bigger profit.

To reach her goal she needs a loan of one million colons (¢1,000,000.ºº) which she will use to buy new merchandise to continue with her project. This business is very important to Adriana because it enables her to generate her own income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 pants for men, 10 pants for women, 10 shirts for men, 10 blouses, and 10 suits for children.

loans.name: Rafael Alfonso

texts.es:
Rafael de 24 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° grado de educación básica debido a que de pequeño ayudaba a su padre en el trabajo, terminaba muy cansado y no rendía en sus estudios por lo que dejo la escuela para trabajar. Su esposa es ama de casa, con él viven 7 personas pero solo su esposa e hijo dependen de él.

Rafael es comerciante, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este negocio, inicio ayudando a un tío, con el que aprendió y al ver que el negocio era muy bueno y dejaba buenos resultado decidió poner su negocio, además tiene una granja de pollos de engorde con la cual le apoya su esposa cuando esta anda trabajando. No tiene horario fijo de trabajo, ya que en ocasiones se termina rápido su venta y en otras tarda más.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una motocicleta para agilizar su negocio, por el momento su producto lo moviliza en un canasto colocado en una bicicleta, es muy cansado y carga muy poca mercadería cosa que resolvería la motocicleta y así tendría más tiempo para cuidar su granja.

Rafael espera mejorar su negocio, aumentando sus ventas, pero lo que más desea es seguir estudiando hasta terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rafael is 24 years old. He is married and has a 2 year old son. He was only able to go to school up the 6th grade os primary school because from the time he was little he helped his father with his work. He would be very tired when he finished and didn't so well at his studies and that is why he left school to work. His wife is a housewife. Seven people live with him, but only his wife and son depend on him.

Rafael is a merchant. He has had this business for two years. He started by helping an uncle. With what he learned from seeing that it was a good business and brought good results, he decided to open his business. He also has a big broiler chicken farm that his wife helps him with when he is working. Sometimes he finishes his sales quickly and sometimes it takes him longer. 

The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to speed up his business. At this time he moves his product in a basket mounted on his bike. It's very tiring and he can load very little merchandise. This would be resolved with the motorcycle and this way he will have more time to take care of his farm. 

Rafael hopes to improve his business, but what he wants the most is to keep going to school so he can finish college.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a biodigester transforming waste into energy.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.en:
Juan José decided to invest in a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to reduce his operating costs and improve his farm's productivity. He dedicates himself to raising cows and sheep, as well as selling their milk. He cultivates the forage to feed his animals on his plot of land, as well as corn for his family's own consumption. 

Juan José's expenses in energy supply (fossil fuel-based LP gas and wood) to cook and heat water take away an important part of his income, which is why he was very interested in producing his own biogas and biofertilizer from a simple and available resource: his animals' manure. With the biodigester, he will be able to eliminate  these expensive and contaminating energy sources, replacing them by renewable energy. He will also be able to increase the yield of his crops in a natural way, spreading the potent and nutrient-rich organic fertilizer on his field. With the savings he will make, he plans to send his son to finish high school and would like to expand his farm.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 6 cubic meter waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 31 años de edad, esta casado y tiene una hija de un año de edad, solo estudió hasta 2° grado de educación básica porque su familia no tenia la capacidad económica para darle el estudio, su esposa es ama de casa y cuida a su hija, solo ellas viven con él.
Pedro es agricultor, aprendió el oficio trabajando con su padre, también tiene un molino de nixtamal en el que ofrece servicios de molienda.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes para el maíz y repuestos para el motor de su molino, garantizando así una buena cosecha y la estabilidad de su negocio. Pedro sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudio como fruto del esfuerzo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Pedro, 31 years old, is married and has a one-year-old daughter. He only studied through the 2nd grade of primary education because his family did not have the financial resources to give him an education. His wife is a housewife and cares for his daughter. They are the only ones who live with him.

Pedro is a farmer. He learned the job working with his father. He also has a nixtamal [boiled corn] mill, with which he offers milling services.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer for the corn and spare parts for his mill's motor, thus guaranteeing a good harvest and the stability of his business. Pedro dreams of his children finishing their studies as the fruit of the effort from his work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the corn and spare parts for his mill's motor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa de 30 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 y un año de edad solo el mayor estudia. Ella estudió hasta 3er grado de educación básica su esposo es militar y trabaja en la fuerza armada.

Rosa es ama de casa y sus ingresos dependen del trabajo del esposo, antes trabajaba de empleada doméstica cuidando unos niños pero desde que se acompañó dejo de trabajar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar madera, 4 tablones, 5 vigas 200 varas de tusa y 5 libras de clavos de 5 pulgadas y pagara la mano de obra del carpintero que va a reparar la casa. Sueña con reparar toda su casa y no tener que pasar incomodos otra época lluviosa por la filtración del agua, además de que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, is married and has three children aged 8, 4 and 1. Only the oldest goes to school. 

She studied through the 3rd grade. Her husband is in the military and works for the armed forces. 

Rosa is a housewife and her income is dependent on her husband. Previously she worked as a maid taking care of children but since she has been married she stopped working. 

She is requesting a loan to buy wood, 4 boards, 5 beams, 200 rods, 5 pounds of 5 inch nails and to pay for a carpenter to repair her house. 

She dreams of fixing the whole house in order to not be uncomfortable for another rainy season due to rain coming in. She also dreams of her children studying.

loans.use: to buy wood, 4 boards, 5 beams, 200 rods, 5 pounds of 5 inch nails and to pay for a carpenter to repair her house.

loans.name: Dahabu's Group

texts.en:
Dahabu is a forty-eight year old Komaza tree farmer. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She is married and her spouse is a farmer, too. 

In addition to growing trees, Dahabu also cultivates maize, cowpeas and cassava, and supports her family by selling coconut leaves (makuti) for roof thatching. She decided to join Komaza, and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate her children through high school and university. Her favorite part about working with Komaza is enjoying the good trees growing fast. 

Dahabu is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
Edward has 7 children and is  described as a very hardworking individual. He was selected to become the group leader of his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District.  He is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Edward has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming supplies but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Edward is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 4.25 acres will be planted by Edward's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize.

loans.name: Timothy's Group

texts.en:
Timothy has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. He is 68 years old, married, and has 8 children.

Timothy likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Timothy plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Timothy’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 13 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Visitecas Group

texts.en:
Santa María Visitación is a town located high above the beautiful Lake Atitlán, in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is one of just a few towns in the country with absolutely no illiteracy. The population is very enthusiastic and hard-working and strives to move ahead in their lives.
Seven women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Triunfadoras Visitecas” meaning “The Victorious Women of Visitecas”. They strive to create a higher standard of living and a more prosperous future for their children and the community at large. The women have requested a loan from Friendship Bridge and are hopeful that it will be funded by KIVA investors.
The President of the Trust Bank is Doña Alida who studied to be a teacher. She is 42 years of age with two children. One of her children is in elementary school and the other, who is a teenager, is attending middle school. Doña Alida is thrilled about this and highly motivated to create additional income so that her children can study in a university in the future. She understands the importance of formal education. Last year, Doña Alida opened a business selling delicious fruit sorbets. She is requesting a loan to buy fruit, flavoriings and supplies to improve the quality of her iced treats. Doña Alida also raises chickens and will use some of her funds to buy feed for them.
During their monthly meetings, the ladies in the “Triunfadoras Visitecas” Trust Bank learn that they do have a voice, through games, drawings and role playing; the women learn how to more effectively care for their children with new information about nutrition, health and hygiene. They gather information about effective business practices like formulating effective business plans, budgeting, accounting, marketing and customer service. They feel more empowered and informed and this greatly raises their self-esteem. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of small loans and education “Microcredit Plus”. Quite simply, it works.
It is nearly impossible for an impoverished woman to secure a loan in a banking institution. In funding these loans, KIVA investors, partnering with Friendship Bridge, provide a most valuable opportunity to these women. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the fruit sorbet she sells

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose, pictured above, has been a farmer for 14 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 35 years old, is married, and has five children.

Rose likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rose plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Rose’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es  madre de familia, estudia y a la vez enseña en la escuela para así cubrir sus gastos en el instituto donde estudia y en la casa.
Una de sus aspiraciones es obtener mi título en profesorado en educación bilingüe  y dar un mejor  futuro a su hijo y a la vez salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por cumplir con su objetivo como persona y estudiante
texts.en:
Sonia is a mother to her family. She studies as well as teaches in school in order to cover her university fees where she studies as well as her household bills.

One of her aspirations is to get her degree as a teacher in bilingual education and give a better future to her son and also to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan so that she can pay her university fees, and so be able to continue to strive for her goal as a person and as a student.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Barranche Group

texts.en:
Barranche is a village in the Totonicapan Department of the Southwestern Highlands of Guatemala. Eight K’iche Maya ladies, who live in this village, have formed The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Margaritas de Barranche.” 

One of the youngest members of the group is Patricia, who is less than 20 years old and only has five years of education. She was forced to abandon her education due to the poverty of her family. A couple of years ago, Patricia began her own family and now has two children. Her children are the motivation for her daily hard work. In order to earn income to sustain her family, she and her husband sell jackets (ponchos) and dusters. On a daily basis, her husband sells their goods walking about the village, while Patricia sells on market days in the plaza of a nearby village. This husband and wife team work hard in order to create beneficial conditions where their children can be healthy and get an education. Patricia is requesting a new loan in order to purchase merchandise to increase sales of jackets (ponchos) and dusters. 

The ladies of the “Margaritas de Barranche” Trust Bank participate in educational sessions at their monthly meetings. As many have had little or no education, this is the first time that they are learning about useful subjects like health, nutrition, hygiene, family planning, women’s rights, and self-esteem. They are more effective entrepreneurs with information about budgeting, accounting, marketing, customer service, and indebtedness. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus,” and it is most effective.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to increase sales of jackets (ponchos) and dusters.

loans.name: Laban's Group

texts.en:
Laban, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. He is 45 years old, is married, and has 12 children.

Laban likes to think of himself as a very trustworthy person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013, and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Laban plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair his home.

In total, Laban’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is 25 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Nancy is representing her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Nancy's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Nancy and her group will receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Allan's Group

texts.en:
Allan is a 60-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Allan has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Allan described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Allan’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Micheal's Group

texts.en:
Micheal, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 15 farmers in Webuye District. He is 65 years old, is married, and has eight children.

Micheal likes to think of himself as a very trustworthy person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Micheal plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Micheal’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and has nine children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Elizabeth has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Elizabeth also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Elizabeth's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nilda Melissa

texts.es:
Nilda a sus 30 años de edad, vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos, siendo el sostén de su familia su padre y uno de sus hermanos.
Nilda desea culminar sus estudios de maestría titulándose en el área de Ciencias Económicas. Se considera una joven entusiasta, responsable, disciplinada en cada una de sus actividades diarias  sobre todo muy honesta, menciona que la honestidad es la principal razón por la que una persona logra lo que se propone.
Su motivación es poder superarse de manera profesional en un ambiente laboral competitivo que le permita desempeñarse y mostrar sus conocimientos aprendidos y así obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y de quienes la rodean.
Nilda considera que el poder realizarse como profesional y ejerciendo su carrera de economía, puede generar muchos aportes que contribuyan al desarrollo de su país en donde se requiere de personas dispuestas a superarse de manera digna y honesta evitando así el conflicto entre personas donde sus acciones conllevan a la violencia.
La joven menciona que en el transcurso de su vida universitaria aprendió a esforzarse, menciona que sus estudios fueron costeados por sus padres ya que la universidad no exigía de gastos que ellos no pudieran  cubrir, pero al momento de querer obtener su maestría, ella decidió afrontar los retos y los costos con mucho sacrificio, es por eso que se siente orgullosa de ser quien es y de poder honrar a sus padres de la mejor manera.
Nilda espera ejercer su carrera y a la vez aplicar sus conocimientos para alcanzar la meta dentro de alguna empresa desea ser gerente y brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Nilda, at the age of 30, lives with her parents and siblings. Her father and one of her brothers are the support for the family.

Nilda wants to complete her master's studies, with a degree in the area of Economic Sciences. She considers herself an enthusiastic, responsible, and disciplined young woman in each one of her daily activities. Above all, she is very honest. She mentions that honesty is the principle reason for which a person achieves what they propose.

Her motivation is to be able to better herself in a professional manner in a competitive work environment that will allow her to perform and demonstrate  her acquired knowledge and thus obtain better income that will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family and of those who surround her.

Nlida considers that the power to fulfill herself as a professional and pursue her career in economics can generate many contributions to the development of her country, where people are needed who are ready to improve themselves in an honest and worthy manner, avoiding the conflict between people where their actions involve violence.

The young woman mentions that in the course of her university life, she learned to work hard. She mentions that her education was expensive for her parents, since the university didn't require expenses that they couldn't cover, but at the moment of wanting to obtain her master's, she decided to face the challenges and costs with great sacrifice. It is for that reason that she feels proud of being who she is and of being able to honor her parents in the best way. Nilda hopes to pursue her career and at the same time apply her knowledge to reach the challenge within some business. She wants to be a manager and offer the best to her family.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in Economic Sciences

loans.name: Doris Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Doris, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 25 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Webuye Distric, Kenya. She is married and has four children.

Doris is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Doris says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to save more money, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Doris will use the profits from this season to repair her home.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Tjetjep

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Tjetjep. He is one of the Ruma agents who is selling mobile phone airtime and serves utility bill payments to his community. 

Tjetjep is happily married.  He and his wife have been blessed with two children; one is a 6-year-old son and the other is 3-year-old daughter. This small family lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. As the head of the family, Tjetjep’s main job is a security officer at an office building in Jakarta, but he also works part-time in managing his family’s car repair shop.  

Three months ago, Tjetjep met a Ruma field staff who introduced him to Ruma. He was interested to join as he sees the potential, and is excited to learn about mobile technology. For the last months, Tjetjep has not only learned about how to improve his business, but also to impact to his surrounding community through technology.

Now, the demand for mobile airtime is increasing. Tjetjep is applying for a working capital loan from Kiva in order to process more airtime transactions. In the near future, Tjetjep plans to add new products from Ruma to the things he sells, such as e-commerce service for low-income communities via agents like him. In the photo, Tjetjep is the one who is pictured standing in the car repair shop he manages.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and clothing for the Christmas season. With this income, she wants to grow as a microentrepreneur and give what is necessary to her daughters.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 35 years old and has been working in retail for more than 20 years. He has a small retail store in which he sales plastic and home cleaning products. He works with his wife. He is asking for a loan to buy more products for the end of year retail season. Daniel says that this has been the family business and is what he likes to do. One of his biggest accomplishments is buying a taxi that one of his brothers drives and it works as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy home cleaning products for his store.

loans.name: Rismanto

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Rismanto. Rismanto is a 30-year-old man who owns and manages a small shop that sells mobile phone SIM cards, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. Rismanto is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with a child. Together, this small family lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Living in Jakarta means high living costs for Rismanto and his family. Therefore, to support his family’s needs, Rismanto decided to join Ruma three months ago. He is excited to do business as a Ruma agent, not only because he can raise his income by selling out mobile phone airtime credits, but also because he can learn more about mobile technology use for businesses.

As the demand for mobile airtime increases (especially on the weekends), Rismanto is applying for a working capital loan from Kiva in order to process more airtime transactions. In the near future, Rismanto plans to add more products from Ruma to the things he sells, such as utility bill payment services and product catalogue services, to his community. In the photo, Rismanto is the one who is pictured standing in front of his small stall.

loans.use: to provide more mobile phone airtime transactions

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino tiene 31 años, es soltero vive en casa familiar con padres. Sabino es una persona con buenas referencias familiares y personales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Sabino se dedica a la crianza de animales menores(patos, conejos, cerdos, pollos, entre otros). Desde hace aproximadamente más de 5 años. Sabino necesita préstamo para compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde balanceado para los animales ya que se acerca la campaña navideña y también para hacer arreglos en sus corrales(lugar donde cría a sus animales) pra criarlos en mejores condiciones y una mejor calidad. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sabino is 31 years old, and lives with his parents in their family home. Sabino has very good personal and family references and comes from a close-knit family. He lives in a farming, ranching and commercial community located in the district of Saña, Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. 

For approximately five years, Sabino has worked raising small animals (ducks, rabbits, pigs, chickens, and others). Sabino needs a loan in order to buy pigs and balanced growing rations for the animals, now that the Christmas season is drawing near, and also in order to make repairs to his pens so that he can raise them to a higher quality and in better conditions. In the short term, this will allow him to increase his income, thereby increasing the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and balanced growing rations for the animals, and to make repairs to their pens.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge de 29 años de edad inició su actividad comercial en el año 2011, después de haber aprendido ayudando a un vecino a vender bolsas plásticas y viajando a una ciudad fronteriza para comercializarlas al por mayor. Cuando el patrón de Jorge falleció, quedó con buenas relaciones con  los clientes y pasado un tiempo, cuando su hermana propietaria de una miscelánea, le propuso alquilársela, no dudó en hacerle la contrapropuesta de comprársela y así logró generar ingresos mediante esta negociación, aprovechan a sus antiguos clientes, pues la propuesta finalmente fue aceptada por su hermana. Hoy después de 3 años su negocio continúa y vende artículos de miscelánea,  bisutería, papelería, ropa, productos desechables y hasta helados. En la actualidad Jorge se propone hacer crecer su negocio y por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para elaborar comidas rápidas como panes, salchichas, salsas, verduras entre otros ingredientes, pues también tiene experiencia en esta actividad y desea retomarla, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en ropa y accesorios, alusivos a las navidades y el año nuevo que se acercan y con ello las exigencias de sus clientes son mayores. Su inversión impactará positivamente el negocio de Jorge, pues  incrementará sus ventas y obtendrá un ingreso adicional por el nuevo negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jorge, 21 years old, started his business in 2011 after having learned by helping a neighbor to sell plastic bags and travelling to a border town to sell them wholesale. When Jorge's boss passed away, he was left with good relations with his clients, and after some time, when his sister, who owned a corner shop, offered to rent it to him, he didn't hesitate in making a counter-offer to buy it. By making good use of his old client relations, he managed to generate income, and in the end his sister accepted the proposal.

Today, after three years, his business continues to sell general goods, accessories, stationery, clothing, disposable goods, and even ice cream. Jorge has resolved to keep his business growing, and for this reason he is requesting a loan, his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase supplies to make fast food, such as as breads, sausages, sauces, vegetables among other ingredients, as he also has experience in this area and would like to take it up again. The rest of the money will be invested in clothing and accessories related to Christmas and New Year's, which are approaching. as his customers have higher demands this time of year. Your investment will positively impact Jorge's business by increasing his sales and adding an additional source of income in fast food, making yours a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy as breads, sausages, sauces, vegetables among other ingredients for his fast food business

loans.name: Jesie

texts.es: Jesie de 41 años de edad, se dedica al a venta de productos de aseo personal, cosmeticos y productos alimenticios, también ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal en su sala de belleza desde hace 20 años, aprovechando su gran inclinación por la belleza y la estética, actividad a la que se dedicó en primera instancia, y que posteriormente fue agregando la comercialización de artículos de aseo personal, cosmeticos y productos alimenticios, aprovechando el mercado cautivo que había construido. Su meta hoy, es incrementar el número de clientes y ampliar en infraestructura su peluquería, aunque su mayor desafio es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para lograr su  propósito de manera oportuna. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos de peluquería como shampoos, masajes, tintes, esmaltes de uñas, limas, entre otros y cosmeticos. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, pues ampliará su oferta al público y comprará de contado, para obtener descuentos que aplicará a los precios, con lo que sus clientes se verán beneficiados, y justamente esto es el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Jesie is 41 years old and she has worked selling personal care products, cosmetics and foodstuffs, at her beauty salon for 20 years, taking advantage of her interest in beauty and aesthetics.  She started out as a beautician and later started incorporating sales of various products (personal care products, cosmetics and foodstuffs), taking advantage of the captive audience she has built up.  Her current goal is to increase her number of clients and expand the infrastructure of her salon, though her greatest challenge is not having enough working capital to achieve her goal in a timely way.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be the first time she finances with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy supplies for her salon and assorted merchandise.  With this investment, her business will improve as she will expand what she offers to the public and she will buy in cash to get discounts applied to the prices.  This will benefit her clients, which will mean her Kiva loan is a success.

loans.use: to buy and sell personal care products, cosmetics and foodstuffs,

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela del Maestro de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Unidos Venceremos. Este es un grupo de personas formado por 11 señoras y 2 señores que tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo con el cual se han ayudado mucho para salir adelante, ellos se dedican a diferentes actividades, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios,).
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Gloria, tiene 59 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes, ella vive con la mamá.
Doña Gloria es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto a su madre, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como aceite, arroz, detergentes, carne, pescado, queso y otros productos, ella también ahí mismo tienen un restaurante en el cual los fines de semana venden almuerzos y meriendas, su mamá le ayuda con el negocio  ella tiene más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad para surtir aun más su tienda y para preparar los alimentos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
In the Maestro residential community in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi and known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the Unidos Venceremos [United We Shall Conquer] credit group meets every 2 weeks.

This group is made up of 11 women and 2 men, who some time ago, decided to get together and form this group, through which they have helped themselves get ahead. They make their living in different activities (commerce, sales, production, and services).

One of the members of this group is Gloria. She is 59 years old. She is separated, and from this relationship, she has 5 independent, adult children. She lives with her mother.

Gloria is a woman who likes to work in order to get ahead with her mother. She has a convenience store in her house, where she sells all types of necessities, such as oil, rice, detergents, meat, fish, cheese, and other products.

In the same place, she also has a restaurant, where they sell lunches and snacks on the weekends. Her mother helps her with the business. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and this is how she makes a living.

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, detergents, sausages, and other staple items to stock her store even more and to prepare the food.

She has been with the credit group for two semesters, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to have good health for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergent, sausages, and other primary necessities

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Siti, a micro-entrepreneur from Jakarta, Indonesia. Jakarta has been known as the most populous city in Indonesia and in Southeast Asia. Siti is married, and she has been blessed with a 14-year-old son. Her husband had passed away years ago, and now Siti and her son live only with each other. To support their living, Siti runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits.

Siti met a Ruma field staff who introduced her to Ruma. She got excited and decided to try the mobile phone airtime business. For the last three months Siti has been running the business really well, and now the demand for mobile phone airtime is increasing. Therefore, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile phone airtime transactions. Most of her customers are her own female neighbors who have also adopted mobile phones. 

As the business runs, Siti plans to add more mobile services to her community, such as a utility bill payment service. In the photo, Siti is pictured standing in front of her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services to her community.

loans.name: Joyce Guicela

texts.es:
Joyce es una joven de 23 años de edad, nació en el departamento de La Paz, vivió con sus padres y sus abuelos maternos hasta que cumplió cinco años. Durante ese tiempo Joyce tuvo que afrontar el divorcio de sus padres, sin embargo, ellos hicieron todo lo posible por llevar una buena relación, tiempo después cuando cumplió trece años su madre se volvió a casar y nació su hermano, quien se ha convertido en una de sus más grandes motivaciones para  seguir adelante.  

Actualmente Joyce trabaja como auxiliar en una empresa de transporte y al terminar su turno, se va a la universidad a estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales, por lo que solicita un crédito educativo para poderla culminar ya que los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar. 

Joyce agradece a todas las personas que a través de sus aportes puedan ayudarla a cumplir con su sueño que es titularse y así ser un ejemplo de vida para su hermano menor.
texts.en:
Joyce is a 23-year-old young woman. She was born in La Paz department and lived with her parents and her maternal grandparents until she turned 5. At that time, Joyce had to deal with her parents' divorce, however they did everything possible to have a good relationship and later, when she was 13, her mother remarried and her brother was born, which has become one of her greatest motivations to continue onward.

Currently, Joyce works as an assistant in a transportation business and when she finishes her shift, she goes to the university to study for her degree in Environmental and Natural Resource Engineering, for which she asks for an educational loan to be able to finish it since she uses the income that she earns to help with the household expenses.

Joyce is grateful to all the people who, through their support, can help her to achieve her dream which is to get a degree and in this way be a living example for her younger brother.

loans.use: To pay for her Environmental and Natural Resource Engineering program.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 41 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Virginia has been pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from selling bread. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Nuraiym

texts.ru: Нурайым, 48 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей школьного возраста. Нурайым в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад. Благодаря упорному труду Нурайым в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров. Нурайым в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для разведения. Она является членом группы "Эки Орук", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита Нурайым вложит в расширение бизнеса и постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Nuraiym is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two school-age children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 21 years and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns five cows.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to the "Bai Tushum" bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy sheep for breeding.  Nuraiym is a member of the "Eki Oruk" group, which comprises two more members.  She will reinvest the earnings from her loan to expand her business and to build a large barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and expand her business.

loans.name: Nine

texts.en:
Nine is a micro entrepreneur who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Her main source of income is selling goods over the Internet. Nine joined Ruma three months ago because she realized that by selling mobile phone airtime and serving utility bill payments, she would be able to provide good access to services for low-income communities in the peri-urban area in which she lives now.  

Nine is also excited about Ruma’s new product that works like e-commerce for such a community. People can buy products ranging from school supplies, fashion products, and kitchenware, to the latest gadgets, just by visiting the nearest authorized Ruma shop. The demand for mobile phone airtime and bill payment services is increasing, especially on weekends. Nine hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to process more of these transactions. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 64 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, detergent soap, diapers, face powder, etc. 

Adela has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Adela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, detergent soap, diapers, face powder, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has four children who are currently in school. Edna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Edna has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella works hard to support her family. Annabella is married and has a business buying and selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Annabella requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tons of sand and gravel to sell.

Annabella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tons of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Suwarno

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Suwarno. Suwarno is a Ruma agent who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Suwarno is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with two daughters; one is three years old, and the other is eight months.  As the head of the family, Suwarno realizes he needs extra income to save for his children’s education.  

About one and a half years ago, Suwarno met a Ruma field staff that made him decide to start a business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments to his surrounding community. Suwarno now has become a successful agent, since his customers are people in peri-urban areas who are in need of access to such services. 

As the business runs, Suwarno hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva that will be used to process more mobile airtime and bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the near future, Suwarno plans to add more products from Ruma to the things he serves, such as e-commerce for low-income communities. Suwarno is the one in the photo who’s holding his mobile phone, which he uses for transactions.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Alice  tem 53 anos de idade, é casada e tem 4 filhos com idade escolar. O seu esposo é reporter de um jornal nacional e o seu horario de trabalho é das 07:00h as 15:30h. Eles sustentam também uma sobrinha que perdeu os seus pais e vive com eles.
Alice é negociante e vende no quintal da sua casa. O emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de um fardo de roupas, cerveja, carne, ovos, refrescos e arroz, para reforcar o seu negocio.
  Alice tem como esperanca fazer crescer o seu negocio e dar acompanhamento nos estudos dos seus filhos ate ao ensino superior. O seu maior desafio e de construir uma mercearia maior no quintal da sua casa, e tambem concluir a sua casa uma vez que ainda esta em obras para melhor confortar a sua familia
texts.en:
Alice is 53 years old and is married with 4 children, all of whom are in school. Her husband works as a reporter for a national newspaper, and works every day from 7:00am to 3:30pm. Along with their children, they also help care for a niece who lost her parents and lives with them.

Alice owns a store situated in the yard of her house where she sells various items. With this loan, she will buy a bundle of clothing and meat, eggs, rice, beer and other drinks to sell from her store. Alice hopes to expand her business and help her children stay in school through college.

Alice's main goal is to build a larger store in her yard and also to finish construction of her house so that her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: buy a bundle of clothing and meat, eggs, rice, beer and other drinks to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru:
Майсара экономически активная жительница района Дангара. Ей 41 год. Она вместе с мужем занимается торговлей на рынке. В 2009 году Майсара и ее муж открыли свой маленький торговый бизнес по купле и продаже парфюмерии, заколок, резинок и других аксессуаров. Доход с бизнеса является единственным доходом семьи. У Майсары четверо детей. Сыновьям по 17 и 15 лет, а дочерьям по 16 и 5 лет. Все ее дети, кроме младшей дочери учатся. Майсара вместе с мужем стараются обеспечить детям хорошее образование, здравоохранение и питание. Поэтому они усердно работают на рынке без выходных. 
Сейчас Майсара хотела бы обновить ассортимент парфюмерии на своей лавке. С такой целью она обратилась за кредитом. Майсара верит в вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: Maysara is an economically active resident of the Dangara district. She is 41 years old. She and her husband are involved in retail business at the market.
