In 2009, they opened their own small retail outlet and they currently buy and sell perfumes, hair clips, elastic bands and other accessories.  The earnings they make from this business is the family's only source of income.  Maysara has four children: two boys (17 and 15 years old), and two daughters (16 and 5).  All her children, except her youngest daughter, are currently in school.  Maysara and her husband strive to give their children a good education, quality healthcare and good nutrition.  For this reason, they work very hard at the market and they do not take any days off.  Maysara would like to renew her inventory of perfumes.  For this reason, she has requested a loan.  She is confident that you will support her.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Benjamin Lito

texts.es:
Benjamin es un hombre de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 5 años, y su negocio es la chapa y pintura automotriz.
Él es independiente, buen padre, paciente, emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona sur de la ciudad, un lugar que reúne una vez al año cerca de mil artesanos en la denominada feria de ‘la Alasita’ dónde se oferta todo tipo de bienes en miniatura con el fin de que esa miniatura se materialice y se haga realidad (la creencia dice que se compran sueños para que se hagan realidad, por ejemplo: un auto en miniatura se materializa –al pasar un año- en un automóvil de verdad). De clima cálido tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura constante de 30 grados aproximadamente durante todo el año.
Benjamin es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la venta de empanadas y con su hijo que ya va a entrar a la escuela. Su negocio es el arreglo de chapa y pintura para automóviles; su trabajo principal es la reparación de carrocerías de automóviles que han sufrido accidentes o impactos y han quedado deterioradas estética o estructuralmente. Para realizar su trabajo primero se debe lavar el área a trabajar con jabón y agua. Luego procede a lijar el área que se quiere pintar con una lijadora de disco, aproximadamente 12.5 centímetros de cualquier lado del área dañada, luego pega tres capas de periódico alrededor del área lijada, Rocía el área lijada con cinco capas de base para automóvil, Después de la capa final, permite que la pintura se cure por dos días. “el pintado de autos es un arte que me permite jugar con los colores y tonos hasta que quede perfecto…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de un motor para su bomba de aire. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 16 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Benjamin solicita un préstamo para la compra de una bomba de aire para realizar la pintura a los automóviles dañados de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a 39 year old man who lives with his partner and his son of 5 years old and has a car repairing and painting business. He is independent, a good father, patient, entrepreneurial, responsible and hard-working.  He has his business in the south of the city, a place where once per year thousands of people come to sell their arts and crafts in a fair called "la Alasita" where all types of different miniature goods are offered with the idea that the miniature good materializes and becomes a reality (the belief is that you buy dreams so that they can become a reality, for example; a miniature car materializes one year later to become a real car).  The area has a warm tropical climate with a constant 30 degrees Celsius temperature throughout the whole year.

Benjamin is of dark complexion, has short black hair, is quite short, his mother tongue is Guaraní but he also speaks Spanish due to the culture and for his business. He shares his live with his partner who makes a living selling empanadas and also lives with his son who will be starting school soon.

He has his own business fixing and painting automobiles.  He mainly does auto body repair for cars which have been damaged due to accidents or impacts which have caused both esthetical or structural damage.  In order to do his work he must first clean the area of the car with soap and water.  Then he must sand the area which needs to be painted with a disc sander to about 12.5 centimeters on both sides of the damaged area.  Finally, he applies 3 coats of newspaper to the damaged area to then spray the sanded area with 5 coats of automotive paint.  After the final coat of paint is applied he allows it to dry for 2 days: "painting vehicles is an art work which allows you to play with colors and tones until it becomes perfect..." he mentions. 

His dream is to have his own house and he wants to invest in his business by buying a motor for his air pump.  This is the second sequence of loans with this institution in the last 16 years which has done this same activity.  It is for the reason that Benjamin is requesting the loan, to buy an air pump to paint the damaged cars of his clients.

loans.use: to buy an air pump to paint his clients' damaged cars

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 53 year old; married woman with three children. Two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers. Evelyn has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juacinta

texts.en:
Juacinta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, etc. for her business. Juacinta has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juacinta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Erejen

texts.en:
Erejen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Erejen is 28 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Erejen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Erejen requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Erejen has been in this business for four years. In the future, Erejen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and has four children. Evelyn is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Norma is 42 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Norma has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 68 years old and widowed with six children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been in pig fattening for 14 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy solar lanterns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия жительница маленького городка под названием Куляб. Куляб расположен в южной стороне Таджикистана. Зулфие 41 год. Она разведена с мужем и живет вместе с сыном. Сыну 21 год. Зулфия дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она работает на дому и также дома принимает клиентов. Зулфия занимается этой деятельностью уже 5 лет. За такой срок она хорошо освоила свою работу. У Зулфии на пути имеет преграда, из-за которой ей тяжело продолжить свою деятельность. Ее швейная машинка устарела и не выполняет все свои функции. Она решила скорее купить швейную машинку, чтобы не лишиться источника дохода.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a resident of the small city of Kulob, located in southern Tajikistan.  She is 41 years old, divorced from her husband, and she currently lives with her 21-year-old son.  Zulfiya sews women's clothes from home.  She works from home and receives her customers at home too.  She has been involved in this activity for five years and, over that time period, she has become quite skilled at her work. However, Zulfiya is currently facing a hurdle, which is making it hard for her to continue her activity.  Her old sewing machine is no longer fulfilling all its functions.  This is the reason why she has decided to buy a new sewing machine, so that she won't lose her source of income

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and keep her source of income.

loans.name: Futuma

texts.en: Futuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells seven days a week. She sells to all categories of people. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. She hopes to buy a plot of land to start farming. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is grateful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan which she used to buy gardening materials (wire and baskets) and supplies (seed and fertilizer) needed in her pineapple farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her farm, she also has a canteen beside their house.

She would like to apply now for a Php 45,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs to increase the crop yield on her farm. Her earnings from her farm are a big help in meeting their daily needs. Part of the loan she will use to pay for the ingredients needed in her canteen. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial assistance that will be given to her. 

Letecia dreams of growing her farm, and having a decent place for her canteen. She prays to stay healthy and that through her hard work she will be able to save for her old age, since she is now a widow.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer to be used in her business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Fe has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years. Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy works hard to support her family. Ma. Daisy is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Daisy requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her business.

Ma. Daisy has been in this business for six years now.

Ma. Daisy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business. Anecita has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 53 years old and married with four children.  She is in the agricultural business of farming corn in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elma has been farming corn for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zibulatudde Development Group

texts.en:
The group named "Zibulatudde," (translated as "you can only lack if you are just seated") is in its fourth loan cycle. This group was formed in the outskirts of Mpigi, a remote area that is still growing and is mostly rural. All of the members are striving to get ahead.

John is the treasurer of the committee. He makes craft mats and also works as a clothing designer. John spends his time by making the effort to help his family and loved ones so that he can provide them a decent life.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy more raw material to make mats to sell, as well as thread and fabrics, so that he can keep expanding. As a result, John will give his family what they need to have a better quality of life. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial boost.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make mats in addition to threads and fabric

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vende principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares que conocen a Luz y quieren que también progrese en su actividad.

Desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes habilidades en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar surtido de productos de belleza y ropa para aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas, obteniendo así unos buenos ingresos para su hogar

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos y al acompañamiento de la Corporación Interactuar.
texts.en:
Luz is a very enterprising woman, and she has a strong desire to go forward and progress.

For 4 years, she has been selling products by catalog, including clothing, accessories, beauty products, and products for the home. These products are sold mainly to the friends, neighbors, and relatives that know Luz and also want her to progress in her activity.

Since she was a child, she felt a strong affinity to business and selling. As a result, today she has great abilities in this field thanks to her kindness and excellent quality of service.

She requests a loan to buy a supply of beauty products and clothing to increase her inventory and improve her sales. This will allow her to obtain more income for her household.

She hopes that she can go forward thanks to the support of people with good hearts that support this type of product and thanks to the support of the Interactuar Corporation.

loans.use: to buy a supply of beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a 23-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is an agricultural center near the famous Rift valley. He owns a small inherited piece of land. On the land, he has kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for seven years. His main income sources are milk and crops. He recently ventured into a small side business to supplement the meager income he earns from mixed farming. 

From Kiva lenders, Kelvin is seeking a loan worth 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to grow his horticulture business. 

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. It is to support horticulture farmers that Juhudi Kilimo has teamed up with Kiva to help Kelvin access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With the loan, Kelvin’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 55 years old and married with four children.  

Vilma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 27 years old and a married man. He has three children, aged 8, 6, and 4; two of the children are attending school. He is a farmer, who grows passion fruit and pineapples for sale and home consumption. He works for 6 days a week and 8 hours a day. He started farming way back in 2008, was motivated by the fact that he wanted to earn a living.

He hopes to use the loan to buy organic manure and pesticides for his plantation. Usually he sells his goods to fellow traders from neighboring trading centres. His hope and dream is to start up a retail business, so that he expands his sources of income.

Edward faces a challenge of pests and diseases which affect his crops and limited capital. He is described as an honest and hard-working man in business. He appreciates the service offered by lenders.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and pesticides for his plantation

loans.name: Amit

texts.en:
Amit is very graceful to know how Kiva lenders helped him financing his rice cultivation. He repaid his loan on time and fully.
He thanks all of you, and requests another loan of SRD 10,000 to continue rice production. 

With the loan, he will purchase inputs just like fertilizer, pesticides, and diesel.

loans.use: To purchase inputs like fertilizer, pesticides, and diesel.

loans.name: Krishne

texts.en:
Krishne thanks all Kiva lenders again for helping him realizing his long-term goals. The last loan he repaid fully and on time. 
With the profits, he has paid the tuition of his children and could renovate his house. 

To continue rice production, he needs another loan of SRD 8,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

With the profits of this loan he plans he will save to send his children to college in the city.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Paulo

texts.pt:
Solteiro de 48 anos de idade, já viveu maritalmente tendo se separado, pai de 2 filhos menores e seus únicos dependentes, vive na casa própria, não muito escolarizado e vivendo a base de negocio de venda de diversos produtos alimentares e bebidas e carne de vaca, ha mais de 15 anos e esta a repetir o credito pela 3ªvez.
Com o mesmo pretende comprar cabeças de gado para abate e posterior venda de carne durante 2 dias, por semana.
Ele gostaria de desenvolver mais o seu negocio e com os lucros comprar uma viatura que lhe possa ajudar e facilitar o seu negocio.
Constitue grande desafio para ele, o facto de ter que alugar sempre o carro para o transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Paulo is 48 years old and is single, having separated from his wife. He has two young children who are the only people that rely on him financially, and he lives in his own home. Paulo has not had much schooling and for more than 15 years he has made a living selling a variety of food items, drinks and meat. This is his third loan with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner].

Paulo will use this loan to buy cattle that he can butcher in order to then sell the meat, for two days each week. He would like to develop this business more and use his earnings to buy a vehicle that he could use to make his work easier. One of his main challenges has been that he always has to rent a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cattle that he can butcher in order to then sell the meat.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Romelia es una mujer de 47 años de edad, divorciada, tiene un hijo varón de 24 años y una hija mujer de 27 años y su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en una zona universitaria de la ciudad, caracterizada por la aglomeración de institutos, universidades, librerías, fotocopiadoras y negocios relacionados a la vida estudiantil. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura ambiente aproximada entre 6-16 grados centígrados que varía durante el día. 
Romelia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, usa lentes de aumento, su lengua materna es el aymará y habla español por el comercio. su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son independientes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos de todo tipo como; yogurt; bebible, con frutas, etc., leche saborizada de; chocolate, frutilla, vainilla, y de todo tamaño, en botella, en bolsita o en envase tetra pack. “en época de clases mi negocio se llena y ls ventas son constantes, en época de vacaciones la venta disminuye al extremo que no tengo clientes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda grande en el centro de la ciudad y vender por mayor todo tipo de productos lácteos porque tiene muchos años de experiencia en el rubro. Ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de productos lácteos para aumentar sus ventas por la temporada de fin de año y recuperar el futuro mes de enero donde no existe venta. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que viene realizando esta actividad. Es por esos motivos que Romelia solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos lácteos por mayor para recuperar el mes de enero donde no existe venta.
texts.en:
Romelia is 47 years old, divorced and has a 24 year old son and a 27 year old daughter. Her business is selling dairy products. She is enterprising, independent, a good listener, strong, a good mother, responsible and a hard-worker.

Her business is located in the university area of the city which has an agglomeration of institutes, universities, bookstores photocopy shops and businesses related to student life. It has a cold and dry climate with an average temperature from 6 to 16 degrees Celsius during the day.

Romelia is dark-skinned, short with long black hair and she uses contact lenses. Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her children who are independent in her own house made from bricks that has running water, electricity and sewerage.

Her business is selling dairy products of all types like yogurt, drinkable and with fruit, etc., milk flavored with chocolate, strawberry, vanilla in all sizes, in bottles, bags and tetra packs. " when school is in my business is full and sales constant. When it is vacation time my sales drop to the extreme of having no clients" she comments.

Her dream is to have a large store in the center of the city selling all kinds of dairy products wholesale since she has many years of experience in the field. She wants to purchase dairy products wholesale to increase her sales for the end of the year season and make up for the month of January when she has no sales.

This is her first loan with the institute in the 25 years she has been in this business. For these reasons Roselia is requesting a loan to buy dairy products wholesale to make up for the month of January when she has no sales.

loans.use: to buy dairy products wholesale to make up for the month of January when there are no sales.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is grateful that he was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in his general store. Through his earnings, he is able to send his child to school and meet their daily living expenses.

He would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, pasta, can goods, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and beverages to meet the increased demand of grocery items this Christmas holiday. His store earnings are a great help to meet his family's basic needs, and for the education of his child. He is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on his investment and for the financial help that will be given him. 

Dante dreams of having a bigger general store to have a more prosperous life. He aims to give his child the best education and lead a happy and quiet life. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which he studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rhaylyn

texts.en:
Her name is Rhaylyn, 25, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Jury, a tricycle driver, and has two kids who are still in the elementary level in school. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support their children's schooling. 

Rhaylyn operates a tricycle and has a small general store. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines especially in the provinces like Palawan, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to the market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even use this mode of transport from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of Php 700 a day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan which she will use for maintenance of her tricycle and also to add some grocery items to her small general store. She is positive that this will boost her income as both tricycle transportation and a general store is really needed in their place of residence.

Rhaylyn dreams to be successful in her business so she can give her children the best education in order for them to have a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her tricycle and add some grocery items for her small store as well.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Her name is Delia, 62, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Avelino, a farmer; their children are already working on their own farms.  She manages their own household while operating the business. She and her husband work hard to continually provide income for their daily needs.

Delia owns a corn and pineapple farm. She grows mostly corn and pineapple in their farm located in Silang. It is in the highlands, where it is suited to grow fruit bearing tress like pineapple. She sells her product to market, and fruit stores that she regularly supplies, and to the local community. Aside from that, she also buys and sells fruit on the side. She earns a minimum of 1,300 in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan that she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs to increase her crop yield. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.  She is wishing everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Delia hopes to grow her business to be able to save for their old age. She prays to stay healthy and for children's family to be happy and united. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs to increase the crop yield on her farm

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in Kipasi, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity of the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflowers, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts (peanuts) and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although bee-keeping has not traditionally been practised in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Moses is married and has 13 children. He runs a small business selling fish and also does farming with his wife. They have now been farming for 10 years and are currently growing maize, sorghum, beans, groundnuts and sunflowers. Moses is excited about bee-keeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Moses' first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his business and pay his children's school fees. Moses' hope for the future is to live a better life and to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Hillary does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but he is an accomplished farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. He is happily married and, together with his beautiful wife, he is blessed with two children. 

For the past 10 years, he has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge he has in farming, farmers from his village and neighboring villages come to his home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, tea, and some personal businesses he engages in to make extra income. 

Hillary sells cereals to his neighbors and to the local market and makes additional money. Although his work is not without challenges, he says, he is regarded as the best cereal seller in his village. 

He has been unable to meet the market demand which has resulted in a loss of tenders. One of his neighbors ordered 100 bags of maize that he was unable to supply. He is seeking a loan to buy more cereals so that he can satisfy the demand. He intends to buy different variety of cereals such as millet, rice, sorghum and maize. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that supports small-scale farmers, Hillary is confident that this loan will permanently change his life. Increased profits from cereal selling will allow him to afford his highest monthly expenses; to pay for farm-related comforts and the ability to channel a surplus amount to his children's education. Hillary is visionary, and he plans to buy a maize milling machine through accumulated profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as millet, rice, sorghum and maize

loans.name: Aynisa

texts.ru:
Айниса обычная сельская женщина, мирно проживающая в селе своего района Дангара. Она замужем за пастуха и в браке имеет двух детей. 
Айнисе уже 49 лет. Она на протяжении более 10 лет вместе с мужем ведет животноводческую деятельность. Они выращивают крупнорогатых скотов для дальнейшей продажи. Это главный источник дохода их семьи. Сейчас Айниса хочет увеличить поголовье скотов, так как их рыночная цена сейчас ниже. На сумму кредита она планирует приобрести пару крупнорогатых скотин и таким образом расширить семеный бизнес. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость и верит в поддержку.
texts.en: Aynisa is an ordinary woman from the countryside.  She lives a peaceful life in a village of the Dangara district.  She is married to a shepherd with whom she has had two children.  Aynisa is now 49 years old.  For the past ten years, she and her husband have been involved in animal husbandry.  They raise cattle for further resale.  This activity constitutes the family's main source of income.  Aynisa now wants to increase her herd because cattle prices are currently low at the market.  She is planning to use her loan to buy two cows, which will lead to an expansion of the family's business.  She is hoping for a positive outcome and she is confident that she will receive some support.

loans.use: to buy a couple of cows to expand her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Jamila, who is in her late 50s, is widowed, with three grown-up children. She has been selling fish for five years now. She works from 4.30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Jamila's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start building her house, to buy a sofa set, a TV set, a deck, and a cupboard for clothes, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more fish to resell. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Jamila will share this loan with her loan group, Chamwino, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would like to apply again for another 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items, like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, charcoal, and canned goods which she sells at retail. She expects an increased demand for grocery items this Christmas Season. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas.

Vilma dreams of having a big grocery store, and aims to give her children the best education possible, for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a single mother of three children. Only one child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

She has a business--a restaurant--and has been in this business for six years. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, flour, beans and beef. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To buy beef, rice, flour, cooking oil, beans and bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Marlon Enrique

texts.es: Marlon, esta dedicado a la venta de peto (producto lácteo elaborado a base de maíz blanco) y a la elaboración de comidas rápidas, inició este negocio en el año 2011, cuando al quedar desempleado y encontrarse en la ciudad de Bogotá, un amigo le propuso venir a Barraquilla y trabajar juntos,  entonces los dos se encargaban de elaborar el producto y salían a venderlo. Un tiempo después decidieron individualizar los negocios, ahora Marlon trabaja en el horario de 4:00 p.m. a 8:00 p.m. todos los días y ofrece sus productos a los habitantes de diferentes barrios en Barranquilla, quienes cancelan de contado. En el negocio de comidas rápidas ofrece perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchipapas, chuzos y los insumos para la preparación de las comidas las compra de contado en graneros y salsamentarías.  Él está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de dos triciclos repartidores de peto para ampliar la cobertura de su negocio y tener más rutas donde vender, así mismo generar empleo. Marlon tiene 28 años de edad y es padre de dos hijas a quienes desea brindar un mejor porvenir y lograr que sean unos profesionales,  por eso él trabaja con compromiso y dedicación.  Su meta en el negocio es ampliarlo de tal forma que cuente con más empleados e incremente su producción.
texts.en:
Marlon sells “peto” (a dairy product made from white corn) and makes fast food. He started this business in 2011, when he was unemployed. He was in the city of Bogotá, and a friend told him to come to Barraquilla, so that they could work together. The two were in charge of making the product, and they went to sell it. After some time, they decided to each make his own business. 

Now, Marlon works from 4:00pm to 8:00pm everyday. He offers his products to residents in different neighborhoods in Barranquilla, and his customers pay in cash. 

In his fast-food business, he offers hot dogs, hamburgers, sausages, and kebabs. He buys the supplies for making the food in cash from granaries and delicatessens. 

He is applying for a Kiva loan, which is his first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchase of two delivery tricycles for “peto.” This will help him increase the coverage of his business and to have more routes where he sells, which will help him generate business. 

Marlon is 28 years old, and he is the father of two daughters to whom he wants to offer the best upbringing and the opportunity to be professionals. For this, he works with commitment and dedication. His goal for his business is to grow his business, have more employees, and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy two delivery tricycles to sell his products.

loans.name: Sugira Group

texts.en: Sugira is a group led by Leoncie who is 42 years old. The group name means “Long life” in English. She has been a group leader for 6 years. She has a shop and has been selling in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, soap and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and rice for sale.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila, 21, is a smallholder mixed farmer from North Rift, Kenya, who is married to a nice, 31-year-old husband. They have been blessed with three kids so far. She is very hardworking and focused. Her primary income sources today are milk, eggs, and maize, among other crops. Sheila is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. This expansion seeks to enhance her family's financial security. The more hens she acquires, the more assets under her name and the more income she makes through egg sales. The hens will also bring other numerous benefits, including chicks, manure, and feathers. The income from this investment will enable Sheila to take better care of her family and pay for her children's education. Lend $25 to improve the quality of life of a wife, a mother, and a progressive lady farmer in Eldoret.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: María Edid

texts.es:
Maria de 55 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para abastecer su negocio. 

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old. She has earned the love of all of her neighbors for her kindness and good sense of humor. She is a housewife, and this is her main reason for fighting everyday and generating the income for her family’s life. Even though she didn’t have resources to start her business, this wasn’t an impediment to achieve her dream of becoming a businesswoman. With a small amount of capital, Maria started a grocery store business.

Her dreams don’t stop. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of shelves where she can display her products and make them more visible and attractive to her clients. She will also buy a supply of products to supply the business. 

She hopes to be able to improve her financial condition, to be able to have no money problems in the future, and to guarantee her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy shelves on which she can display her products.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary, a youthful 28-year-old farmer from Simat, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience, despite personal challenges, and his passion to support his two children as a primary caregiver. 

The living conditions in the Eldoret area are very tough, and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Hillary has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Hillary started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past ten years. Hillary's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that he faces, is delivering to the market on time. 

The Eldoret area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Hillary is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Hillary is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits, he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his children. 

Hillary's dream is to provide a secure future for his children through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Jose Filadelfo

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos, estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica y dejo sus estudios por no tener la capacidad económica para pagarlos. Su esposa es ama de casa y ella y sus padres viven con él.

José es jornalero, siembra granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo y cuando tiene la oportunidad trabaja como auxiliar en albañilería, aprendió estos oficios gracias a su padre, cuando dejo de estudiar este lo llevaba a trabajar al campo. Camina 10 minutos desde su casa para llegar a la parcela sembrada trabaja con su padre de 7:00 am a 12.00 m.

Solicita el crédito para comprar 10 pliegos de lámina, 3 libras de clavos y pagar mano de obra para ampliar su vivienda. Sueña con terminar su habitación para esta cómodo con su familia además colocar ladrillo de piso para evitar el contacto directo con el suelo.
texts.en:
Jose is 25 years old, married and has no children. He attended school until the 6th grade and then stopped because he did not have the economic resources to pay for it. His wife is a housewife; she and her parents live with him. Jose is a day laborer who grows grains such as corn, beans and sorghum. When he has the chance he also works as an assistant bricklayer. He learned these trades thanks to his father who took him to work in the farm when he stopped going to school. He walks 10 minutes from his house to the planted plot were he works with his father from 7:00 am to 12:00 noon.

He is asking for the loan to buy 10 sheets of corrugated metal, 3 pounds of nails and to pay for the labor to expand his house. He dreams with finishing his bedroom to be more comfortable with his family and also with laying bricks on the floor to avoid having direct contact with the ground.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheets of corrugated metal, 3 pounds of nails and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 37 years old and lives with his wife in the outskirts of Mbarara town. He has been working at the lands office for seven years. 

Fred built a few rentals using the loan from UGAFODE, but did not install water and electricity because of the cost it involved.  He now needs a loan to install water and electricity, so that he can make improve the standard of his rentals. This will also help him to increase the rent on them which will raise his income.
 
Fred is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to get enough income for his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children. He is hard working.  Pictured is Fred and his wife.

loans.use: To pay labor and buy plumbing mateials.

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en:
Lusi is 20 years old and lives in the village of Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. She dropped out of school because she couldn't afford paying the tuition fees.

She requested a loan of 300 SSP to expand her business by buying sugar and tea leaves.

Lusi hopes that in the future she will be able to go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her tea-selling business

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
The group is called Twitezimbere, which means “support ourselves” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better. 

Leonille is a group leader, aged 42. She is married and has six children between 4 and 18 years old. All of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running the business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been selling Irish potatoes at the market at retail for the last two years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of Ugandan Shillings 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more Irish potatoes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to be able to buy from the farmers herself and sell at both retail and wholesale. She joined MCDT because the services were taken to the members and because of the short time taken before taking the initial loan and the consequent ones. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm by buying more crops to plant

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a thirty-eight year old Komaza tree farmer. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Catherine is married and her spouse is an assistant chief. In addition to growing trees, Catherine supports her family with subsistence farming.

She decided to join Komaza because she saw her Komaza farmer neighbors' trees growing very fast and she wanted to have a tree farm herself. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to educate her children through college or university.

Catherine’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the knowledge she receives on how to plant trees. Catherine is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Dauda joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 3 children. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Dauda spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Vastina

texts.en:
Vastina used the previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She is a female of fifty-two years old, widowed with three children and three dependents, living in Kasese, Uganda.

Vastina grows crops such as maize, rice, cotton and others to earn a living. Vastina has a dream of educating her children to university, the best gift a parent can offer her children. Vastina is faced with the challenges of floods and droughts which affect her crops. 

Vastina needs a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labour

loans.name: Sebe Allahye Group

texts.fr:
Mme PAGOMDGOALMA  est responsable du groupe SEBE ALLAHYE. Veuve, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans et le moins âgé a 35ans. Personne ne va à l’école. 
Mme vend des pagnes  depuis  10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter 15 complets pagnes.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut ouvrir un grand magasin. Elle ambitionne s’occuper de ses petits fils.
texts.en:
Mrs Pagomdgoalma is responsible for the Sebe Allahye group. She is widowed and the mother of two children. The eldest is 40 and the youngest is 35 years old.

She has been selling traditional "pagne' fabric for the past 10 years. She stocks up in the city markets. She hopes to purchase 15 complete sets of "pagne" with this loan. She will use the profits to open a big store someday, and take care of her grandchildren.

loans.use: purchase 15 traditional cloths

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 50-year-old divorced woman, with five children who are all adults. One of her children is attending school. Aisha deals in agricultural sales and as her other source of income, the sale of secondhand cloths. She works eight hours a day, six days a week, and that makes her be described as a hardworking and honest person. Her business started in 2000, amidst challenges of limited capital and disease. 

Aisha’s business is in Kangabwa and her clients are traders from the neighbourhood. The need to earn a living influenced her to open up this business, and she hopes to expand her secondhand cloths business. 

Aisha wants the loan in order to buy new fabric materials to sell to her customers during this season, when she anticipates a high sales margin and profit. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their resilience in supporting the small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy new fabric materials for sale

loans.name: Sulayiman

texts.en:
Sulayiman is a farmer and works six days a week. Apart from farming, Sulayiman also sells goats as an additional income-generating activity. He has been doing this as his source of income since childhood. His business is situated in his village and his clients are butchers. He is faced with challenges of prolonged drought, poor transport and lack of enough capital to improve his business.

He hopes to use the loan to improve his business by buying more goats and also cows, since it's towards the Christmas season. He hopes his sales will be higher and the business profitable. Sulayiman is described as a hardworking man. He’s very grateful for the services.

loans.use: to buy live stock for trade

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald, aged 32, is married and has four children who are all below the age of 10 years. He operates a boutique shop in Buyamba, which is open 13 hours a day, seven days a week. Ronald started this business way back in 2008 and also does agriculture to supplement the family's income. 

Ronald started a boutique shop that sells mainly ladies' clothes. His customers are women from around his village and the neighboring communities.

Due to the available market for his products, Ronald wants to take out the loan to buy more clothes that he will sell during the Christmas season. His dream is to open another outlet. He faces the challenge of a lack of capital but with this loan he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of dresses and tops to sell

loans.name: Ibrashim

texts.en: Ibrashim is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrashim had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrashim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrashim is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his 3 children are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yunusa A.

texts.en: Yunusa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yunusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yunusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Yunusa  is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel, aged 29, deals in trading general merchandise. He is married with two children aged three and five years old. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy stock for his business. He also rides a boda-boda (moto-taxi) from Ishaka town where he earns additional income to supplement his monthly earnings. He is a hardworking man who works eight hours a day and six days a week.

He started his business in the year 2003 in a rural setting but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work. The business is carried from Karambi, Bushenyi District and his customers are all categories of people and their continued support and his tireless efforts have helped him to grow. He started this very business to be able to have a source of income to cater for his family needs. His major challenge in the business is competition from neighboring shops with similar goods, but he is ready to out compete them through his hard work. He hopes to be financially stable and educate all his children in the future.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items like salt, soap and sugar among other daily household items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with five children, and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business selling charcoal, and she has been in this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Margaret generates additional income through selling bunches of green bananas. She works from home and sells both on a wholesale and retail basis. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinder her movements. Margaret aspires to own delivery vans to ease transportation. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is forty years old, married, and has four children.  He is living in Kasese, Uganda. Peter is a farmer, growing crops and rearing animals. This activity has enabled him to pay school fees for his children and look after his family. Peter has a dream of changing his cows from animal fattening into dairy farming. However, he is faced with the challenge of pests and diseases. Peter has asked for a loan to buy a cow for dairy farming.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hassan Babangida

texts.en: Hassan Babbangida is a maize farmer from Dankwaire village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent more than the market price at harvest time. Hassan Babbangida, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en: Kadii is a forty-one-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a widow. In addition to growing trees, Kadii also cultivates maize and cassava and supports her family by doing casual labour on private farms. She decided to join Komaza to get money in the future for her children and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a charcoal selling business. Kadii’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the planting of trees on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Alh. Ibrahim

texts.en: Alh. Ibrahim is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Alh. Ibrahim is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en: Hasifa is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in the family house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for nine years. Hasifa has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling and frying samosas and chapatti. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to buy a delivery van to ease her transportation, and also to get enough profits to buy a plot of land. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is 40 years old and married with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. Rosalia needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, crops, boots, a machete and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2004. Rosalia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, crops, boots, a machete and a spade

loans.name: Faiga

texts.en: Faiga is a 71-year-old widow with 6 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Faiga needs a loan to buy new boots, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a new machete and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Faiga will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy new boots, chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a new machete and crops

loans.name: Kamiati

texts.en:
Kamiati lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, one of whom is attending school. She is not looking after any other relatives.

She has been selling clothes in the market at retail for the last five years, working six days a week. She also earns extra income from her motorcycle that is used for public transport.

She has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more trousers, shirts and jackets for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices. Her dream is to be able purchase clothes in wholesome bales, instead of buying a few of them for sale. She joined MCDT to promote her business and to get new friends.

She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 38 years old and married with 10 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 8 years. Maria needs a loan to buy a sprayer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a crowbar and crops. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Maria will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sprayer, chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer, a crowbar and crops

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, ha tenido un resultado positivo al invertir el préstamo anterior en su negocio, actualmente tiene  mayor demanda de los productos que ofrece en su tienda, mejoro el inventario de mercadería y junto a su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
Nuevamente Dolores hace un llamado para que se le brinde apoyo con un financiamiento para poder comprar azúcar, granos básicos, sal, bebidas, golosinas, etc., para surtir la tienda y cubrir las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en: María has had a positive result upon investing her previous loan in her business. Today she has greater demand for the products she sells in her store. She improved her merchandise inventory and with her family has a better quality of life. Today Dolores asks for financing support to be able to buy sugar, basic grains, salt, beverages, candy, etc. to stock her store and cover the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, basic grains, salt, beverages, candy, etc. to stock her store and cover the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Rafael María

texts.es:
Rafael, con 51 años de edad, es casado y padre de 1 hijo. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, un visionario y buen negociante. 

Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo pipetas de gas en el municipio de Sincelejo y, desde hace 8 años tiene su propio negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Rafael acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido e inventario de pipetas de gas. 

Rafael es un hombre muy organizado aunque ha tenido que enfrentar la competencia comercial del sector.  

La suma de todos sus esfuerzos le brindan a toda su familia una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en: Rafael is 51 years old, married, and has one son. He is known to be a very responsible and hard-working man, a visionary and good businessman. He has always worked in business, selling gas cylinders. in Sincelejo municipality. He has had his own business for 8 years. He has known how to succeed during difficult times in business and he dreams of buying his own home and having a business that lasts over time. Therefore Rafael seeks a loan which will be used to buy and inventory gas cylinders.  Rafael is a very organized man even though he has had to confront competition in his business sector. All his efforts are to provide his family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and inventory gas cylinders.

loans.name: Didas

texts.en: Didas has applied for his first loan from UGAFODE MDI for 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings. He is 43 years old, married and the father of seven children, all of whom attend school. His children are 20, 18,16,14,12,10 and 8 years old, and he supports his family by working for nine hours a day as a tea farmer. In 2002, Didas began supplementing the income he earns there by raising poultry. He works hard to support his family, and will use this loan to buy fertilizer for his tea garden so as to increase his yield. He says he sells his tea to all the factories in the Bushenyi district. His dream is to build a house and the main challenge he faces in tea farming is price fluctuations. He describes himself as honest and says UGAFODE MDI staff has good customer care. In this photo, we see Didas and his wife in their tea garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina is a 25-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience in this business. Katerina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a new oven, olive oil, yeast, making soda and a gas bottle. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Katerina has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a new oven, olive oil, yeast, making soda and a gas bottle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more feed and vaccinations for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He has a poultry farm where he raises chickens and doves. He sells the eggs and the meat to the local traders. It is a very good business and provides him with a good income.

Ahmad would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more poultry for his farm. By taking this loan, Ahmad's production will be increased and his income too.

Ahmad appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy more poultry for his farm.

loans.name: Vainiu

texts.en: Vainiu is 49 years old and unmarried with six children. She has a large kava farm and she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Vainiu needs a loan to buy kava plants, a wheelbarrow, an axe, a chain saw, a shovel, boots and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Vainiu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy kava plants, a wheelbarrow, an axe, a chain saw, a shovel, boots and gloves

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La señora Cristina y su esposo, son personas mayores, que trabajan todos los días para brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Son una familia reducida, tienen dos hijos pequeños que aun asisten a la escuela para tener una mejor educación. Viven en su casa propia, la misma que es de construcción rustica ubicada en la provincia Tiraque de Cochabamba. La señora se dedica a la producción agrícola y el cultivo que más produce es la papa, ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico gallinaza y así continuar produciendo para generar mejores ingresos económicos con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina and her husband are older people who work every day to give their children a better life.  They are a small family, with two younger children who still attend school to get a better education.  They live in their own home, a rustic building located in the province of Tiraque de Cochabamba.

She makes a living in agricultural production and the potato is the most productive crop. She now sees the need to apply for a loan to purchase organic fertilizer to allow for continued production.  In doing so, she will generate more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for the purpose of generating more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Loida

texts.es:
Loida es una mujer de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 2 años, y su negocio es la panadería tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El Torno’ un área rural caracterizada por agrupar a productores campesinos de carne, leche, verduras, granos, etc., y comerciantes revendedores mayoristas que se encargan de vender esos productos en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo; con una temperatura ambiente de aproximadamente 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Loida es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento, que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es el horneado de pan tradicional, variedades como; pan de arroz (a base de harina de arroz), Mollete (Es el pan corriente de harina, azúcar granulada y manteca), Pan dulce (se utiliza uvas pasas, huevo, leche y azúcar), Rosca de maíz (a base de maíz), Tortilla (Es la masa de pan, que primeramente se aplana, se espolvorea con azúcar y harina, se dobla lo aplanado y se repite varias veces obteniendo después de cocido una especie de pan de hojaldre), etc. “la panadería es parte de la tradición familiar, nos pasamos las recetas de generación en generación, espero que continúe así…” comenta. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante el arreglo del techo de su horno, porque se encuentra desgastado y se acerca la época de lluvias. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Loida solicita un préstamo para la refacción del techo de su horno para prevenir la época de lluvias y trabajar de buena manera.
texts.en:
Loida is a 23 year old woman who lives with her husband and has a 2 year old son. She has a traditional bakery business. She is a good mother, independent, happy, optimistic, responsible, hard-working and has a great attitude. Her business is located in the "El Torno" area, an area known for its local products such as meat, milk, vegetables, grains, etc. and resellers to sell various products in different markets in the city. The area has a tropical, humid climate with a temperature of 30 degrees centigrade all year round.

Loida has a brown complexion, long black hair, is short, and her first language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for business. Her husband works in construction and her son knows how to walk now. They live in their own home made of brick and cement, and have potable water and electricity. Her business is baking traditional bread, making varieties such as rice bread (using a base of rice flour), Mollete (common bread of flour, granulated sugar, and butter), sweet bread (with raisins, egg, milk, sugar), corn bread (base of corn), tortillas, etc. She states, "the bakery is part of family tradition, we pass recipes down through generations and I hope it continues on this way..."

Her dream is to improve her family's quality of life and she wants to use a loan to repair the roof of her oven, because it is wearing away and the rainy season is approaching. this is the first loan with the institution in the one year she has had this business as an independent baker. For these reasons she seeks a loan to repair the roof of her oven in time for the rainy season so that it works well.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her oven in time for the rainy season so that it works well.

loans.name: Mere

texts.en: Mere is 42 years old, married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by making and selling pancakes in her community. She has two years of experience in this field, and is requesting a loan to buy yeast, flour, sugar, cooking oil, a new oven and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Mere has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy yeast, flour, sugar, cooking oil, a new oven and plastic bags

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other members of her family.

She has been selling second-hand clothes in the market at retail for the last seven years, working six days a week. She also sells snacks, pancakes, fried cassava and sweet potatoes and half cakes to supplement her income.

She has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings 350,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more skirts, blouses and jackets for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices. Her dream is to build her own work premises. She joined MCDT because she did not have enough money for her business.

She resides in her own house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
