Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, five of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other members of her family.

She has been selling vegetables plus both big and small yellow bananas in a market at retail for the last seven years, working seven days a week. She also works as a cleaner in the City Council to supplement her income.

She has requested for a loan of Ugandan Shillings 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more vegetables, oranges, cabbages, pineapples, tomatoes and yellow bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business to be both a supplier and a farmer of vegetables and bananas. She joined MCDT for financial and business development.

She rents a house with access to neither electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy oranges, tomatoes, pineapples, onions, cabbages and mangos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of ice cream, sugar, and sweet sauces.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana es una señora casada que vive en el campo, su esposo es jornalero y tiene 1 hijo de 12 años que asiste al colegio, Mariana se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para ayudarse en los gastos que tiene de su hogar, de este negocio Mariana espera seguir trabajando y que a su hijo no lo haga falta lo necesario ya que es una madre y esposa muy responsable.
texts.en: Mariana is a married woman who lives in the country. Her husband is a day laborer and they have a 12 year old son who attends school. Mariana raises small animals. This loan will be used to buy chickens in order to help with the household expenses. Mariana hopes to continue working and that her son doesn't lack what he needs as she is a very responsible mother and wife.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new finishing machine for garments

loans.name: Sanad

texts.en:
Sanad is a 19-year-old single man from Khanyounis. Sanad appears in the photo while he is working. He lives with his family in a very simple and humple house. He has a farm for raising sheep. He sells dairy products and meat to the local traders. It is a very good business and provides him with a good income.

Sanad would like to improve his business and expand it in the future. Sanad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his farm. By taking this loan, Sanad's production will increase and also his income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius was motivated to start CleanSlate, an accounting and tax advising service, because “providing services to consumers that will help them better their quality of living also helps to better the quality of the community.”

Cornelius will be starting his Masters in Accounting in early 2015 and currently lives with his wife. Like many small business owners, Cornelius takes great pride in working with his community.

“Over the past two years, I was able to gain tremendous business experience from my interaction with current clients and prospects. I am currently working to regain not-for-profit status for an organization that serves US Veterans.” And, like many small businesses, Cornelius points to access to capital as his largest difficulty.

This is the first loan Cornelius is taking out with Accion. He will use the loan to purchase marketing materials to increase his client base. Looking towards his future, Cornelius has his sights set high: “I plan to grow my business into a nationally known company providing individualized service at an affordable cost.

You can see his business here: http://www.cleanslatefs.com/

loans.use: to purchase marketing materials to increase his client base.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of cement to apply to the floor of her house

loans.name: Gabriel Jose

texts.es:
El señor Gabriel es un experimentado carpintero el cual a desde hace muchos años aprendió este oficio gracias a la experiencia obtenida trabajando en muchos talleres de maderas y con el paso del tiempo fue independizándose hasta montar su propio taller con el cual, a pesar de las adversidades, ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia.

Su mayor orgullo es haber construido una muy buena reputación y prestigio gracias a su buen trabajo; construyo los muebles con sus propias manos y casi todo lo encontrado en su humilde hogar es fabricado por el mismo.
 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de madera que le permitan fabricar más muebles y lograr tener una buena rentabilidad por sus trabajos.

Su principal sueño está enfocado en sus hijos, puesto que quiere darles una muy buena educación y que en un futuro sean personas muy exitosas.

Siempre pensando en Interactuar como su aliado y compañero en su proceso productivo.
texts.en:
Gabriel is an experienced carpenter who learned this trade years ago, thanks to his experience working in a number of woodworking shops.  Over time, he started working independently after starting up his own woodworking shop.  In spite of facing adversities, he has managed to get ahead along with his family.

His greatest pride is the good reputation and prestige that he has built up as a result of his good work.  He makes furniture with his own hands, and just about everything in his own modest home was made by him.

Gabriel is requesting a loan to buy wood so that he can make more furniture and generate good profits from his work.  His main dream is focused on his children; he wants to give them a good education so that in the future they can become very successful people.

Gabriel always thinks of Interactuar as his ally and partner in his productive process.

loans.use: to buy wood to make more furniture

loans.name: Delma

texts.es: La señora Delma es madre de familia, su conyugue la dejo con dos hijos, tuvo que aprender varias actividades entre la cuales se encuentran la  elaboración de tortas, ahora solicita un credito para la compra de un horno y demás instrumentos para mejorar la elaboración de sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos para mantener a sus dos hijos que aun estan en edad escolar,  de esta forma podra brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Delma es una persona luchadora y emprendedora que  sale adelante a pesar de todas las adversidades sufridas, su prioridad es cubrir las necesidades de sus dos hijos de los cuales obtiene la fuerza para no darse por vencida y seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Delma is the head of a household.  Her husband left her with two children, and she had to learn various activities, including how to make cakes.  She is now requesting a loan to buy an oven and other equipment to improve her business and increase her income so that she can support her 2 children, who are still school-aged.  In this way, she will be able to provide them with a better quality of life.  

Delma is a tenacious and enterprising person who is getting ahead in spite of the adversities that she has suffered.  Her priority is to provide for the needs of her children.  From them, she gets the strength to continue to fight and never give up.

loans.use: to buy an oven and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Lilian Yohana

texts.es:
Lilian es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 22 años de edad, estudiante universitaria y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 11 meses comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor como jeans, camisas, camisetas, entre otros, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.

Lilian tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Lilian is an enterprising and dynamic 22 year-old woman.  She is a university student and independent merchant.  Eleven months ago, she started selling merchandise to her friends, family, and university colleagues with the goal of generating income to contribute to the household finances and to pay for her education.

Lilian is requesting support to fortify her business.  She will invest this money in the purchase of items to stock her business, such as: jeans, shirts, t-shirts, and other items.  This will provide her business with greater variety, enabling her to provide better service to her customers, which will make her business more profitable.

Lilian has the firm intention of making progress with her business.  She wants to become a successful businesswoman so that she can provide her family with well-being and a better quality of life. She knows that with the Kiva lenders and the Interactuar organization, she will be able to achieve all of this and more.

loans.use: to stock her business with jeans, shirts, t-shirts, and other items

loans.name: Heroína De Jesus

texts.es:
Heroína, una mujer de 58 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.

De esta forma ira superando dificultades como las bajas ventas y la competencia.

Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.

Apoya a Heroína con su negocio!
texts.en:
Heroína, a 58 year old woman, has given her whole life for the benefit of her family so that they could move forward and together overcome the adversity that faced them.  Thanks to a store that she opened with a lot of effort, patience, and sacrifice, she has been able to generate income to support her children.

In order to become the best family business in her area, she is requesting a loan to purchase stock which will allow her to increase her inventory of grains and groceries.  This will help her overcome difficulties such as low sales and competition.  

This loan will be an opportunity to establish her business as the most productive in the neighborhood and will give her the opportunity to achieve what she has always dreamed of - buying her own home.

Support Heroína with her business!

loans.use: to purchase stock to increase her inventory of grains and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood for his business making furniture

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CONFIANZA”.
La socia es la Sra. Elida, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar golosinas, gaseosas, leche entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de animales, negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La socia que sale a la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Elida is a member of the Confianza community bank.  She is continuing with her grocery store business.  She has been doing this work for a while and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day.  She sells staple items, including rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  She wants to continue working to continue supporting her family.

Elida is requesting this loan to purchase snacks, drinks, milk, and other items.  The other group members work with animals, selling livestock, at a grocery store, and selling animals.  

Elida is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream and promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.  

The group member in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting due to her work.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, drinks, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Mercy Marianela

texts.es: Mercy es madre soltera, tiene 21 años de edad y su hijo 3 años, ella vive en la casa de su madre con sus hermanos, Mercy se dedica a la trabajar al jornal y a criar pollos en la casa donde vive tiene unos pequeños galponcitos, el crédito lo necesita para comprar pollos ya que dice que por medio de este negocio logra que su hijos tenga lo necesario y sobre todo la alimentación.
texts.en: Mercy is a single mother, 21 years old and her son is 3. She lives in her mother's house with her siblings. Mercy works as a day laborer and raises chickens in the house where she lives. She has some small sheds. She needs the loan to buy chickens since she says, through this business, she will make sure her kids have what's necessary and, above all, food.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Juntas Y Unidas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Justina  ella es soltera tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción como cemento, piedras entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de piedras, cemento entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de libros,  negocio de venta de tejidos, brindando el servicio de taxi, pollería,  venta de materiales de construcción.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the communal bank “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS” ("Together and United"). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. One member is Justina. She is single, 51 years old and has three children. Justina alternates her daily activities with the business of selling construction materials such as cement, stone, among others. Justina has worked in this business for a while and it is going very well thanks to her daily hard work. She wants to be able to continue working in her business in order to keep supporting her family. The member requested a loan to buy stones, cement, among other things. The other members work selling books, selling weaved goods, providing taxi services, a chicken restaurant, selling building materials. The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream, and she promises to pay the loan on time and in the prescribed manner.

loans.use: to buy stones, cement, among other things.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 51-year-old married woman from Qalqilya city. She lives with her husband in a simple house. Her husband works as a construction worker, and he gets a low and unstable income. Zakia has a farm where she raises sheep which has been open for the past five years. She sells the meat to the local traders. It is a very good business and provides her with a good income.

Zakia would like to improve her business and expand it in the future.

Zakia took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her farm. By taking this loan, Zakia will be able to increase her production and her income.

Zakia appears in the photo while she is working

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 5 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ sitio que se ha convertido en un pujante brazo de producción donde microempresarios de todas las áreas, como la costura, el diseño y las artesanías, imitan productos extranjeros que se comercializan en los principales mercados locales, Los habitantes de la populosa zona son en su gran mayoría provenientes de etnias locales como los ‘Ayoreos’ y migrantes de otros departamentos del país como del exterior.
Silvia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que le ayuda en sus negocios y su niño que ya va a la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su nueva actividad es la venta de comida tradicional como; el pipián (basado en carne de res o en pato), el locro carretero (carne deshidrata y yuca), el majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, plátano frito), el cogote relleno (cuellos de gallina relleno) y el rapi (carne, arroz, urucú). Cada comida es cocinada una vez a la semana, y a pesar que su negocio es nuevo los clientes ya conocen el menú diario. “sigo teniendo mi tienda de abarrotes, esta es mi segunda actividad y está comenzando de buena manera…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande y conocido, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de sillas y mesas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes en su futuro restaurante.
texts.en:
Silvia is a woman of 25. She lives with her partner and has a 5-year-old son. Her business is selling traditional food.

She is entrepreneurial, a good mother, committed to her work, generous, friendly, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is located in the "Plan 3000" zone, which has become a thriving arm of production, where microentrepreneurs in all areas, such as sewing, design, and craft specialties, imitate foreign products that are sold in the principal local markets. The great majority of the inhabitants of the populous area are from the local ethnic groups such as the Ayoreos and migrants from other departments of the country and from outside the country.

Silvia has a dark complexion, short stature, and long, black, tied-back hair. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish for business. She lives with her partner, who helps her in her businesses, and her son, who already goes to school. They live in their own house made of bricks and cement, which has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system. Her new business is selling traditional food such as pipián (based on beef or duck), locro carretero (dried meat and yucca), mojadito de charque (dried meat, rice, and fried plantains), cojete relleno (stuffed chicken necks), and rapi (meat, rice, and achiote). Each food is cooked once a week, and in spite of the fact that her business is new, the customers already know the daily menu. "I continue having my grocery store. This is my second activity and it is beginning well," she comments. Her dream is to have a big, well known restaurant, and she wants to make an investment in her business through the purchase of chairs and tables so that she can serve a greater number of customers. This is her fourth loan sequence with the institution in the two years that she has had this business. 

It is for these reasons that Silvia is applying for a loan for the purchase of tables and chairs in order to serve a greater number of customers in her restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs in order to serve a greater number of customers in her restaurant.

loans.name: Diamond Sower Academy Group E

texts.en: Kimhoinei is a housewife who depends on her husband’s income for her daily needs. Her husband is the breadwinner of the family. She is 33 years old. Both she and her daughter are pictured with their hands raised. She is the featured borrower of the group. She has two lovely daughters studying in Diamond Sower Academy and a toddler son. She looks after her son at home and does the household chores daily. Her husband is a cultivator who does manual work to support his family. The small income he derives from cultivation work, hardly meets their household requirements. “It is difficult to manage the annual tuition fees of my children for each new session for a low income family like us,” she said. With the Kiva loan, she will pay for the annual school expenses without any delay so that her daughters can join the new school session on time. Regularity of attendance also contributes so much to the well-being of a student's life. She is very happy to avail the loan and said that her burdens are lightened. Her daughters are intelligent and work very hard to excel in their studies. They are much disciplined and well mannered. The group was formed by eight women who lack financial support for their children’s education with the aim of getting a loan. They will use the loan to pay for their children’s annual school fees for the new session. They are all very happy for the loan and wish good luck to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay for school expenses including admission fees, uniforms and text books.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats, to raise and sell them.

loans.name: Diamond Sower Academy Group C

texts.en: Lhingneihoi is a 48-year-old inhabitant of Thangkanphai village, which is around 30 kilometres from the main town. She is a mother of five children and one of her sons goes to Diamond Sower Academy. Her husband and she are engaged in cultivation for their livelihood. There is no other means of income generation for their family and their income is unreliable to pay for school admission fees for all the children at one time. The other children attend different schools and colleges. Lhingneihoi and her son are pictured with their hands raised. She is the profiled borrower of the group. Six women who share the same financial background formed the group and named it ‘Diamond Sower Academy A’.  She says that her children are diligent in their studies and have big dreams of becoming respectable people in society in the near future. She devotes her time to nurturing her children and she cares so much about her children. Due to their financial instability, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to pay for her son’s school admission fees and to buy new text books, exercise books and stationery items for the new session of 2015. She is so much thankful to Kiva for the financial assistance, which is immeasurable.

loans.use: To pay for school admission fees for the new session 2015 and to buy new text books, exercise books and stationery items.

loans.name: Taranaki

texts.en:
Taranaki is a 21-year-old, unmarried woman, who has no children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community, to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business.

Taranaki needs a loan, to buy bags of sugar, a cooler, foam cups, Chinese candy, cordials, a jug, and a large spoon. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Taranaki has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, a cooler, foam cups, Chinese candy, cordials, a jug, and a large spoon.

loans.name: Feonuu

texts.en:
Feonuu is 43 years old and married. She has five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for two years.

Feonuu needs a loan, to buy a display fridge, bags of sugar, flour, cooking oil, canned items, and frozen goods. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2012, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a display fridge, bags of sugar, flour, cooking oil, canned items, and frozen goods.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en: Melania is 38 years old and single with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Melania needs a loan to buy crops, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, a sprayer and boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Melania will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a spade, a machete, a sprayer and boots

loans.name: Kalapu

texts.en:
Kalapu is 43 years old and divorced, with seven children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

She needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, gloves, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Kalapu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, gloves, new gum boots, and a spade

loans.name: La Luz Del Saber Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México, una gran parte de la población se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de jarcería, anteriormente solo había una tienda donde las personas podían conseguir la malla metálica para crear las fibras para lavar y entregar sus pedidos a tiempo. Otras personas también compran las piezas elaboradas y salen a revenderlas a otras comunidades. Actualmente ya existen más tiendas encargadas de distribuir los artículos de jarcería, lo que beneficia a los pequeños comerciantes de la localidad.

Doña Gregoria es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 58 años de edad y es viuda, tuvo 6 hijos que ya son independientes, aunque uno de sus nietos vive en su casa y es ella quien solventa los gastos de su educación preparatoria.

Por más de 32 años se ha dedicado a atender su tienda de abarrotes, platica que la inició porque su casa estaba muy cerca de una escuela primaria, “mis hijos en ese entonces eran muy pequeños, todos se encontraban estudiando y con el sueldo de mi esposo no alcazaba para solventar todos los gastos". Así que el negocio representó una buena alternativa porque no había ningún tipo de competencia entonces y las ventas eran muy buenas. En un principio Gregoria vendía únicamente lápices, libretas y dulces para los estudiantes. Poco a poco comenzó a integrar nuevos productos como refrescos y algunos productos de abarrotes. Con base en mucho esfuerzo y con sus ganancias construyó un local donde ahora cabe mejor la mercancía que ofrece. Gregoria se siente muy orgullosa porque gracias a su negocio pudo dar estudios a sus hijos y tiene la oportunidad de apoyar a su nieto. Actualmente Gregoria necesita comprar más mercancía como leche, huevo, pan, azúcar y dulces para reabastecer su tienda.

A pesar de que con el tiempo han abierto más tiendas en la comunidad, a ella no le preocupa, ni siquiera la señora que vende dulces justo fuera de su local. “Creo que el sol salió para todos y todos tenemos derecho a buscar nuestro bienestar” comentó y concluye que su única ilusión es ver realizado profesionalmente a su nieto.

Durante ocho años Doña Gregoria y los miembros del grupo han solicitando préstamo a VisionFund para invertir en su negocio, están muy agradecidos por el apoyo recibido porque sus negocios han evolucionado.

Los integrantes del grupo son Don Moises y Doña Filiberta quienes invertirán en productos de jarcería; Aurora, en su tienda de abarrotes; Lilia y Angel, en fibras metalicas, Ofelia en borregos y David en su taxi.

*En la fotografía Doña Gregoria viste un suéter morado.
texts.en:
In a community of the state of Mexico, a large percentage of the population is involved in the business of buying and selling household and cleaning products. In the past there was only one store where people could fill their orders on time and obtain the metal mesh used to create scrubbing fibers. Other people also purchase prefabricated pieces and go out to resell them in other areas. Nowadays there are more stores which distribute household and cleaning products, which benefits the salespeople in the community.

Gregoria is a very hardworking woman. She is 58 years old and is a widow. She has six children who now live independently, though one of her grandchildren lives with her and Gregoria is responsible for paying for his education. 

She has owned her grocery store for over 32 years. She says that she started this business because her house was very close to a primary school. She says "my children were very young, all of them were in school and we couldn't cover all of our expenses on my husband's salary alone". The business offered a good alternative option because she didn't need any kind of special qualifications to run it, and she had very good sales. In the beginning Gregoria only sold pencils, books and sweets for the students. Then, bit-by-bit, she began integrating new products such as sodas and a few grocery items. Through a lot of effort, she built a store, which now houses all of her merchandise better.

Gregoria currently needs to purchase additional merchandise such as milk, eggs, bread, sugar and sweets to restock her store.

Although more stores have opened up in the community over time, this does not worry Gregoria. Not even the woman who sells sweets just outside of her store worries Gregoria. She says "I think that the sun comes out for everybody, and we all have the right to pursue our own wellbeing". Her only priority is to ensure that her grandson is able to become a professional.

The members of the group are Moises and Filiberta, who use their loans to purchase cleaning supply products; Aurora with her grocery store; Lilia and Angel who are metalworkers; Ofelia who raises sheep; and David who has a taxi.

For the past eight years, Gregoria and her fellow group members have requested a loan from VisionFund to invest in their businesses. They are very grateful to the support they have received because their businesses have evolved.

In the photo, Gregoria is wearing a purple sweater.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as milk, eggs, bread, sugar and sweets.

location.town: Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 28-year-old married woman from Yatta, a village near Hebron city. She lives with her husband and two kids in a simple house. Her husband works as a construction worker who gets a low and unstable income. Hala has a farm where she raises sheep, which has been operating for the past three years. She sells the meat to the local traders. It is a very good business and provides her with a good income.

Hala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more feed and other supplies for her farm. By taking this loan, Hala will be able to increase the production and also her income. 

Hala appears in the photo while she is working.

loans.use: to buy more feed and other supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more feed and other supplies for her farm

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 22-year-old single lady who lives with her family in Baqaa. Rania has three other siblings and she is the youngest. 

She is a third year student majoring in business administration. She couldn’t enroll herself in a public university and had to register in a private one which made it harder on her parents since the tuition fees are high. 

Rania can’t find a job now as she wants to concentrate on her studies so she won’t waste her parents’ efforts in paying for her fees. As a way to help, she  decided to apply for a loan that will help her pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: G.s. Dios Es Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El G.S Dios es Esperanza está conformado por  tres integrantes  mujeres, madres solteras, originarias de Nagarote, lugar que se destaca por su artesanía y sus comidas típicas.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. En la actualidad luchan día a día para salir adelante.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Yeimis y tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida casera en su casa de habitación , comida casera como:  pollo frito, pollo asada, en caldito, carne asada, bistec,  desmenuzadas, papas fritas, puré de papas, frijoles, arroz, maduros etc. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto  a clientes fijos y eventuales,  el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles para la preparación de la comida.  El G.S. Dios es Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Dios es Esperanza" (God is Hope) is formed by three women members, single mothers, natives of Nagarote, a place that stands out because of its handicrafts and its typical foods. They are known for being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. In their free time, they like to enjoy the company of their children. Now they are striving day by day to get ahead.

Thanks to her will to get ahead, the coordinator is Yeimis. Her business is selling homemade food in her home. She sells homemade foods such as fried chicken, roasted chicken, chicken in broth, roasted meat, beefsteak, shredded meats, French fries, mashed potatoes, beans, rice, ripe plantains, etc.

She works in her business some 10 hours a day, offering her products to regular and occasional customers. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of food products for the preparation of her homemade foods. 

The "Dios es Esperanza" group is grateful for the support that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy food products to prepare fried chicken, roast chicken, chicken in broth, roast meat, beefsteak, shredded meat, French fries, mashed potatoes, beans, rice, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Mujeres Responsables está conformada por diecisiete integrantes madres y padres responsables con  veinticinco hijos bajo su responsabilidad son originarios de  Mal paisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente, ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En la  actualidad luchan día  a día para salir adelante con sus hijos, gracias. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Olga y tiene por actividad económica  la venta de artesanía en su casa de habitación  y forma ambulante   productos como: jarros, floreros, comales, alcancillas, ceniceros,  llaveros,  bisutería artesanal. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir  su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. La asociación comunal mujeres responsables agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Responsables" (Responsible Women) communal bank is made up of seventeen members who are responsible mothers and fathers. All together, they are responsible for 25 children. They are natives of Mal Paisillo, which is located in the western part of the country. The members are known for being hard-working and responsible and for having a desire to improve their situation. They are currently working hard day after day to get ahead with their children. Unfortunately, due to their low-incomes, none of them were able to go to school and instead needed to start working at a young age.

Olga is the coordinator of the communal bank. Her business is selling handicrafts out of her home and also as a street vendor. She sells products such as jars, vases, hotplates, piggy banks, ash trays, key-chains and hand-made jewelry. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock up her business so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn a better income. Olga dedicates about eight hours a day to selling her products.

The members of "Mujeres Responsables" communal bank are grateful for the help the Kiva lenders offer to low-income people and poor countries, like Nicaragua, so they can have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with handicrafts such as jars, vases, hotplates, piggy banks, ashtrays and hand-made jewelry.

loans.name: Bahiya

texts.en:
Bahiya is a 49 years old and widowed. She is supporting five children by herself. 

After her husband passed away, Bahiya refused to depend on others to support her children and decided to open a small business in the area to bring her income. She used one of her rooms and turned it into to sections, one for selling clothes (some are second hand items), and the other for selling cosmetic products. Opening this small home-based store help a lot of people in the area to find what they need without going to downtown and using transportation to get it. 

Now Bahiya is applying for a loan to improve her clothing section and buy more hangers to make it easier for buyers to find the piece they want.

loans.use: To improve her clothing section and buy more hangers .

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a fifty-four-year-old widow living in Wihdat; her children are all married and are helping her as much as they can. 

Neighbours used to knock on Huda's door to ask her to repair some of their clothes. Then they advised her to open a small workshop area at her house where people can come and ask for the service, which will help her make more income to support herself. So she bought a sewing machine and started her small business at home, which helped her make more friends and got her out of her depression after her husband's death. 

Now Huda is applying for a loan to fix her sewing machine and buy new sets of threads and needles to improve her services.

loans.use: to fix her sewing machine and buy new sets of threads and needles to improve her services.

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en: Kayed is a twenty-one-year-old, single man, who lives in Wihdat. He's studying management information systems. His passion is accounting and management systems. He goes to a private university that has a private transportation system, and where he found that he can get a discount on his fees. He has a sister, who goes to a different university, and the rest of his brothers are still at school. Having two children attending universities is somehow a lot on his father. For that reason, Kayed is applying for the loan. He will use the loan funds to cover the rest of his semester fees, and help his sister pay hers, too.

loans.use: to cover the rest of his semester fees, and help his sister pay hers, too.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood and cement, for a house renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more computers and a machine for making hot drinks, for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, so he can provide different kinds of drinks with his sandwiches, such as juices, water, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her semester fees, in electrical engineering.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 28 years old and unmarried with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

She needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Filomena will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, new gum boots, and a spade

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a thirty-six-year-old, married woman who lives in Madaba. She works in a craft center, where they make different mosaic art. She took training courses before, to learn how to do this. In addition to her work at the center, Iman started doing mosaic art at her house. She sells it, using her connections in Madaba. She started her project with a small amount of money, and made small crafty pieces to sell. Now Iman is applying for a loan to buy more supplies and stones, to make more mosaic crafts to sell. She hopes that she can expand her connection to cover other cities in the future.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and stones, to make mosaic crafts to sell.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en: Hazem is a 20-year-old single man who lives with his eight member family in Mafraq. His father works in the armed forces to support his children. Hazem is now in his third year at the university majoring in accounting and commercial law. Recently, his father had to do some work on the house, which cost him more money and he could not cover Hazem’s fees, so Hazem decided to request a loan to cover the rest of his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal for his store to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the rest of his semester fees

loans.name: Angham

texts.en:
Angham is a 19-year-old single young lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her brother works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Angham is a student in the university where she studies Information technology. She wants to take a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family. 

Angham took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Angham will be able to do her homework and write her reports easily.

Angham appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is an 18-year-old single young lady from Khan Younis City. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Aysha is a student in the university where she studies Business Administration and Secretary. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Aysha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Aysha will be able to do her homework and write the reports easily.

Aysha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 22-year-old single man living with his nine member family in Mafraq. Abdullah is a university student majoring in economics and business administration. He is requesting an educational loan to help him cover his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola is a 19-year-old single young lady from Jenin City. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Rola is a student in the university where she studies Nursing. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Rola took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university instalments for this semester. By taking this loan, Rola will be able to complete her studies faster.

Rola appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university instalments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stylish ready-made women's clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 25-year-old single man, who lives in Mafraq with the rest of his family. Eyad is a second year student in the university majoring at accounting. After school he goes to work at a hospital as a worker to make some money and help his parent in paying for his school fees. Now Eyad is applying for a loan to help him pay for his upcoming semester fees, because what he made in the last month was not enough to pay for his school.

loans.use: to help him pay for his upcoming semester fees, because what he made in the last month was not enough to pay for his school.

loans.name: Mohamaed

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Mohamaed.  He is single, and has no children. In 2007, Mohamaed established his E-voucher, top-up cards, phone and water business. 

Working 12 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 198,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He now requires a loan in order to purchase more top-up cards and water for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 900,000. 

In the future, Mohamaed plans to open another business center (shop). He plans to buy another vehicle in the future; he is very hard-working.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more top-up cards and water for resale.

loans.name: Lozah

texts.en:
Lozah is a 26-year-old single young lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Her brother works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Lozah is a student in the university where she studies Education and Arts. She wants to take a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.
 
Lozah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Lozah will be able to do her homework and write her reports easily.
 
Lozah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Adelmo

texts.es:
Adelmo tiene 67 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene cuatro hijos mayores los cuales ya son independientes, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyugue, vivienda construida de material rustico (adobe y techo de teja). La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería; el lugar donde vive es zona centro del distrito Buenos Aires, de aproximadamente 90 familias dicho distrito tiene aproximadamente 45 años de creación política y está ubicado en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Adelmo es venta de agua para riegos de cultivos agricolas ya que cuenta con dos motores propios. La actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años, dichos servicios los realiza dentro de su comunidad, el agua la vende a agricultores de la zona para lo cual cobra por estos servicios por horas, al costo de 14 nuevos soles hora. El destino del crédito es para compra accesosorios (tubos, mangueras, mangas, otros) para sus motores, asi mismo para dar mantenimiento preventivo a uno de sus motores. La inversión le ayudará incrementar las ventas y a obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. Adelmo piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que año tras año su negocio viene siendo más conocido en la zona, así mismo sus ventas vienen creciendo. Y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Adelmo is 67 years old, married and has four adult children who are already independent. He lives in his own home with his partner, a home built of local materials(adobe and tile roofing). Life in this place is quiet. Its inhabitants engage in agriculture and livestock-raising. The place where he lives is the central area of Buenos Aires District, a place with approximately 90 families. This district was created approximately 45 years ago and is located in the district of Buenos Aires, Morropón province in the Piurá region of Peru's north coast. 


Adelmo's business is selling water for crop irrigation, as he has two of his own engines. He has been doing this work for eight years and provides these services within his community. He sells the water to area farmers and charges for these services by the hour, at a cost of 14 nuevos soles per hour.

The purpose of the loan is to buy accessories such as pipes, hoses, sleeves, and other items for his engines as well as to do preventative maintenance on one of his engines. the investment will help him increase his sales and obtain greater income for his family. 

Adelmo intends to continue investing in his business, as year after year it is becoming better known in the area and his sales are gradually increasing. In this way he can obtain better earnings which will allow him in the medium or short term to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase accessories such as pipes, hoses sleeves and other items for his engines, as well as to do preventative maintenance on one of his engines.

loans.name: Marian M

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Marian. She is married and has five children aged 29, 27, 25, 22 and 11. She has three additional dependents who live with her just to be self reliant, and to help her husband in the running of the home. In 2004 Marian established her gara, palm and batik business. She began her business just to assist her husband in developmental purposes. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 620,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Marian requires a loan in order to buy more sugar, ink and soda. In the future Marian plans to open a provision shop, and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soda and ink for her gara tie dye business.

loans.name: Dora Aracely

texts.es: Dora de 40 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza para sostener la economía de su hogar por medio de su negocio de venta de lácteos como: requesón, crema, queso duro blando y queso fresco, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 12 y 2 años de edad, además tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad que la apoyan con los gastos económicos. Dora siente que el techo de su vivienda ha cumplido su vida útil ya que se han comenzado a presentar filtraciones, además desea colocar canales de lamina para captar el agua del techo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, canales y pines para cambiar el techo e instalar canales en su vivienda, que le permitan captar el agua del techo.
texts.en:
Dora is 40 years old. She's an entrepreneurial woman who works hard to sustain her household economy through her business selling dairy products like: cheese, cream, hard cheese and soft cheese. She's been in this business for four years.

She lives in her own house with her two children who are 12 and two years old. She also has three adult children who help her with expenses. Dora feels that her house's roof has outlived its useful life because it's started to leak. She'd also like to install laminated gutters to capture water from the roof.

For this, she's seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet, gutters and pins to change the roof and install gutters in her house, which will allow her to capture water from the roof.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet, gutters and pins to change the roof and install gutters in her home.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 62 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para sostener la economía de su hogar, apoyada en su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos de engorde, además está laboriosa mujer cuenta con ganado bovino del cual obtiene leche que comercializa en su cantón, y cuando le queda leche elabora queso obteniendo mejores ingresos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y un hijo mayor de edad. Teresa desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita invertir en pollos y ganado bovino para que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en: Teresa is 62 years old and is a very hardworking enterprising woman who strives daily to support her household.  She raises and sells chickens and also has cows from which she obtains milk that she sells in her neighborhood.  She makes cheese with any leftover milk to obtain extra income.  She lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner and adult son.  Teresa is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy chickens and cows so that her business will continue to prosper.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cows.

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es:
Rosa, por los buenos beneficios que obtiene del uso de los créditos, nuevamente requiere más capital para comprar arroz, aceite, frijoles, bebidas, papas, pollo, etc., para elaborar la venta de comida.
Actualmente sus ingresos han mejorado con la inversión del préstamo anterior, su familia se mantiene y hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa needs another loan to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, beverages, potatoes, chicken, etc. to make and sell food.

Her income has increased with the help of the previous loan.  She is able to support her family and has not had any trouble with her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Bertilda

texts.es:
Maria Bertilda tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Maria Bertilda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (patos, conejos, pollos, etc), desde hace 06 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; pues desea aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales, comprando pavos, gallinas, cerdos, cuyes, pichones, entre otros, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su productividad de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Bertilda is 39 years old and lives with her partner and two children in her care.  She lives in her own home in a rural area of the Oyotún District, Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.  Her community is mostly engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.

Maria Bertilda has made a living raising and selling corralled animals (such as ducks, rabbits, and chickens) for 6 years.  She carries out her business from her home, and she is asking for a loan for working capital, since she wants to increase and diversify her stock of animals by buying turkeys, hens, pigs, guinea pigs, and pigeons, among other animals.  The loan will help her to invest in more animals so that she can increase her productivity and meet the needs of her clients.  This will allow her to increase her short-term earnings and improve her income towards the aim of improving the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to increase her working capital so that she can augment and diversify her stock of animals

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 35,000. This loan is intended to buy ingredients for her snack vending business.

Alma dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía, ha progresado positivamente en la venta de bebidas con la ayuda del capital anterior, ya ha establecido una mini tienda de productos básicos para el hogar, su negocio es más rentable y en su hogar toda su familia esta saludable.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, galletas, etc., para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y mantearse trabajando.
texts.en:
Sofia has made progress in her beverage business through help from the previous loan.  She has already set up a mini basic products store in her home.  Her business is more profitable and her family is healthy.

She needs a new loan to buy basic grains, juices, soft drinks, candy, cookies, etc. so she can cover her customer demand and continue to work.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Amorlita

texts.en:
Amorlita is from Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old and is married with two kids.

In 2011, Amorlita applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing about all the benefits of being a member, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains her status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Amorlita asked for financial assistance in the amount of Php 50,000.00 to buy stocks such as soft drinks, soaps, shampoo, candies, etc., for her mini grocery. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy stocks such as soft drinks, soaps, shampoo, candies, etc., for her mini grocery.

loans.name: Daysi Yanira

texts.es: Daysi cuenta con 39 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 5 hijos 3 hijas de 8, 12 y 18 años de edad y 2 varones de 10 y 15 años de edad, además vive con ellos una nieta de 1 año de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza cada día para poder sostener la economía de su hogar, por medio de su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para caballero, damas y niños. Daysi desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita invertir en: duralita, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, que tiene algún tiempo deteriorado, pero por falta de liquidez económica no ha podido cambiarlo, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Daysi is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and 5 children, 3 daughters who are 8, 12, and 18 and 2 sons who are 10 and 15, as well as a granddaughter who is a year old.  She is an enterprising woman and she works hard every day to be able to support her household by running a business selling clothing for men, women, and children.  

Daysi wants to take out a loan with FUSAI so that she can buy Duralita sheeting and roof beams to change the roof of her home.  The roof has been deteriorating for quite some time but she hasn't had enough available cash to be able to change it, so she is hoping that she can receive this support as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy Duralita sheeting and roof beams to change the roof of her home

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta landed in the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC in 2009. She has four children who are all school-age. She knew joining PMPC would be her last chance to get back on her feet after she went broke when her first business went bad. PMPC came to Julieta's rescue and lent her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has taken another loan for this quarter's cropping. She borrowed an amount to pay for land and seedbed preparation on her rice farm. Julieta perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation on her rice farm

loans.name: Roger Atahualpa

texts.es: La perseverancia y dedicación en los estudios es lo que hacen a Roger merecedor del título que obtendrá como licenciado. Su principal apoyo en todo momento ha sido su mama. Roger estudia Ciencias Políticas y Relaciones Internacionales porque le gusta aportar a la sociedad y sobre todo ayudar a las personas que más lo necesitan, es por esta razón que solicita el préstamo para suplir los gastos de su graduación y obtener de esa manera su título. Dentro de los planes próximos de Roger está realizar una maestría acorde a su carrera.
texts.en: Perseverance and dedication at his studies mean that Roger is well deserving of the degree he is about to receive. Roger's biggest support has always been his mother. Roger studies political sciences and international relations because he wants to contribute to society and, above all, he wants to help those who are most in need. Roger is applying for a loan to cover the costs of graduation and receive his degree. In the future, Roger would like to do a Master's in his subject.

loans.use: to cover the costs of graduation and receive his degree.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando has wide experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting, to earning income as well. Fernando and his wife have been doing this type of work to earn a living for more than 2 decades now. 

As a farmer, Fernando has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knew he could always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results and produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Someday Fernando hopes to purchase another rice field to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results and produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
In 2010, Leonora learned about the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. She tried her luck on starting a business focusing on her rice farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Leonora has now borrowed another amount to pay for land and seedbed preparation, which will greatly help her to boost her farming income. 

She is also looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, wood and metal sheeting to change the roof of her house and put down a concrete floor.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María Soledad tiene 53 años, es casada, vive en casa de propia, junto su esposo e hija y 02 nietos, en sector el Porvenir de la otra Banda. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Soledad se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (chivos y cabras). Además ofrece el servicio de jornales agricolas. Su esposo es dependiente de la empresa agrícola de Cayalti. María Soledad desea del crédito para realizar la inversión en compra de ladrillos de adobe para mejora de vivienda, pues se acercan las temporadas de lluvias y ella desea asegurar su vivienda para así, poder ofrecerle a su familia una casa confortable, comoda y sobre todo segura, obtiendo de esta forma una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Soledad is 53 years old, married and lives in a house that she owns with her husband, daughter and two grandchildren. The family lives in the Porvenir area in the Saña district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in trade, farming and cattle-raising.

María makes a living raising and selling animals (goats and billy goats). She also works as a farm labourer. María's husband works for Cayalti farming company. María wants this loan in order to invest in adobe bricks to improve her home. The rainy season is approaching and María wants to make sure her house is safe in order to give her family a comfortable and, above all, safe place to live. With this loan, María can improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in adobe bricks to improve her home.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 68 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Francisco se dedica a brindar servicio de albañilería; desde hace 30 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de herramientas como son tablas, burros, etc. para su trabajo esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicio a sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 68 years old. He has a partner but no children in his care. Francisco owns the house where he lives. Francisco lives in a rural area in Oyotún, in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in trade, farming and cattle-raising.

Francisco makes a living offering building services. For 30 years, he has run the business out of his home. He is applying for this loan in order to invest in fixed assets; he will also buy tools such as wooden planks and worktables for his work. He is buying these items in order to improve customer service. In the short term, this will allow Francisco to increase his income and profits and, in the end, improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets; he will also buy tools such as wooden planks and worktables.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina has prepared well for the post-harvest operations of her palay (unhusked rice) in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She wants to ensure that she will have ample time for the threshing, drying, storage and processing of her harvest to make way for another cropping season. 

She presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC and has taken out a loan to pay for these operations.

Felomina hopes to live a happy and healthy life with adequate income from her rice farming business.

loans.use: to pay for post-harvest operations of her palay (unhusked rice)

loans.name: Nongtaaba De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUMAROU est le  représentant  du groupe NONGTAABA DE ROLLO. Marié, il est père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 13 ans et le moins âgé a 11 ans. 01 vont à l’école. Il  a 17 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraichage depuis 05 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  06 sacs d’engrais ; 05 bidons d’essence.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumarou is the representative of the 'Nongtaaba de Rollo' Group.  He is married and has four children.  The eldest is thirteen years old, and the youngest is eleven years old.  One of his children currently attends school, and he is financially responsible for a total of seventeen people.

Oumarou has been working in agriculture for five years.  He buys his supplies at the local market, and will use his loan to buy six sacks of fertilizer and five drums of fuel.

His profits will be put to one side and saved.  In the future, Oumarou would like to expand his business and provide more for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer and 5 drums of fuel for his agricultural business.

loans.name: Nancy Zoraida

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Nancy, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.

Se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en el municipio de Caparrapi.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.

Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para el mantenimiento del corral donde alberga sus animales.

Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
Hard-working and dreamy are two words that describe Nancy perfectly.  She is an industrious woman and mother who does what she can to give her children and husband the best quality of life.

She raises and sells pigs in the town of Caparrapi.  This activity is very common in the region and many of the local people are in the same business.

She has great expertise in the field and feels she needs a small boost to increase her sales and business.  Therefore she is requesting financial support to buy maintenance materials for the corral where she houses her animals.  She will use the loan to continue her activity which is the only source of income for the family.

Nancy is grateful to Kiva lenders and the Corporación Interactuar who make it possible to grow and improve to grow and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy maintenance materials for the corral where she houses her animals.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea de 51 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos de 33 y 30 años de edad y solo uno vive con ella. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque sus padres no le tenían fe al estudio y pensaban que de eso no iba a vivir. Su pareja es agricultor solo él y su hijo viven con ella.

Andrea es comerciante, tiene cerca de 24 años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas, también es empleada doméstica, todos los días se despierta a las 4:00 am para moler el maíz y tenerlo listo para empezar a vender las tortillas, en esta actividad llega su hija que está acompañada a apoyarla, dejando de vender a las 6.00 pm.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad para abastecer una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa y tener cierta cantidad de ingreso por la venta de dichos productos. Andrea espera tener apoyo de CrediCampo siempre pues uno de sus sueños es tener una mejor casa.
texts.en:
Andrea, 51, and her common-law husband have two children, ages 33 and 30.  Only one of them still lives at home.  Andrea was unable to get an education because her parents did not believe she could earn a living from it.  Her husband is a farmer.

Andrea is a merchant and for 24 years has been selling tortillas.  She also works as a domestic employee.  At 4:00 a.m. she gets up to grind the corn and prepare it to sell tortillas.  Her daughter helps with the activity which ends at 6:00 p.m.

The loan she is requesting is to buy basic goods to stock a small store she has in her home to earn extra income.  Andrea is counting on support from CrediCampo, since one of her dreams is to have a better house one day.

loans.use: To buy basic goods to stock her small store.

loans.name: Edwin Wladimir

texts.es: Edwin es en joven de 29 años, el vive en el campo my por lo tanto dice  que se dedica a l jornal d trabajos de agricultura, y a la crianza de chanchos, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos que dice que su madre le ayuda en el cuidado de sus animales, lo que Edwin aspira de sus negocio es incrementar su negocio y así seguir apoyando a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Edwin, 29, lives in the country and works as a day laborer in agriculture and also raises pigs.  He will use the loan to buy pigs which his mother helps raise.  Edwin wants to expand his business and continue supporting his parents by helping with the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Wend Lasida De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur ADAMA est le  représentant  du groupe WEND LASIDA  DE ROLLO. Marié, il est père de 10 enfants. Le plus âgé à 25 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Il  a 13 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraichage depuis 05 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  03 sacs d’engrais ; 10 litres d’essence.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices et réinvestir dans son activité. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adama is the representative of the 'Wend Lasida de Rollo' Group.  He is married and has ten children.  The eldest is twenty-five years old, and the youngest is two years old.  Three of his children currently attend school, and he is financially responsible for a total of thirteen people.

Adama has been working in agriculture for five years.  He buys his supplies at the local market, and will use his loan to buy three sacks of fertilizer and ten litres of fuel.

His profits will be put to one side and saved, and some will be reinvested in his business.  In the future, Adama would like to expand his business and provide more for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of fertilizer and 10 litres of fuel for his agricultural business.

loans.name: La Amistad De Huayllabamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMISTAD DE HUAYLLABAMBA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Herbet tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la docencia, el socio es profesor del nivel primario, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura, transporte, venta en el mercado.
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "AMISTAD DE HUAYLLABAMBA" which is located in the district of Huayllabamba, province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Herbet, 36, is single and works as a primary school teacher.  He has been in this line of work for quite some time; and it is going well for him because of the effort he puts into his work every day.  He wants to continue in this field to support his family.  

He is requesting a loan to buy educational materials and other items.  

The other members work in agriculture, transportation and market sales.

Herbet is grateful to lenders taking part in his dream and he is committed to paying back the loan on time.

The individual photo is of a member who was unable to attend the meeting because of work.

loans.use: To buy educational materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Alexander vive con su hijo y su cónyugue. Alexander vive en el caserío del Tambo, el cual es un Caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse. En dicho caserío la población se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería, así como al comercio. Y està ubicado en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Alexander se dedica ha brindar servicio de soladura y cuenta con un pequeño taller de carpintería metálica, cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, por su buen servicio cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona, además Alexander se dedica al comercio, venta de combustible. Alexander cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Alexander desea el crédito para invertir en su taller comprando herramientas que le permitan darle un valor agregado a su servicio, lo que le va a permitir captar a nuevos clientes y mantener contentos a todos los solicitan sus servicios, pues invirtiendo en su negocio y Alexander podra adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alexander is 30 years old. He is married and has one dependent son. Alexander lives with his son and his partner. He lives in the village of Tambo, which is a medium village with aspirations of growing. In this village, the population is dedicated to farming, livestock and trade. It is located in the district of San Felipe, Jaen province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Alexander is dedicated to providing welding services and he has a small metal shop. He has more than 5 years experience in this role. Due to his good service, he has quite a lot of customers in the area. Also, Alexander is dedicated to trade, selling fuel. Alexander has many good personal and working references. He wishes the loan to invest in his shop by buying tools that will allow him to add value to his services. It will allow him to attract new customers and keep all who request his services happy. So, investing in his business,  Alexander will be able to acquire an acceptable profit to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his shop by buying tools that allow him to add value to his service.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has always been enthusiastic about managing her rice farming activities, from which she earns a small income which helps her husband to support their family.
