Doris is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell for her frozen foods business.

Doris has been in this business for six years. Doris earns additional income from manicure/pedicure services.

Doris has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Elisa Jessica

texts.en:
Elisa Jessica is a hard-working entrepreneur who has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer and pay electric bills for her business.

Elisa Jessica has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Elisa Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional  computer and pay electric bills

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 30-year-old  single man who owns a business.  He works 7 days a week to earn 2,000,000 SKK every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 6,250,000 SLL . Mohamed has previously received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan to buy drums of engine oil, an oil filter, a fuel filter, brake liner, bearing and rings,  and pistons.   He was unable to achieve his previous plans because of  domestic problems, but intends to complete his plans. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase drums of engine oil, an oil filter, a fuel filter, brake liner, bearing and rings, and piston rings.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: Marta de 38 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her son and her husband. She has a small store that she has operated out of her house for many years, and has many customers due to her good prices and friendly nature when making sales. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc., and in this way increase her earnings for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a busy mother of four children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household merchandise like coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and seasonings. She is 41 and married, and one of her children is still attending school. She has been operating a store for 14 years already. Her husband earns a living by farming.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock like groceries and soft drinks. In this way, she can now display and sell more stock, and apparently, this will help attract more consumers to come.

In the future, Jocelyn dreams of handling her business successfully in order to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like groceries and soft drinks

loans.name: John Paul

texts.en:
John Paul is from Cabanatuan City and is taking a Mechatronics course from Globaltech Institute for Advance Technology.  He chose this field to enhance his skills and knowledge.  

He is hopeful that he will finish this course and help his family out of poverty. 

 Because his family lacks the financial resources, John Paul is requesting an educational loan of PHP15,000 from Kiva's lenders, which he will use to sustain his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 41-year-old married woman with six children. Her youngest child is six month old.  

Flora engages in raising and selling hogs.  Her husband is a farmer and a laborer as well.  To supplement her income, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells basic commodities like noodles, canned goods, beverages and seasonings.  These are her sources of income.

Due to the very limited capital, Flora has requested a loan of 20,000PHP buy various groceries including soft drinks for her store and pig feed for the farm.  It would be very helpful especially in restocking her store and hopefully she can continue to raise and sell more pigs in the coming months.  She would be able to earn more and eventually she could provide healthy food for the family.

In the future, Flora dreams of expanding her both business to make them productive and profitable and also support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her farm and various groceries including soft drinks for her second business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for the family.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, sanitary pads, diapers, soft drinks, snack foods, etc. 

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl works hard to support her family. Cheryl is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Cheryl requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cheryl has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elcie

texts.en:
Elcie is 38 years old and married with one child. Elcie works very hard to provide for the family.

Elcie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Elcie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, cereals, sugar, coffee, shampoo, canned goods, etc. 

Elcie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elvia Eliza

texts.es: Elvia es una señora casada, tiene 59 años de edad, sus 3 hijos ya son mayores de edad, Elvia vive con su esposo que se dedica a trabajar al jornal, Elvia es una señora que se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura, el crédito lo necesita para compra una vaca ya que dice que por medio de la venta de la leche es come logra que no haga falta por lo menos lo mas indispensable en su hogar, la aspiración de Elvia es lograr ahorrar dinero para comprarse un terrenito donde tener su ganado y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Elivia is a married woman. She is 59, her 3 children are already of age. Elvia lives with her husband who works as a day laborer. Elvia is a woman who works in animal husbandry and agriculture. She needs the loan to buy a cow since she says by means of selling the milk is how she can achieve not having a lack of at least the most important things in her home. Elvia's aspiration is to achieve saving money to buy herself a small patch of land where she can have her cattle and therefore continue working.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and works hard to support her family. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Evangeline requested a loan from NWTF for 29,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional materials such as woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as woods, nails, paints, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Helen is 39 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Helen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Lilia

texts.en:
Ma. Lilia works hard to support her family. Ma. Lilia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now

Ma. Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 60 años de edad, está casado y tiene cinco hijos, tres están casados y con hogar propio y dos viven todavía con él. Estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa, ella, sus dos hijos y dos nietos viven con él.

Juan es agricultor aprendió de su padre y toda su vida cultivó maíz y frijol, la parcela de siembra está ubicada cerca de la casa pero la compra de los productos para siembra queda a 66 kilómetros de donde vive. Uno de sus hijos le apoya en el trabajo y por lo general trabaja 6 horas diarias desde las 6:00 am.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca, tiene la oportunidad de comprarla y quiere aprovechar los residuos del cultivo para alimentarla y algún día produzca leche ya sea para venderla o para hacer queso. Juan espera tener salud para seguir trabajando y ser un ejemplo para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan, 60, is married and has five children, three of whom are married with their own homes, whilst the other two still live with him. He stayed in education until 6th grade of primary school. His wife is a house wife. She, the two children and two grandchildren live with him. 

Juan is a farmer. He learned from his father and has grown maize and beans his whole life. The sowing plot is located close to his house but the place where he buys the products to plant is 66 kilometres away from where he lives. One of his children helps him with the work and in general he works 6 days a week from 6am onwards. 

He is asking for the loan to buy a cow. He has the opportunity to buy it and he wants to make the most of the leftovers of his crop to feed it. One day it will produce milk which can be either sold or used to make cheese. Juan hopes to remain healthy so that he can continue working and be an example to his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Ines es madre soltera y vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su madre La casa tiene luz y agua pero carece de estabilidad de suelo, además falta una de las paredes que da a un río que esta cerca Ines se gana la vida vendiendo salchipapas (salchichas con papas), se levanta temprano para cocinar y esta expuesta a quemaduras por el uso de aceite Ines no esta cómoda en su domicilio por lo que necesita un préstamo para construir una habitacion en el terreno donde esta la casa de su madre, Ines hara todo lo posible para que la habitación este lo más alejada del río. Ines es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y espera recibir su ayuda
texts.en:
Ines is a single mother and lives with her parents in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to her mother. The house has light and water but the floor lacks stability. Additionally, it is lacking one of the walls that overlooks a nearby river.  Ines earns a living selling salchipapas (hot dogs with french fries). She gets up early to cook and is exposed to burns by the use of oil.

Ines isn't comfortable in her home, therefore she needs a loan to construct a room on the land where her mother's house is. Ines will do everything possible so that the room is further from the river. Ines is the only source of income in her home but she enjoys good health and hopes to receive your help.

loans.use: to construct a room on the land where her mother's house is.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 11 años a la venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayores y cal para seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, and lives in her own house with her spouse and their two children. She has worked for 11 years selling tortillas. She runs this business from her house, and has many customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale maize and lime, to continue with her sales and to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy wholesale maize and lime.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 31 years old, married, and has one child. She resides in Ormoc City, Leyte where she operates a sari-sari (variety) store, which she has been doing for four years. She sells basic merchandise such as sugar, powdered milk, eggs, soft drinks, cooking oil, matches, and canned goods. Her husband earns a living by farming.

Jocelyn requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks such as soap, beverages, canned goods, and soft drinks. With the improved stock she will be able to attract more consumers to shop and purchase, resulting in a higher income. Jocelyn hopes she can manage her current business so she can support the needs of her growing child.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as soap, beverages, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Yavet

texts.en:
Yavet is a 56-year-old man who is married to Adriana, a 46-year-old woman. They are blessed with four daughters and a son. Darmiyati, 26, is married; Wati, 24, just graduated with a Bachelor's degree; Emiliana, 22, is married; Febi, 19, in the first semester at a local university; and the last is Robinson, 13, a second year student of junior high school. 

Yavet works as a civil servant at a sub-district office. Yavet always considers that the education of his children must become the top priority. He has completed his first loan cycle to TLM for paying Wati's education fees. So he recently submitted a second individual loan aplication to TLM of IDR 15,000,000 for Febi's education fees, and also other college fees and requirements.

loans.use: to pay the education fees of his children

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 23-year-old married woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cristina has a seaweed business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years.  She has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy farm supplies for her seaweed business.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed business

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 27-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cristita has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 2 years. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Elenita is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for her business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Nancy has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years.  She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Ma. Nancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 41-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marissa has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years.  She has requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Marilou is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle for her vehicle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marlyn is 35 years old, and has six children who are currently in school.

Marlyn has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Marlyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Enma Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es madre soltera, ella tiene 3 hijos de  3, 5 y 10 años de edad, los dos mayores están estudiando, Mercedes se dedica a la trabajar en una planta florícola y también cría ganado, Mercedes necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca ya que dice que es asi como se apoya en todos los gastos que tiene que hacer de sus 3 hijos y aspira seguir trabajando por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mercedes is a single mother. She has three children, 3, 5 and 10 years old. The two eldest are studying. Mercedes makes a living working in a floriculture factory and also raises cattle. Mercedes needs the loan to buy a cow. She says this is how she supports all of the expenses she has that her three children make. She aspires to continue working for the wellbeing of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rosa Digna

texts.es:
Rosa, de 33 años de edad, está acompañada, su compañero de vida es empleado, ella estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, tiene dos hijos, los dos están estudiando en la escuela del cantón.- Rosa, ya tiene más de 5 años de tener la tienda en su casa y los fines de semana vende comida típica como yuca, tostadas, pastelitos y más, el crédito es para cancelar otro crédito en otra institución, que ocupo para ampliar su negocio.

Rosa, sueña con hacer una tienda más grande y poder darle el estudio a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old, and her spouse is employed. She was in school only until 6th grade. She has 2 children, both of whom are studying in the local school. 

Rosa has had the store in her house for more than 5 years, and on weekends she sells typical food of the region, like yuca, toasts, small cakes, and more. This loan is to pay off another loan from another institution, which she took out in order to expand her business. 

Rosa dreams of having a bigger store, and of being able to help her children stay in school to become professionals.

loans.use: to pay off another loan from another institution, which she took out to expand her business.

loans.name: Dedina

texts.en:
Dedina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dedina is 49 years old, and two children are currently in school.

Dedina has a general store business in the Philippines. Dedina requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Dedina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Dedina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Uber Javier

texts.es: Javier es un joven de 29 años de edad, el trabaja de albañil y también trabaja al jornal de  trabajos de agricultura, el esta casado y comenta que en la actualidad su esposa esta operada de una un problema que tuvo en la garganta, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos pequeñitos, criarlos y después venderlos a buen precio para que le quede ganancias, Javier aspira seguir adelante en su  negocio y  que su esposa se recupere pronto.
texts.en: Javier is a young man of 29. He works as a mason and also as a day laborer on agricultural jobs. He is married and comments that currently, his wife is operated on from a problem that she had in her throat. He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of small chickens, raise them and later sell them at a good price so that he's left with profits. Javier aspires to get ahead in his business and that his wife recovers quickly.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Edith Carmita

texts.es: Carmita es una señora muy tranquila, esta casada y sus 4 hijos tienen  2, 7, 15 y 18 años mismos de los cuales los 3 mayores asisten a un centro educativo, el esposos de Carmita se dedica a trabajar al jornal y a sembrar pequeñas huertas de papas, Carmita se dedica a tejer sacos de lana y a la crianza de animales, este credito lo va a invertir en la compra de vaconas, ya que dice que es por medio de este negocio que logra apoyar económicamente en los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo en los gastos de educación de sus hijos que ya que son 3 hijos que estudian y gastan bastante.
texts.en: Carmita is a very peaceful person. She is married and her four children are 2, 7, 15 and 18. The three eldest of them go to an education center. Carmita's husband works as a day laborer and planting small patches of potatoes. Carmita works stitching wool sacks and raising animals. She's going to invest this loan in the purchase of cattle. She says that it's by way of this business that she achieves economically supporting the expenses of her home and, above all, in the educational expenses of her children since there are three children that study and they spend significantly.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Ren is 52 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, Ren has been farming rice for 34 years. The current business earns her about US $11 per day, but she can manage to save about US $3 each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Ren with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee. She hopes that her daughter will have a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Sreyneang lives in a rural area of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is 26 years old and married with two children. She has been made a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR (Combodian riels) per day.

Sreyneang has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. She completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn crops from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Fia

texts.en:
Fia is a 64-year-old married woman with 5 children. 

She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living and has 3 years of experience with this business.  Fia needs a loan to buy oil, bags of flour, baking powder, tongs, containers etc.

She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees and to support her family financially. 

Fia has been a member of SPBD since November this year.

loans.use: to buy oil, bags of flour, baking powder, tongs, containers etc

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 38 years old and married with four children.

Nenita earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old and married with nine children.  With six children in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc.  She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Austeria

texts.en:
Austeria is 58 years old, married and has eleven children, two of whom are in school. 

Austeria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines, and has been raising pigs for 5 years. She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Austeria has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Austeria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdurrahman is a single 23-year-old man from Baniswef. His father is on pension and his mother is a housewife. Abdurrahman has 7 siblings, all living in the same house. Two years ago, Abdurrahman started a cattle fattening project to help his father in the family income and get ready for marriage. He requested a 6000 EPG loan from TADE to start his fattening project and he successfully repaid it on due date. Abdurrahman now dreams of expanding his business by fattening more cattle as he now has the enough experience to run the project successfully and develop it.
Abdurrahman requested a 10000 EPG loan to buy two head of cattle to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle expand his business.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juvelyn has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 12 years.  She has requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, gasoline, wood, etc. for her business.

In the future, Juvelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing nets, fish containers, gasoline, wood, etc. for her business

loans.name: Charan's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Charan is a 25-year-old married father of one kid. To support his family, Charan farms rice while his wife earns additional income by raising pigs. Together, they can earn about 47,000 KHR per day. Drought is the main challenge for his business. 

Charan’s group has been with VisionFund for one cycle. He successfully paid back the previous loan. Now he is leading his group to seek a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for supporting his farmland. He hopes to make more income from his current business so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for supporting his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Ellen works very hard to provide for them.

Ellen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like vinegar, salt, sugar, coffee, soft-drinks, milk, shampoo, etc. to sell. Ellen has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, salt, sugar, coffee, soft-drinks, milk, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like vinegar, salt, sugar, coffee, soft-drinks, milk, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 29 year-old man who lives in Baniswef, Egypt. He is married to a housewife and has two elementary school children. Their only source of income is a barber's shop business Mohamad started 8 years ago. However, his project is very small and doesn't have enough supplies and tools. The lack of supplies alienated his customers and consequently his income decreased. Mohamad needs a 5000 EPG loan to buy new supplies such as a new barber's chair, hairdryer and some lotions and creams, to develop his project and increase the family income.

loans.use: To buy new supplies such as a new barber's chair, hairdryer and some lotions and creams, to develop his project and increase the family income

loans.name: Erkingul

texts.ru: Эркингул, 55 лет, замужем, есть сын. У Эркингул высшее образование, работает в лицее преподавателем физики и астрономии, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей и коллег. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Эркингул в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 30 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. В хозяйстве есть земельный надел мерою 8,0 ГА, где она выращивает ячмень для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 1 бычок и 8 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Эркингул, ее деятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эркингул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров и 2 бычков. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем купит корм для скота.
texts.en: Erkingul is 55, married, and has a son.  She has a university education and works at a secondary school as a physics and astronomy teacher.  Her neighbors and coworkers have good opinions of her, and say that she is a kind, hardworking woman.  To earn some extra money for her family, Erkingul has farmed crops and livestock for the past 30 years, and currently has one cow, one bull calf and eight sheep on her farm as well as 8.0 hectares of land for growing barley as a cash crop.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her business brings in around 12,000 som per month, which is fundamental in paying for her family's food and other daily necessities.  To further develop her business, Erkingul has requested a loan of 150,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy two dairy cows and bull calves each.  She plans on using her extra income due to the loan to further expand her business as well as eventually buy feed for her animals.

loans.use: buy two dairy cows and two bull calves to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Vanny is 55 years old and married.  She has 6 children, two of whom are dependents and still in school.  

To support the family, she and her husband have been in farming business. The current business earns her family about 46,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Vanny has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and to pay for her children’s education. Now, she is asking for a loan to pay for fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.  

She hopes to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 6 years now.  Evangeline works hard to support her family.

Evangeline has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and supplies for her business.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and supplies for her fishing business

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Morn is a 42-year-old married mother of six children who are dependent on her and still in school.  

Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years.  Together, they can earn about 30,000KHR per day to meet family’s needs and manage to save about 20,000KHR each day for the future needs.

Morn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Morn is going to use her loan portion to pay for harvesting rice and use a portion of it to pay for labor. 

With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district in Battambang province.  She is 34-year-old and married with three children. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice for 15 years.  The current business earns her about 34,000KHR per day. 

Sophea has been with VisionFund for 4 cycles and has completely paid back the past loans.  Now, she is going to use her portion of this group loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Run's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Moung Russey district in Battambang province, Ron is a 52 years old married mother of 6 children. 

To make a living, she has been farming rice for 30 years.  The current business earns her about 50,000KHR per day. 

Ron is just with VisionFund for this cycle.  She is leading her group of two to ask for a loan.  As the leader, Ron wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to grow her rice quickly so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a widow and has 2 children who are grown and married. 

He knew this would be his last opportunity to get back on his feet after his first business went bad.  PMPC came to Florencio's rescue by lending him money when he needed it badly.  Florencio was grateful for this much needed capital from PMPC in 2010.  

Now, he has requested another loan for this quarter's crops.  He will use his loan to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides to maximize his farm production and enable him to generate more income. 

Florencio perseveres and has faith he will reach his goal to abundantly provide for his own needs, as well as for those of this family.

loans.use: to pay for bags of fertilizer and herbicides to maximize his farm production and enable him to generate more income

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Fifty year old Jocelyn is a resident of Ormoc City, Leyte.  She raises and sells hogs for a living. She is a widow with three children ages 17, 11 and 6 years old respectively.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional pigs, pig feed and vitamins.  With this loan, Jocelyn will raises and sell healthier pigs.   Aside from that, she could possibly roll her capital into other business ventures that could help improve her livelihood.  This could also help her finance the schooling all her three children.

Jocelyn hopes that someday, she will grow her hog raising business to successfully provide for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara is a 28-year-old single teacher who teaches at a public primary school. She lives with her parents in Pursat province in Cambodia. She is also studying banking and finance in her second year at a university. For her present job, she has been a teacher since 2009, earning $4.50 per day. Due to a lack of finances, Sara would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees for three years. This loan will help her graduate and provide her with a skill. After graduation, she is going to find another job with better salary to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Sort's Group

texts.en:
Sot is 43 years old and married.  She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  She has three dependent children to take care of and they are in school. 

Rice farming is the only source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 22 years.  Sometimes, she farms for others for a fee.   With the current business, she can earn approximately 20,000KHR per day and save about 10,000KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is the first micro loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Leading her group to apply for a loan, Sot will use her portion to buy rice seed for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is from Pagadian.  She is 65 years old, married to a farmer and they have had five children.  

Farming is the main source of their income.  As a farmer, Trinidad always worked hard plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and doing any agricultural work that would sufficiently provide for her family.  

Trinidad landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC.   Now, she has taken a loan of PHP9,000 to purchase fertilizer and herbicides to increase crop yield on her rice farm.  This will help boost her farming income.

She is always looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides to increase crop yield on her rice farm
